review_body: The location is very central. Very short walking distance to several metro lines. There are lots of restaurants around. The rooms are a little small; however, the space is used efficiently. Our room has a very nice minimalistic decoration that we enjoyed to spend time in the room. The rooms were very clean, i especially loved the bathroom and the wc which was a technologic piece of art. The rooms were better than many 5 star hotels. The only missing thing is the room service. We’ve booked 3 rooms, it was good gesture of the front desk staff that he accepted early check in even if the hotel was fully booked.Thank you very much for the service once again.

This hotel has a great location in Ginza and was incredibly well priced. Right next to the metro and easy to walk to a lot of attractions. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet and stocked with everything you could need.

A nice modern and well maintained four start hotel just in middle Ginza and direct access to the subway. Comfortable rooms, with wonderful beds, in size somewhat bigger than similar hotels in the area. All rooms seem nice, although would prefer the ones with bath, which makes the general bathing area a bit larger.No downsides at all, being the staff very professional, attentive and efficient anytime.

Stayed here for two nights in late December 2019. Check in was efficient and staff spoke good levels of English. The room was new and modern and more spacious than expected. There was a sofa and coffee table and also a desk for working on. The bed was quite comfortable. The hotel is very conveniently located. Diagonally across the road from Mitsukoshi. 5-10 minutes walk to central Ginza and 10 minutes walk to Tsukiji outer market (still much more fun than Toyosu by the way). If you are into sake there is a Dassai store with sake tasting right next door. The airport limousine bus does not stop at this hotel but it is a short taxi ride from the hotel to Tokyo station for the Narita Express. My room faced walls and did not have much natural light. However I did not stay in the room during the day much anyway.

The room we had was bigger than other hotel rooms of the same location and price rangeClean and all necessary in room amenities available.Bed on the soft side for me. Linen soft and comfortable.Strong shower pressure. Excellent location for metro, eating and shopping. Walked once to Asakusa and took 90mins with interesting sights along the way. Plenty of cafes, high end restaurants and convenience stores in the vicinity.Not so good - very poor in room WiFi connection; lobby sofas always taken up by people who sit there for hours (maybe they are checked out guests or to be checked in guests?) Otherwise we had a wonderful stay!Anna

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Took cab from airport, cost around ¥8500. We arrived almost 11pm. We walked around to find something to 3. The good thing was located at ginza area. There were places opened till late. We stayed at smoking room. Hotel provide air purifier, which most of hotel in Japan did. Good location the room was rather small. But the location paid it off. Only 300m to higashi station. If you want to go ginza station, just go underground, around 600m walk. Very convenient. From hotel to Tokyo station, only ¥740. Very near and morning, easy to find taxi.

There is no more conveniently located hotel for tourists in the Ginza area. It is very busy and bustling. The front-desk staff fall over themselves to help and advise. Excellent buffet breakfast. Next to all the main dept. stores and in walking distance of all the main shopping area. Also to the Kabuki theatre. There is an elevator outside the main entrance straight down to two main lines on the metro/subway system.

I stayed at Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo from 11/28-12/3. I was very satisfied with everything about this hotel. The room was small but very clean. The bathroom was nice. Great location (between Ginza Station and Higashi Ginza Station). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping staff were also great. As for airport transportation, I took the Limousine Bus from Narita and got off at Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel (approx. 3~4 min walk to Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel). Also took the Limousine Bus from Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza to Haneda Airport. Very convenient.

This hotel is in an upscale area, close to the subway line and only about 10 steps from the closest subway stop. Excellent service at the hotel, front desk clerks speak English, signs in English. Room is small by North American standards but very functional and very clean...no complaints.

Our flight from LAX to Tokyo got cancelled on October 12th due to typhoon Hagadis and we were unable to get on another flight until several days later. I tried several times that same day to call both the hotel directly and the Agoda booking service to cancel our reservation but the phones were down, my calls would not connect through. After returning to the US I again called Agoda and got nowhere. No consideration for our circumstances. I was told we were a no show and were charged the full amount for the 2 nights we had booked. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

Sun City, Arizona

review_body: We stayed here for 7 nights. Great location with a reasonable price. No Gym or pool but overall a good hotel to stay in. The staff are very nice and friendly and the rooms are very clean. Our view was a bit weird because it was next to another building with a direct view to our room so not so much of a privacy. Everything else was good.

Nice modern hotel with bright large lobby area. Check-in was ok and we were presented with all the room upgrades with their respective additional costs. We did upgrade to a corner room which was large and comfortable. For a Japanese hotel the bathroom was also quite large with an almost full sized bath. No real bar and not that many in the immediate vicinity of the hotel that we could see. We didn't have breakfast which we hadn't booked and the receptionist talked us out of taking it. There are lots of decent bakers and coffee bars near the hotel. Thanks to Trip Advisor we had seen that the wifi was a problem so requested a router for the room at check in which was provided and set up for us and it worked fine. It was just as well as there was no hotel wifi network visible in the room on our devices so the router was definitely needed. Ask for one!

We stayed for 5 nights at the Millennium Mitsui hotel and were very happy with it. Rooms were reasonable, nice bathrooms, great breakfast included. The staff were all very friendly and no language barrier. The hotel was in a great location with 2 metro stations really close that allowed you to get pretty much wherever you needed to go. Very close to heaps of shopping (albeit high end shops) and plenty of restaurants. Definitely recommend this hotel

This hotel had it all. Clean, spacious and quiet rooms, delicious breakfast buffet and just a few blocks from Ginza shopping district. There’s also a subway stop right outside the front door. The staff is very helpful and willing to provide restaurant recommendations or help with directions. The lobby and common area artwork is an added bonus.

We tried this hotel beacuse it is just beside the Ginza shopping street but I was not happy with the service and the size of the rooms. Considering that this is a tourist area, it was very hard to communicate with the reception people. The rooms are absolutely tiny. So when you shop, there is no space to put your things around your room. The restaurant serves the same food every morning and it can get packed.

Stayed here because of the location and couldnt be wrong about the location. Two subway line just in front of the hotel if you want go away from ginza district and very close to main ginza attraction. Mall and boutique just walking distance from your hotel. Check in process was fast and efficient. Staff can speak english and mandarin. Room are good enough size for japanese std around 22m. Decent size bathroom too. Overall stay here was nice and would love to stay here again

Check in was pretty standard and what you would expect from 4-5* property. Staff were friendly, attentive, and professional. We had the base room category and while some people complain about the wall view you get from the window, it didn't bother us that much as we didn't spend much time in the room other than to sleep (of course a view would've been nice, but it didn't take away anything from our experience). The room was clean and I found the mattress hard (which I prefer) and slept quite comfortably. The room layout was a little bit strange in that you don't have a fully enclosed bathroom. ex. there's a stall for the toilet and another stall for the shower, and your sink is next to the closet. I think the open concept is just to maximize space? The wifi was also very bad. We couldn't connect to it and when we could, it was very slow and the connection would die again. I think it's an issue they're working on and they placed an additional router in our room that helped with the issue. We booked this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of our trip, left for a week, and returned here for our last night in Tokyo before going back home. We left a piece of luggage in storage and when we returned, they had it already placed in the room for us and the additional router for our wifi connection. These were small details, but was very much appreciated as these details make guests feel like they're cared for. Overall, the staff were very nice and professional, the room was clean, and the location was great. Obviously we liked it enough to return to for our last night in Tokyo and we would recommend it to other as well!

We stayed here for the first time. Very small room, window looks out to a wall. Price was pretty high for what you get, but it is clean and neat. It does have a elevator right out front to the subway.The breakfast was way over priced, restaurant is located down staircase from lobby and not much of a buffet.

I don't often review hotels but for this instance I felt that it is necessary. Let's start with the basis first. I paid full price for this hotel booking with chase concierge service. I was debating between this and intercontinental (which I often stay at for work), so this time I decided to try something new and I really regret it. Let's start with the pros and cons.Pro:Room are clean, comfortable and the renovation is new.Air purifier with humidifying fiction is provided. (This seem pretty standard in Japan actually)Bathroom and shower is cleanLocation is great, it is right next to the Ginza subway stationCon:1) WiFi is slow. By slow I don't mean I can't load up my streaming app kind of slow, I mean I can't open websites kind of slow. In all my years in Japan, I have never seen wifi this slow, 711 has faster internet than this hotel. And I do mean that in a literal sense since 711 provide free Wi-Fi2) I was placed in the top floor of this hotel, so I was thinking to myself, oh great.. I'll get a view... But nope I was wrong! My view from the room is a wall!!!! I'm not kidding, I look outside the window it is a wall. So the front desk person told me that the standard room that I booked are all facing walls. I was like WTF, I was never told that in any listing or anyone that I was spoken to. I learned in the past to never take garden view rooms, so I know for a fact this did not come up because I pay attention to these things. After I told the front desk about that, he was like you should have picked the superior room and it cost more. So I told him, I wasn't even given this option when I booked, if I knew I wouldn't have booked this room or this hotel at all. After that he proceed to tell me that the hotel is full but he can upgrade me to the superior room tomorrow free of charge. so I came back the next day, I was talking to the lady at front desk about this. At the end she was telling me the same story on how it cost more and I told her that the guy I spoke to the night before said it would be free. At this point she talked to her manager, who came out speaking in Japanese to her, after that she just said the rooms are full. I would say that's pretty low for them to lie like that. Honestly I didn't think it was a big deal, I have stayed in intercontinental/Marriott many times and they always upgrade me for free without any issues. Since it doesn't cost the hotel anymore money to switch an unhappy guest to another room, I don't see why they wouldn't do it because you now risk losing future business. Anyway with that said the price I paid for this hotel was the same as intercontinental/Marriott so I really regret staying at millennium instead of other hotels. I'm checking out tomorrow, let's see how that experience go, I'll update if anything changes.

Super friendly staff! Hotel room was small by American standards but normal for Japan. Room was super clean, well decorated and hotel is centrally located. The subway is right in front which was amazing!!

Good hotel, central position, room very little not suitable if has to work. Good breakfastClean, staff very kind.Nothing to complain except the dimension of room.. offer a lot of completare things comb theft brush...

This hotel is centrally located at the core of the Ginza district. Minimalist in style, yet with every amenity you need. The staff speaks very good English and provided excellent service. The only drawback is that the bar is really just the basement breakfast room with little bar ambience. But who needs that anyway when in the middle of the vibrant Ginza.

First of all, it's so good to have Japanese who can communicate in English. They all are very friendly and helpful, but communication would be a frustration when English doesn't work.Very good location: it's located on the main street in the district, surrounded by all the shopping malls which are open start 11:00.Quiet morning without a crowd: There are some good cafe to have breakfast. And not bad at all to take a morning stroll in the quartier. Street is quite clean, display of the magasins are nicely designed. So window shopping could be a feast to eyes.Hotel itself: Everything in Tokoy is so small compared with their counterparts in China. So, for me it's still a little narrow. But in Tokoy, it's not 'really' small. But room is neat. The capsule coffe is even better than the cafes'. Bulgari shampoo, condition and other toiletry items are comfortable to use and smell not bad. My aunt likes their air cleaner coz it's totally silent which doen't disrupt a light sleeper.Pillow is soft ans sheets are also soft. Nice to lie in the bed. Bed itself is soft but not that soft, so I like it a lot. But for ones who like really really soft ones may need another thought. Ok. For me, it's a good sejour.Leave me a message if you need me to answer your questions.

The hotel is perfectly located in Ginza, close to restaurants, shops and the Yuracucho station.The room was nice but I wish it had more storage place and a better view. However, it was very clean, it had lots of amenities and it was very comfortable and quiet (which is basically what we look for).I recommend this hotel.

The location of the hotel is a key feature - access to public transport and plentiful eating options. Hotel staff are exceptionally friendly and most helpful. We stayed on two separate occasions, with different room configurations - with and without a bath. The room without a bath (shower room) offers more space in the bedroom area and is recommended. A recommended breakfast option, rather than the Breakfast Buffet, is "Pronto" cafe on the nearby intersection. An outstanding customer experience.

Overall a good hotel to stay in. The bathroom is clean and they make your room every day, with fresh towels every day. However, the hotel has very bad internet to no internet connection. Outside the hotel is on going construction work that works throughout the night from 10pm onwards to morning. Its terrible. Wouldn't recommend styaing here for the next year or so. But great location when construction outside is over.

I stayed here for four nights for work in July. The location is convenient: you have the Kabuki theater (Kabukiza) less than a block away, one block from the Wako tower in Ginza, access to the major metros (Asakusa, Ginza, Hibiya, etc) right outside the hotel. Very idea for travelers who need access to all major Metro line as the hotel is in the heart of Ginza. Service was amazing, The staff were very professional and courteous, Breakfast selection was amazing. Some may feel the room is too small, but I felt it was just right: no nonsense and no frills, just everything you need for your stay. I would definitely stay here again for the service, location and cleanliness.

Great location, less than 10 mins walk from Hakata Station. Brand new hotel, opened on 26 June, 2019, and rooms are well equipped. There are many restaurants and bars nearby, and it is diagonally opposite Canal City. Rooms are big for Japanese hotels, and the facilities are great. There are Nespresso machines with 4 pods per day in the rooms, and there is free bottled water available too. Nothing was too much trouble for the front desk staff, and they gladly changed my room to a higher floor.There is also a big bath on the top floor of the hotel that is pretty nice.

Currently staying in the this hotel for the 6th night now (stayed here last week for 4 nights and now back again). When we returned to the hotel from our trip to Kyoto, we were given a smoking room. As non smokers we weren’t too happy for this and requested for a non smoking room. The guy at the reception [-] was super rude and commercial - the only way he would entertain our request was if we paid another 15000 yen per night and moved to a twin room. We declined saying that we had already paid 300 dollars per night per room and this was way too much and all were requesting was to change from a smoking room to a non smoking room. He declined and disregarded the fact that we had stayed in the hotel for so many days. When I asked for the manger I was told he doesn’t come on weekends!! Pathetic hotel, service and this guy [-] was just too impolite.

We stayed 4 nights....the room are very clean...reception staff are going all the way to help..even walking to a restaurant to make our booking..buffet breakfast is nice and staff very effective..location is great...

Our experience here was top notch — front desk has been immensely helpful with everything from directions, loaning is umbrellas, dinner reservations, and laundry service. The room was actually bigger than we expected and the amenities quite lovely — complimentary water, slippers, electric kettle and teas, toiletries, and pajamas. Location is highly convenient!

Fabulous location in Ginza, helpful staff, always taxi's outside, very clean room with excellent shower. Exactly what we needed upon arriving in Tokyo. It was a very busy hotel at peak checkout times but the staff were highly efficient. Didn't eat at restaurant or have breakfast, as many places nearby. Altogether an excellent stay.

Only 2 issues:Free TV channels are extremely limited for English (CNN International only), and you can’t attach any sort of media device to it. Not an Amazon Firestick, Chromecast or even flash drive or external drive. Seems like the hotel would really like to push their pay-per-view for entertainment.Wi-Fi constantly drops. This came as a huge surprise to me, as Japanese hotels, especially in Tokyo, usually have extremely fast and reliable internet and WiFi. This wasn’t so much of an issue for me as I had good mobile data, but do take note if you rely heavily on WiFi. Otherwise, this hotel is excellent. The rooms are spacious compared to most hotels in the heart of Tokyo. Staff is very friendly and reliable and they employ many different nationalities, so communication is quite easy. Take note too, that housekeeping stops all service after 2PM, so make sure you’ve gotten your room tidied up prior or you’ll have to wait till the following day for a freshened up room.Ginza is just a minute away, there are trains stations to the various lines that are also very close.

For a start, there is this Mitsui Garden, and another one down the road with "Premier". We got mixed up and visited both, so that you won't make the same silly mistake as us. But it is a cozy hotel to stay in. Location is superbly convenient with Higashi-Ginza (East Ginza) station just right smack in front of the hotel, and Ginza station is like....5 mins walk away. Hibiya station (if you enjoy walking) is also not very far, probably another 15 mins walk.Food, convenience stores, shopping, are massively abundant in the vicinity. But...so many small lanes around you may get lost if you are not good with navigating. Try travelling with GPS.Staff is friendly, can understand English, but converse slow. It was acceptable. Rooms are smaller than expectation, but the pillows are very comfortable. Honestly. So comfortable we were contemplating of buying some back only to find that we may not fit them in our luggage during the last day and gave up the idea.... :DProximity of the buildings are rather close and practically no view from the window unless you enjoy saying hi to the fella at the window in the next building. We had our curtains drawn throughout the entire stay. We had to.Breakfast though is not that sufficient. Simple spread at the basement lounge, you can find the basic options there and that's about it. Staff is friendly, but there is this area that covers about 3-4 tables that catches the morning Sun...so hot, it's like dining in the greenhouse. And perhaps we were a little bit too sensitive but we couldn't help but felt that western and local guests got a wee bit more attention than us.After two mornings of trying out the breakfast, we skipped them entirely. There are a lot more better food options around the area than dining with perspiration while didn't feel welcomed...Upon checking out, the front desk was apparently understaffed but we still caught the attention of a female staff who went all the way out to the main road to get us a taxi. Where are the concierge or porter? For a moment we thought we were staying in a budget hotel.... ha...But a big thank you going out to the hardworking female front desk who checked us out and making sure we understood every single details on the bill, assuring us that she will return, and jog back to us with the taxi and made sure the driver understood where we were to go to. We regretted not getting her name.... Thank you.Overall, it is a hotel with great location amidst all the confusion and is still a good one to stay in nevertheless.PS. not sure when it will complete, there is construction of something right in front of the hotel. But noise level and hindrance to traffic is being kept to the lowest.

This is a great location in Ginza but we were disappointed with the hotel in general. We expected more for the price we paid. The rooms are looking tired with signs of wear and cobwebs and the breakfast was overpriced for the food on offer and the restaurant staff were sullen. Reception always seemed to be full of people and cases. It didn't feel like value for money but that is often the problem in a big city. We wouldn't stay again.

Stayed here for 2 nights. We caught the limousine bus from Narita and walked a few minutes to the hotel. Perfect location in Ginza close to loads of eating places and shops. Metro station just round the corner. 10 minute taxi ride to Tokyo station. Lovely friendly staff. Traveling with a friend we each had a superior room and agreed they were compact but well laid out. The shower worked well. As did the intuitive toilet. My room was quiet and I heard no noise on my room. The bed was firm but comfortable. The only con was the room was showing a bit of wear and tear. I would stay here again and recommend it to others

Stayed here for 2 nights on arrival from UK - chosen for the short walk from Tokyo station and good reviews here . Staff very helpful and spoke English - a real bonus to very tired tourists after a long flight. The hotel was easy to find , easy to walk to many cafes , restaurants and convenience stores , easy to walk to the metro and many sights - so just right for jet lagged , disorientated tourists. The room was clean and comfortable . A great start to our Japan adventure.

We stayed here for 6 nights. The location was excellent, two subway stops, many cafes, shops and restaurants. The staff were delightful - very friendly and helpful. The room was quiet, comfortable and had plenty of facilities. WI-FI was strong. The breakfasts were excellent, plenty of choice for both western and eastern palates. We would recommend this hotel.

This was our first stop in Japan.Room was a good size with enough space to keep our suitcases handy without tripping over them.Separate loo which opened its own seat when you opened the door and at night had a little light so you didn’t need to put a big light on - very handy for jet lagged people.Shower excellent and good sized space around basin area.Kettle and fridge and ice machine on that floor Didn’t eat any meals here so no comment.Subway station with elevator just 20 yards from hotel

The staff is helpfull. The room was a little small. But the bed and pillows were wonderfull. Good bathroom. Very good amenities. Very confortable pajama. There are several café style stores around for breakfast. The location is very good for dining out as there is a multiple choice of restaurants and bars.Very good shopping around also.

Good hotel in the beautiful central area. The metro station just behind the entrance (you may go directly from/to Narita aeroport form it). Room is nice, good bed, good design. Adapter and additiomal charge for any phone included. One big problem: internet is absolutly bed, especially in mornings and evenings when most guests are in the hotel.

I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. I was hoping for something nicer than a typical business hotel and this was definitely it. The rooms are small but well situated for two travelers. Our window view was horrible but the bathroom and amenities (and the quiet!) made us not care at all. The front desk was also wonderful about getting us dinner reservations and recommended our favorite meal of the trip.

New York City, New York

review_body: Decided to stay at this hotel because of its location and relatively new premises around Ginza. Location is the best as it is located right on to of one of the subway line. Meals are plenty around the corner. The staff is nice and helpful, a typical of Japan. All premises are clean. But the room is very tiny - although everything you need is in the room. And the hotel is very crowded so you've to gotta wait until 3 PM to get your room. Better book additional night if you happen to come early in the morning.

Seriously one of the BEST hotel I have ever stayed in. Best in terms of the design and layout of the room which is extremely well thought out and maximises the available space. Separate toilet, spacious shower, sink outside of the bathrooms so you dont need to go into the bathroom to fill water for kettle etc. Down to the hand wash pump instead of soap , to plastic cups for brushing teeth instead of glass (how many times have I thought Im going to break the glass early in the morning when Im half asleep still) Down to the lighting of the room. I have really appreciated the attention to detail. Other hotels, take lots of notes!!Also praise to the front desk who organised for an earlier checkin, we had travelled in total for more than 24 hours and really needed our room early to freshen up so then we could head out again soon after. Hotel close to trains, shops. Will DEFINITELY be coming back and recommending to family and friends. Thankyou Millenium Mitsui Garden Hotel!

One snag, apart from a small canteen area that works as breakfast, bar and restaurant combined there is virtually no where to be but your room. So if you check out and have time to kill before you fly home, or move on to your next location, then there is nothing much for you. Since Tokyo hotels do not approve of early or late check ins this is quite an issue for a business traveler. The TV in the room was also inoperable for a non Japanese speaker - which is nowadays unusual.

Stayed for the first time.Good modern rooms.Breakfast was good.No gymnasium. Centrally located. Very convenient for reaching any restaurant in Ginza.Due to Cherry blossom period, hotel was crowded & tariff was relatively high.

I had stayed at Mitsui Gardens Hotel in Sapporo quite a few years ago (a plesant stay) and indeed Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel did not disappoint! Millennium Mitsui is a clean hotel with crisps sheets everyday, even equipped with a humidifier by default (very thoughtful) . We stayed on 11/F, which gave us a more spacious view of the city. It is also at a very convenient location with subway Higashi-Ginza entrance right at your door steps, not to mention that you will be surrounded by all the eateries of your liking!Will definitely return again.

Upon arriving at Higashi Ginza station from Narita Airport, we were surprised that the elevator we alighted from was directly in front of this hotel. Our 5 day stay was pleasant due to the location, and exceptional service and comfort provided by a millennium hotel. Granted, the room was a tad small (expected of most Tokyo hotels), but we couldn’t fault anything else. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was well laid out with the ubiquitous Toto toilet.

Located in Ginza for prime shopping right out the door. As a result, many choices of bakeries, cafes, and restaurants to eat. For this reason, I did not eat at the restaurant of the hotel. I don’t like to eat I’m the basement haha.Subway stop is right outside the door. And while the hotel is on a busy street, one can sleep quietly.Clean and compact. The way the room is organized is highly logical so my stay was super comfortable.

Stayed at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel in Tokyo last week. Good quality hotel and nice size rooms. Great location and plenty of shops just around the corner. Next door is a Sake Bar which was quite interesting

Stayed at MMGHT for one night last week, in transit through Tokyo. The location is excellent, being close to Ginza shop, restaurants and Ginza Metro Station.The room was modern and clean. Beds were a good size, and the bathroom was well appointed - including a toilet seat that gave a welcome when the door is opened.A special shout out to the staff, in particular Ricca, who was fabulous in helping to call our favourite restaurant. Unfortunately our restaurant was booked out, but Ricca helped us to book s similar establishment, which was excellent.

This hotel is right next door to the famous Ginza shopping area. It was convenient for our Tokyo friends to meet us as the subway is just outside the hotel.Although rooms are small, beds are very comfortable , shower gives a strong spray. Space is so well planned that one literally walks into a bathroom (sink on one side) and shower room on the other . But the way that the rooms are expertly planned , more than makes up for the size . For eg : power points are on the table , warm toilet seat that auto opens, frothy handsoap, bath amenities , place to hang hand wash items. Love it ! Although we were on the 5th flr, the windows are well sealed and the traffic noise does not bother . We appreciated this more when one of the window latches was accidentally not secured , but the Hotel staff were quick to manage the situation.Altogether a good place to stay.

We stayed at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel for two nights in February. It is centrally located in Ginza, and you can easily walk to plenty of shops and restaurants. It is quite literally right behind the A1 exit at Higashi-Ginza station. The location of this hotel is impossible to beat. It took us less than 30 minutes to get here from Haneda Airport (one direct train using the Keikyu-Kuko Line). The hotel is quite modern, and the rooms are small but comfortable. The shower is surprisingly large for a room of that size and they make great use of every inch of the room. There was construction going on at the time to get ready for the Olympics, and there was some street noise early in the morning on our first night. However, this may likely be unavoidable almost anywhere in Tokyo leading up to the Olympics. Note that the Wi-Fi was quite spotty at times, but it wasn’t a big deal for us because we had picked up a pocket Wi-Fi at the aiport (we went with Ninja Wi-Fi, which is very close to the Keikyu-Kuko station at Haneda) . We really enjoyed our stay at the Millenium Mitsui Hotel and would definitely recommend for an easy to find, centrally located hotel in Ginza. If you are staying there, the Ginza Akebono is a short walk and has delicious mochi and other treats.

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The location is excellent . When you exit the higashi ginza station elevator on A1 , it opens to the entrance of the hotel . The hotel is a 2 minute walk to mitsukoshi department store and that shopping street in ginza . There’s a 2 store drug store across the hotel and our favorite reasonable steak place , ikinari. The hotel room is a decent size . The bathroom orientation is a bit weird . There is a separate toilet and shower but you’re expected to dress up in the room hallway so make sure you double lock the room door when you take a shower because if your room mate opens the door , you can be caught undressed

Although nondescript from the outside, the hotel itself is quite nice. The rooms are a good size. The room amenities include a clothes refresher...handy after eating at a yakiniku or teppan restaurant. The location of the hotel alone is ideal as it is close to stores and good restaurants.

I wanted to love this hotel as this is my second stay here; however, these 3 nights (which ran me nearly $1000 USD) have been extremely agitating. Like most people, I need WiFi for work, but our room just could not hold a connection. On the second night, I couldn't stand it anymore and called the front desk. Forty minutes (I missed my concall) and two routers later, it finally connected. Much to my dismay, it stopped working the following morning. I went out and rented a pocket WiFi just so I could work without losing my mind. I wasn't this infuriated until I was told that the hotel manager said that they can't do anything more about it. At this price point, this type of attitude and service is absolutely unacceptable. I won't be coming back.

compact but well designed with a generous supply of great amenities, this very modern hotel is located directly across the road from the up scale dept. store Mitsukoshi with the best basement food hall.

This new hotel is located right next to the main Ginza Street, near shopping, restaurants and transportation. The rooms are small, but typical size for Japanese hotels. The staff was very helpful, all spoke excellent English.

Decent hotel that located at Godanta, 5 mins walk to train station. Hotel employees are friendly and willing to help. The room is small but got everything you need in a trip. Big size people might think the room is too narrow, need to see if there are bigger rooms. Also there is hot spring in the roof, super relaxed after a long day walk in Tokyo city. Especially the price, we booked during a bargain. 14000 JPY/ night is very good.I’ll choose this hotel again next time.

Stayed for a few nights here, by my self, the room its big enough for me to open my suitcase and still have room to walk and mostly importantly it is clean.It's a perfect hotel for couple or business, however it might be too small for a family

I would say this hotel is at a very good location, the higashi-ginza station is right outside the door, and Ginza luxury shopping and great dinings are around it. The room is too small for our standard tho' BUT amenities are great. Overall, good value hotel.

Very Convenient The hotel is in great location, right off A1 exit of Keikyu/Asakusa Line from Haneda airport. This was the reason we’ve chosen it. We booked two double bed room (26 square meters). It was good size for two people. As we have been travelling to Japan often, we were aware of many hotels offer two separate beds even for couples. We did not have any issues with this. The beds were comfortable, room clean, shower room good size, the vanity area was a bit tight but not too bad. Breakfast decent. Western choice was a bit limited. While we were at 10 floor, we could still hear car noise at night. But it was not too bad. We recommend it for its location, value and good service.

First of all the location of the Millennium Mitsui Garden in Ginza cannot be beaten. Real estate is all about location and this location is prime. Easy access to the metro (higashi ginza station , H line for the airport, M Line etc.). You are at the epicenter of Ginza luxury shopping and great restaurants. You are also at a walking distance from my favorite place in Tokyo the old historic fish market. The hotel is new and really modern with great amenities. I love the design of the elevator banks that is really fast and efficient. We reserved a corner room that offers ample room but requires reservation well ahead of time. Our room was really functional and well designed offering the comfort of a five star hotel. We even had a air purifier and a small fridge with ample room. The room also contains one of my favorite: BULGARI Shampoo and Shower gel as well as Air Conditioner and body moisturizer a real treat! Easily comparable to the Four Seasons or the Ritz but at a much better value. Love these Toto Japanese toilet. Service was overall very good. We had a small incident where we felt that the receptionist was not really eager to help. On the other hand Rio May went out of her way to help us several times. The hotel was also very helpful in securing several Michelin starred restaurants. So we are very grateful for their helping hand. I would recommend the hotel to use a real bellman as there was no one helping when we arrived with our numerous luggage. Our departure was the opposite, our Ukrainian hostess ordered a taxi for us and provided a helping hand with our packages. We will be back thank you for your great hospitality!

Stayed 3 nights here while on visit to Tokyo. The staff were friendly and it’s at a good location. However, for family, the room is too small. Don’t think there’s room service either. For business, there is no gym facilities.

I have stayed here 2 times and both times have been satisfactory.The 1st stay I chose corner room which was bigger and nicer.The hotel was clean, startegically located in Ginza area. It's distance to Tsukiji is close enough for us to walk every morning for a delicious sushi breakfast.

Hotel location was superb, right on Ginza street, where all the buzz is. Well connected to rail stations, the hotel was comfortable and cozy, but we Indians would definitely not like to put up in such small rooms. No space at all around the bed to move around after lodging 2 pieces of luggage.Washbasin is outside the bathroom, i.e right in the passage that goes from the main door to the bed. Extremely inconvenient. No food served in room service. Reception staff was warm and cordial, toiletries, linen and other amenities all fine

This was our third stay at the hotel we love for location and room style. Unfortunately this time around we were greatly disappointed by the quality of the room given to a Member of their MGH Club. We have consistently booked the larger corner room, but this time around found ourselves in a much smaller configuration with inferior amenities in comparable to the past years. While it could have been an error on my part, I am always careful to be sure to get a room according to size and more so one that has bathrobes as part of the amenities. It was a disappointment to find myself in a room, without among many things the much needed robe. In fairness when I complained they kindly provided the robe.To its benefit the hotel is impeccable clean and service for the most part excellent. Location is iidea and perfect for our needs,I do not know if the hotel has changed his standards and amenities or I made a major over sight in my bookings. The experience has made me a bit less inclined to return next year and more open to exploring new locations

While we are only here for three days we have been very impressed by the location and amenities of the hotel. Room size adequate for two people. Up-to-Date for comfort. If I have one suggestion it is to ensure the one English speaking tv station not overplayed with Japanese translation. Again highly recommend for ease of location to shopping, underground and ease of walking to many places.

i stay couple of days in Tokyo for transit. I thought Ginza is a nice place for dining and shopping. However, I thought it would be the same as Sapporo that subway station and underground well connected. I was totally wrong. Turns out I need to carry my luggage ups and downs stairs from subway station to ground floor under the rain. I would choose another one which is near the station next time. Staff are not that nice as I expected. may be too many tourists and too many Chinese around. Sad

We stayed here for 3 nights. Arrived quite early but the staff let us check in at 2pm rather than the given time of 3pm. The room and lobby was very clean and staff are very helpful. Well located in the Ginza area. We didn't have the breakfast.

nice but small,and the lobby restroom kind of stinky,but the service quite good,i lost my power bank in my room,the keep trying to find it,thery respondsible very good,when you open the door,the first you see is the sink

The best thing about this hotel is the location. It’s in very close proximity to shopping, restaurants and the subway. I didn’t care for the food but luckily Denny’s is a five minute walk away. Compared to other hotels like Marriott and Mercury this place is reasonable priced. We paid a fluctuating rate of 200-250 USD. The staff speaks limited English but is still very helpful. I recommend booking a room with two beds. It’s the same price and slightly bigger. Our standard, king was like a closet. Awful. We were on the third floor in a smoking room and there were no windows in the room or on the floor ( had a dark gloomy feel). The tv plays one English Chanel for about ten minutes then back to Japanese. If I was on a budget, I would come back to this hotel. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. Pros: locationValue for money well-attentive staffsmoking roomsCurrency exchange ATM in lobby Small fridge in room Decent bath amenities Cons:Do not offer IRD Limited Chanel variety and English on the tvLimited options for dining, very traditional food ( I’m a picky eater) Small rooms

This hotel is at a great location for shopping in the Ginza area. You have a 2 minute walk to the famous Nissan corner. The rooms are larger than your average Tokyo hotel room. The bathroom was great with separate shower, toilet and sink areas. You could get breakfast included and it was good. They had a lot of buffet options and also had an espresso machine that could do mochas. The staff was helpful and spoke English.

I had two nights in this hotel for a business meetings in Tokyo. This hotel is just 10 steps to Ginza main center.I arrived on Sunday Morning and I found the main Ginza street closed to traffic and open only to walking for shopping full day. It was a fantastic experience.Ginza Subway station is just in front of the Hotel.The room was not so big as usual in Japan but very clean with a large window.Good breakfast and acceptable price.I will use it again.

San Zenone degli Ezzelini, Italy

review_body: The hotel is situated right in the heart of shopping areas. The room is clean and spacious. Service is excellent. The buffet breakfast is simple yet delicious. Only problem was the WiFi was almost not working throughout my stay.

Location absolutely perfect. Hotel room very small.However, extremely efficient with minimal space, especially with the cost of real estate in Tokyo Ginza. Metro is right out the door and a $12 USD cab ride to Tokyo Station if you have lots of luggage or packages. Otherwise, an easy 5-8 minute walk to Mitsukoshi and Matsuya Dept Stores. Behind the hotel and walking one block, you will find a couple of good coffee shops where you can have a light breakfast for $5-$10. Buffet breakfast at the hotel is standard fare @ $27 USD. Numerous restaurants can be found above department stores and smaller side streets. Hotel staff were friendly and welcomed me each time I returned from my shopping day.

The hotel is located in Ginza. It is convenient for all the attractions and shops in Ginza and is right next to the underground station. The rooms are rather compact and are always full. The breakfast is good and includes a cooked breakfast as well as typical Chinese and Japanese cuisine

Just on top of higashi ginza station and short walk to ginza station. Short walk to department stores, restaurants, and bars. Room is clean and comfortable despite being small (but typical in Tokyo). Staff is helpful with restaurant booking.

The Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel is in an excellent location for access to Ginza 6 Building, Trains, major shopping areas and the Apple store! Seldom did we need a taxi. Convenience store right next to hotel. Sushi Bar very close. Italian restaurant named Bernini is a two block walk when you tire of noodles and fish. The pizza and salads there are excellent. Thin crust. Great staff. Easy walk. Hotel rooms are small. No drawers at all for clothing BTW. Good for couples staying for a few days, but bad for kids and longer stays. Expensive breakfast Buffet as well, but it's Tokyo.

The Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel is a very conveniently located, stylishly designed boutique hotel in the heart of Ginza. With a station right at its doorstep, the high-end Mitsukoshi department store across the road and an array of cafes, restaurants and retail stores within walking distance, this luxe hotel is hard to beat.As with many of Tokyo's accomodation options, the rooms are compact. However, its design is more contemporary than many others in the city, and every spare area has been thoughtfully designed and beautifully appointed. The staff were always helpful, assisting with restaurant bookings and recommendations, as well as being fluent in English.

Caught train from Haneda right to hotel entrance,and back - couldn’t be easier. Other Ginza line just up the road. Well-located for sightseeing. Rooms “small, but perfectly formed”. Contains everything you could possibly need; empty mini-fridge for own supplies from Family Mart (bring teabags).Don’t expect lots of room but more than adequate. Highly recommended on quite a few levels and very good value for money. Really great breakfasts - really sorry we slept in and missed our last one!

This hotel is located in middle of Ginza super clean and pretty modern cool hotel. Almost didn’t want to leave the room because so cozy. If you’re staying in Ginza this swanky hotel is highly recommend.

The best thing about this hotel is the location, the subway below the hotel takes you to Haneda and Narita Airports (there a lift 10 meter from the hotel entrance) and another 3 minutes walk takes you to Ginza station which connects you with almost everything else in Tokyo.The room is rather small but excellently designed and everything is in the right place. Bathroom and toilets are immaculate and last but not least the staff are friendly and helpful. Special mention to Kazuma Uetsuhara who helped us in our travel arrangements.

We booked this hotel for our honeymoon.On arrival to check in, we were given a box of chocolates and a card which was very thoughtful of the staff. They put us on the 12th floor as we requested a high floor for the view.The room was absolutely immaculate and the view didn’t disappoint.All the necessities were provided; toothbrushes/combs etc. Shiseido products were used in the rooms and were replaced daily.2 bottles of water were also put in the fridge daily. I can not fault this hotel at all.You have to pay for your room on check in, but it means for a quick departure.Check in is 3pm and check out is 12pm.The location of the hotel is perfect.Ginza is considered the up market shopping area. All the designer brands are on this street. There is two metro lines directly outside the hotel which brings you to Shibuya, Harajuku.There is the Tjusiki fish market 10minute walk from the hotel.Also the street behind the hotel is known as ‘ramen street’ and has numerous ramen restaurants. A few are Michelin star and very affordable. I recommend Clam Soba! It is a very good restaurant.I would definitely stay in this hotel again.The only thing that is lacking is the bars in the area. The hotel bar closes at 10pm. There is one bar across the street called the iron fairies which is open until 4am but drinks are quite pricey.

The location of this hotel is excellent surrounded by hundreds of restaurants. What impressed me was the service at the reception. Our flight was cancelled due to the typhoon. I went to the reception for assistance and a lady by the name of Watanebe helped me to organise an airport hotel,booked the airport limousine and the shuttle bus from the airport hotel to Haneda airport. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants quality service and great location in Ginza.

centrally located in ginza, in front is the higashi ginza subway station, room very tight but spotless clean, functional, separate bathroom with bathtub and shower area, enclosed watercloset, sink is located outside the bathroom, courteous andhelpfull staff, english speaking also a plus, elevator is very quiet ,negative side is only 1 cnn english channel,i will recommend this hotel.

Hotel is lovely, reception staff are very helpful. It is in the Ginza district and close to designer stores. Rooms are very comfotable, I was pleasantly surprised at how well they were designed to give you everything you need in a small space but without feeling cramped. Would highly recommend.

Clean, quiet, well located at the door to a metro stop, Hotel room included a free travel pocket wifi, hot water kettle, mini fridge, hair dryer, device charging cables, etc. Outside are hundreds of dining and shopping choices. My only complaint, is I am allergic to down, and the 2 comfortable pillows on the bed are down, the synthetic pillows are like two bags of bricks  I haven't inquired yet if they have a replacement, but I will tonight.

We stayed here for two weeks in mid August. Family with two adults and two small kids plus a 12 year old. Took the largest corner room with three largish single beds which was more than enough for us. Room is well stocked and equipped with a nice bathroom. All the mod cons in terms of toiletries and a nice free mini bar of drinks including beer. Location is excellent in the middle of a Ginza. Staff really helpful and from a family perspective location and use of taxis is easy and not that expensive. Housekeeping took a while to educate as to our additional needs (extra water) but got there in the end. Breakfast is basic buffet. Could be improved with more choices of fruit and juices plus yoghurts however served us well and no major complaints. All in a all a great hotel for location and comfort. 37m2 floor area for 5 of is was more than enough to open all our suitcases and still breathe. Took many tours across Tokyo and Kamakura / Mount Fuji region which we arranged in advance with Viator. Would stay here again given location and comfort. No complaints and probably as good as it gets in this part of Tokyo!

We had a great experience. The room was small but perfectly functional and comfortable. The area is great, it’s the main shopping area so it is full of restaurants (not the cheapest in town). We had our breakfast at a cafe nearby which was very nice (now cafe). Pity most of the staff did not speak much English but, as we discovered later on in our trip, this is very common in Japan. If you stay here, go and visit the garden in the roof of ginzasix (a new department store)

This is a very nice hotel, especially for the reasonable prevailing nightly rates! It started our two week trip to Japan with perfect style and elegance. The location couldn't be better. The front door of the hotel is literally adjacent to the elevator doors coming from the Higashi-Ginza station. It is squarely in Ginza with excellent access to the famous shopping, restaurants, and an easy walk to Tsukiji market. The rooms were typically small Tokyo hotel rooms, but they were beautifully decorated, immaculately clean, and ultra modern. Our favorite was the toilet which opened, closed, and flushed automatically. Lots of fancy Shiseido products. Seemed like every drawer had more goodies including fancy pajamas. Our room had a view of the Kabuki theater and over the city. Service was excellent and most of the staff spoke some English. They also had the "Handy" smartphone, as many hotels in Japan now do, which was super helpful in saving data and other fees using my home phone. This hotel is a top choice for our future visits.

I took the family to Tokyo and we weren't disappointed by the location of the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel. It was in a great location right on top of the Higashi Ginza Station with two subway lines. it was also just a couple blocks from the biggest shopping street in Tokyo! The staff were also very helpful and accommodating.

Went there during our family trip for celebriting our grandmother 60th wedding anniversary.A typical city hotel. Good surrounding, food, supermarket, tsukuji. Everything is on a walking distance.Hope can go there again with my daughters next time

Clean rooms, great service and good location (and Shiseido products!). Ginza station is a 5-minute walk away, and Mitsukoshi department store (with its well-stocked food hall) is right across the street. Walking distance from all the big Ginza stores.

This hotel was a great find in an expensive city. Though we booked the lowest level double room (on the 2nd floor), the layout was exquisite, with no wasted space. Everything we needed was at our fingertips, both inside and outside. The location was superb for touring, shopping and eating. (Don't miss the food hall in the Tokyu Plaza!) We loved everything about this place and would stay here again on future trips.

Clean, comfortable and conveniently located outside a major metro line. Staff accomodated all requests and were able to communicate well in english. Would stay here again if I was staying in the Ginza neighborhood.

Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo sits right at the heart of Ginza. It’s most convenient getting to many tourist spots and great restaurants. We stayed in a deluxe twin room at the corner with windows on two sides. It’s quite spacious according to Tokyo standards. The room was nicely appointed with a free mini bar providing a free bottle of red wine, sake, beer and soft drinks each day. For the lady using the room, they provided a free supply of Mikimoto cosmetics. And they used Bulgari toiletries. Housekeeping made the room clean and tidy and ensured that toiletries and the mini bar were replenished each day. The response to service requests was in general fast. I would have given the hotel five stars if not because of the absence of a gym, and the service attitude of certain individual front desk staff. In the afternoon on 5 July we sought help from a female staff to book a tour to Mt. Fuji and Hakone the next day for our party of six. Giving the excuse of there being too many different options, she declined to make the call for us and asked us to call the tour company ourselves. If we knew Japanese we would not have asked for help. In the evening on the same day, three ladies were on duty at the front desk. We sought advice on transportation to Narita airport early in the morning on 7 July. As the earliest airport coach would leave a nearby hotel at 7:15 am, which was too late for us. As there were six of us with more than 10 bags, we asked what alternatives we had. We were told to take the underground, which actually was not a viable option at all. We asked about taxis and were told that they were too expensive. We weren’t told about how much it would be and we weren’t asked whether we were prepared to accept the high fare. We asked whether there were transportation companies providing transfer services to the airport and were told that there weren’t. All three ladies showed no concern at all to find a solution for us and were totally not helpful. All they cared about was to get rid of us. As we had to find a way to the airport, we approached the front desk again later that evening. A gentleman was on duty then. He was most helpful and immediately made a couple of calls and secured two seven-seaters from a transportation company for us to leave the hotel at 6:00 am on 7 July. We were of course happy to pay a total of ¥46,000 for the two cars. The ladies concerned were very untypical of the services we have encountered in Japan. We visit Japan quite often and are always impressed by the courteous and attentive services we receive wherever we go. It is difficult to build a reputation for oneself. But it takes only a couple of unpleasant incidents to ruin it.

Loved everything about this hotel. Staff, location and service. Train station is almost by the hotel’s doorstep. Near convenience stores and walking distance to Ginza boutiques :) Breakfast buffet is a bit pricey though and usually not included in the room package. Would love to go back!!!

We would definitely recommend this hotel to people visiting Tokyo. Helpful staff, clean room and an amazing toilet!!! We were near the top floor so nice and quiet however I would imagine that it could get noisy in the morning if you are on a lower floor. Ginza is a great place to stay and it is right next to the tube (asakusa line) so makes it easy to get around. We purchased a three day pass for about £10. It is only available for tourists to buy from the kiosk in the station - you do need your passport to buy the ticket.

Center of Ginza and connected to subway. Great location and the staff were very friendly and efficient. Upgraded our room to a wonderful suite. Will probably stay there when visiting Tokyo. Very close to Tokyo station so can travel to nearby sites easily. Good Japanese restaurants all around.

Mitsui Garden Hotel is a great option to stay in Tokyo, it is in a nice area not super close to anything but well connected to all you might one to visit. The staff is really friendly as it is always expected, and rooms are modern and with all you can ask for this price range.

This is a great hotel. what’s not to like? right in the centre of Ginza. Go out and turn right, you get the asakusa line a few steps away. Ginza line is also a few steps away. There’s no room service, but you don’t need it. You are in Tokyo. Ramen everywhere, Family Mart & Lawson everywhere. Detour coffee shops all over. Rooms are some of the bigger ones in Ginza, excellent location, super clean, and the service and staff every efficient. I like this one better than Premier. The other Mitsui at Ginza location has tiny triangle shaped bathroom.

I loved this hotel! You’re right above the metro so it’s easy to get around everywhere. The hotel is very clean and the staff goes above and beyond to help you with any needs or questions you have. I love that we were able to get here without needing a transfer from Haneda International Airport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo.

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the wonderful people that work here.From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were warmly welcomed with the staff taking the luggage from me and escorting me to check in. The room was wonderful and although small by international standards had enough room to move around. The bathroom was outstanding (you don't even have to touch the toilet, the seat opens and closes itself and auto flushes). The amenities are as you would expect with great coffee bags.We only had a couple of occasions to request anything and both times the staff were super efficient and nothing seemed to be trouble.Upon checkout we were literally escorted to the door and waved off, like you would family.I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Outstanding in every way and the team that works there are a credit to Mitsui.

I found the layout of the room a bit weird in the beginning. The basin / mirror was set out of the shower / toilet areas. Having experienced for 3 nights, I found such design actually give space/mobility for a couple to juggle in such limited room.2 bottles of drinking water, tea bags, dripped type coffee bags are provided everyday. Very nice indeed.One disadvantage > the in room WiFi was so poor, no connection no matter day or night. We claimed at the reception and she provided a router for in room use. Laptop was connected but not to the mobile phone.

The Millenium Mitsui Garden Hotel is one of the best business hotels in Tokyo. Located in Ginza right in between JR Yurakucho station and Tsukiji, it's just steps from Ginza main shopping streets. Tokyo station is a ten minute walk away.The hotel has an unusually generous lobby with quick, efficient, and helpful staff.Rooms are excellent. Not only are they (almost) brand new, but materials and fit-and finish are commendable. They're very clean with good beds and a full range of amenities. Bathrooms - split between toilet and bath/shower - are unusually large for a hotel of this category. Prices at this hotel fluctuate significantly. At anything below Y15,000 for a single room, this hotel offers a good value. Once rates exceed Y20,000, there may be better options elsewhere. Is this hotel perfect? No. Internet is too slow. And windows were rather dirty. If you are very susceptible to road noise, then there are better hotels out there.But otherwise, this hotel is very much recommended!

If you want to be right smack in the middle of ginza shopping, this hotel is perfect for you. The rooms are clean and modern. The breakfast was also delicious and extensive, but can get quite full at peak times in the morning. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting again soon.

Did a last minute booking at the Millennium Mitsui Garden the hotel during Christmas due to unexpected circumstances during our trip. The double room was full and was left with a slightly higher-priced twin room – and what a pleasant surprise it turned out to be! The biggest surprise (in a good way) was the size of the twin room – it was much larger that I had anticipated for a Tokyo room. There was more than sufficient space for 2 persons (2 super single beds) and space to lay our luggage down on the floor of the bed room. What was interesting in the design (and perhaps that was well thought out) was that the wash basin was located outside of the main bathroom. I believe this freed up a bit of space which would otherwise have been taken up by an overall larger bathroom. Well done!Apart from the room, the hotel was also located right in the heart of Ginza. That means: a. Good location to subway stations – but Tokyo JR Station was slightly farther – at a 20 min walk away b. 24-hour convenience store just downstairs from the hotel & plenty of restaurants and bars were around the hotelc. main shopping belt at Ginza was literally at the doorstep d. room was brightly colored and clean e. stayed in winter – room was well insulated If I had one gripe about the hotel – it would be noise insulation. Being right at the heart of Ginza means a fair amount of traffic downstairs. While the noise was not intrusive, if you are a light sleeper, it might be useful to request for a room facing away from the main street. Of course then you won’t get to see the bright lights of Ginza just looking out of the window! All in all, it was a great stay.

Price is expensive due to the superb location. However do note the room is not huge (as with most hotels in tokyo), not a huge wardrobe either. However I would still recommend this hotel for the service and the location. This hotel is not bad at all, i'm just managing expectations because of the price u might be paying.Personally I always stay here if I want to be in the ginza area.

We booked two adjacent rooms for 3 nights in May 2018. The hotel has an excellent location - right in the heart of Ginza, a minute from the station, across the Kabukiza theater and a short taxi ride from everything else. Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and courteous. They do not book tours but helped us get to all the locations we wanted to visit. Easy access from Haneda by train on the way in and we took the N’ex on our way out to Narita. Highly recommend! We will definitely stay here again!!

The hotel is modern and in a good area (Ginza) with plenty of shopping around. Only stayed one night and so did not get to see the sights. We were pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade on arrival (Mikimoto Cosmetics Pearl Room) which was a lovely corner room on 10th floor with good views. The bed was comfortable and the night was good. The only disappointment was the breakfast. The choice available at the buffet style meal was OK however we had stayed at two other hotels before the MMGHT and they were better! So a bit unfortunate for the comparisons. The other two also had drinks dispensers that offered a choice of hot and cold drink while this hotel's only offered basic tea or coffee. Wish I could give excellent but can't.

Booked two rooms for our family of four. The location of the hotel can't be beat in the Ginza area. If you are coming from Haneda airport, the train stops at the Higashi-Ginza station (please note that this is different from the Ginza Station) and there is an elevator at Higashi-Ginza station that would bring you right in front of the hotel. The hotel is near Tsukiji Market, lots of shopping, and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again. Service is friendly and the rooms are well-equipped with Shisheido amenities, fridge, coffee maker, and a free Handy mobile phone which you can take with you during your stay around Tokyo to surf the net and make local calls. The room though small, is comfortable and clean. Highly recommended.

Great hotel!Perfectly equipped with everything you may need during your stay.Wonderful location too.The ice cubes machine on every floor is brilliant.The housekeeping does an excellent job. And i mean it. Every time we returned to the hotel, the room was spotless.Keep up the good work! We will return to you for sure!

located right outside the Highashi-Ginza station and literally surrounded by great eateries and shopping streets. Front desk was helpful and the check-in/out was a breeze. Got my money's worth while staying here.

My fiance and I stayed 1 night in the hotel, we really enjoy the location of the hotel, as we can walk out to pretty much everything! We had a great experience in Mitsui Garden Hotel in Tokyo last year, and hence we chose this chain hotel again, & we are not disappointed at all! Location:Excellent!!- conveniently located above Higashi-Ginza subway station, the elevator from the A1 exit takes you straight to the entrance of hotel- located across from Mitsukoshi Department store- walk out to all restaurants, convenient stores and shops!Amenities: GREAT! - each room is equip with a free "Handy" phone which works as a free wifi hotspot and you can take it out from the hotel during the stay- currency exchange machine availble in the lobby- breakfast restaurant on sub-ground levelRoom & Common Area: Excellent!!- Hotel feels new, almost like recently renovated/built- Room is decent size in Japan's standard- everything is neat and clean in the room, beds & pillows are comfortable- all toiletries are Shiseido brand including cleanser, makeup remover, toner & moisturizer. - there is not much of a view from the room because the hotel is surrounded by buildings, but it really doesn't bother us at all. As the location is the more important to us. We will definitely return again.

Clean. Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. All at a reasonable price. Only negative is that the rooms are a bit small, but that's to be expected in Tokyo.We didn't book the room with breakfast because Tsukiji is about 10 minutes away on foot - and we took advantage of that every morning.The staff helped us with sending our luggage to the next hotel. It was great. If you aren't looking to blow your budget and you don't mind the small rooms, this is a fantastic hotel to stay at while you explore Tokyo and the surrounding area.

One of best choice if you want to stay in Ginza, Tokyo. The hotel is located in central Ginza and you could get in MRT just ourdoors. Room is very neat and clean even it is tidy. Room is fully equipped and have a good city view. Highly recommended!

Booked a superior double for solo travel and was not disappointed. Though size is small, queen bed is super comfortable with good toiletries and shower strength. Quiet room with no noise from the lift lobby (to which I was very near) nor street level. Staff are extremely helpful and able to converse pretty well in English. I bought a Keikyu one-way ticket with 72 hours of unlimited subway access and dropped off at Higashi Ginza station from Haneda. I knew the station was very near the hotel but was pleasantly surprised to find that once you take the elevator from the station, the hotel is less than a few metres away. And because I booked some day tours from Club Yokoso where the pickup point was in Shinjuku, it was also super convenient to take the Ginza subway, which is just a 2 min walk away. Mitsukuoshi, Matsuya and Ginza Six (and many other places for shopping) are just a 5, 10 min walk away. Took the airport limo bus from Courtyward Marriot to Narita which is about 10 mins away from Millenium. Hotel staff from Millenium is able to help make the reservation. Will never stay in another hotel again if in Tokyo - this is my ultimate choice!

Great location right above Higashi Ginza station. Rooms are reasonably sized and clean. Hotel staff are generally friendly and helpful but beware! Housekeeping and the restuarant in the basement are not part of the hotel/ hotel staff and there is NO flexibility to accomodate special requests

Couldn’t have found a more conveniently located hotel for our one week break in Tokyo.The hotel is new and very clean, helpful staff and decent breakfast. Rooms were compact but comfortable and had everything a guest might need. No issues with internet speed despite comments from other reviews on this subject. Several dining options close by.

The hotel is very modern. The rooms are comfortable,not big but a reasonable size for Tokyo and fitted out with a good standard of furnishing. The location, in the heart of Ginza, is ideal. The staff were so very friendly and exceptionally helpful. They really went out of their way to make our stay special.

It's new and it's located in middle of Ginza right above a subway station (the Ginza subway line is exactly the place you want to be in order to not waste time in Tokyo).Those already make up for a good reason to stay at this hotel. On top of that the service was great and the breakfast nothing short of a 4-star hotel. The rooms were nice and well furnished but small. However small rooms is what you get in Japan. Overall a great choice.

We had a great 5 day stay jn this lovely hotel. The service is great and the staff helpfull and friendly. Checkin and checkout where very fast. The rooms are clean and perfect. Ginza is also a great area to eat shop and explore the city

We stayed for 5 nights in the first week of April.Hotel is very modern and well located with Higashi Ginza and Ginza subway lines in close proximity and Yurachuko (for Yamanote line) at walking distance. Very close to shopping area too. It is very easy to reach the hotel while arriving from Narita by Airport limousine bus, as it stops at nearby Courtyard Marriott hotel which is just few blocks away.Room was well appointed and spotlessly clean though smallish with limited storage space.However layout was well designed with separate space for shower/tub, toilet and washbasin.The modern Japanese washlet is amazing.For those looking for Indian vegetarian food,Natraj restaurant is located very nearby just adjacent to Uni Qlo building.The best part of the stay was the overwhelming hospitality displayed by the entire staff be it the staff at the reception or restaurant or housekeeping.They were extremely polite, helpful and very attentive.Overall we had a very comfortable stay and would definitely return if we visit Tokyo again.

review_body: We just came back from a week in Tokyo, staying at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel. The location was ideal for us, right in the Ginza district, a block from the Kabuki theater, Three blocks or so from Ginza Six, which is a large, upscale shopping building that include a host of excellent restaurants on the top floor, and a beautiful, traditional Noh theater on the bottom floor. We dined at four different restaurants in Ginza Six and attended the theater there. There is also good dining at smaller places along the neighborhood streets.Millennium Mitsui is within walking distance of the Imperial Palace gardens -- which is the most beautiful city park I've ever seen. On your walk there, be sure to stop and pay your respects at the Godzilla statue!It's a longish walk around the park to the Japanese Museum of Modern Art. In the opposite direction from the hotel is the famous Tokyo fish market -- open for tourist visits at 10:00 AM (no photos allowed). After your tour around the market, you can get a sushi brunch at any of a number of bar-style restaurants. You'll never have sushi fresher than that!Millenium Mitsui Garden is modest in some ways; the foyer isn't particularly grand; our room was small by American standards, yet worked fine for the two of us. And the hotel has an excellent breakfast buffet. Concierge service is helpful and (like all Japanese service) very polite!
