review_body: Rooms are very well appointed with easily Navigator ball light controls and the very important Japanese toilet, love it. Plenty of outlets and other nice cities to make the stay Pleasant. Only downfall is the breakfast which I would call average by Asian standards. Scrambled eggs are extremely undercooked and there are not as many choices as I would like. Also breakfast staff does not come around asking if you want tea or coffee. You must get it, including refills, by yourself.

Great hotel in awesome location, just steps from metro entrance, and an easy walk to all of Ginza, Tsukiji market, and Marunouchi. Nice staff, comfortable and thoughtful rooms. Not ultra luxurious but it has to be the best value in Tokyo for the money, and the rooms have everything you'd want, most of all a great location.

The hotel has the perfect location in Ginza, has the expectedly small rooms but designed very efficiently with separate toilet and shower/tub and good amenities in room. Breakfast is also good save for the old coffee machine that is beyond its best before date. Attentive, english speaking staff and a spacious lobby round out a good experience

The hotel is in a prime location, situated a block away from the main Ginza shopping area (where Matsuya, Mitsukoshi are). There are several restaurants, Starbucks, convenience stores, less than a block away. The train station is only a 2-minute walk away. Check-in was fast but lobby can get crowded at times.The rooms are quite small but are new, with complete amenities. With the hotel prices, however, you can get more rooms. We got a triple room and 2 doubles for a family of 6.

Hotel situated right on top of higashi-Ginza stop. Perfect for traveller. Plenty of shops nearby mostly premium brands. Further walk away you find more shops and malls. It’s located in Ginza area known for premium shopping. Breakfast was almost similar for days, nothing to shout about.Room was relatively small indeed, with the price tag should have bigger rooms. Amenities was superb with everything provided. Internet was good and consistent.Staff service was top notch and quick. Only part is the price tag!!

Nearest subway is Higashi Ginza or Ginza . The hotel is within walking distance to Tsukiji Market , Ginza Corridor , Mitsukoshi , Ginza Six , Tokyu Plaza etc Highest floor is 14 floor Superior twin room should have view of Misyukishi2 free drinking bottles everyday Free toiletries , pyjama and disposable sleepers . Kettle to make tea and coffee. Tv has one CNN in English Front desk helps to store luggage , make reservation for restaurants and give advise on direction .No porter service but there are trolleys House keeping changed towel , pyjamas and replenish toiletries everyday . Keeping the room spotless .Would choose this hotel again whenever in Tokyo Special note for passenger using Haneda airport as the hotel sits on Asakusa subway line ( 20 minutes direct subway ride )

Hands down the perfect hotel if you wish to stay in ginza. Location is superb ! From the airport, train is available and the station is right infront of the hotel. Just take the lift up & you are right by the front lobby. Hotels are still nice bcoz its not as old as the other hotels in the area. Rooms are rather small but do other hotels in the area.A stone away from Mitsukosi, Ginza 6 and other major malls.

This was a great hotel in Tokyo. It is in the Ginza area - an easy taxi ride from the train station and very close to the subway station. it is also close to the department stores - a good place for lunches. The room was very comfortable, quiet, clean, good amenities. And the staff was so friendly and helpful. They made great restaurant recommendations and were able to give us directions to the local sights. Their English was excellent. Of all the places we have stayed in Tokyo, this one is our favorite. Free internet

This hotel is very well located in the Ginza area. One can simply walk to do their shopping.The underground train is located behind the hotel which makes it easy to get to other suburbs of Tokyo.The rooms are spacious and well kept. This could easily be a 5* hotel in other countries .The reception staff is very helpful and always willing to assist with directions etc.The rooms are very modern and neat.They provide a set of pyjamas,slippers and fresh water bottles daily.Wifi is available.

Our family of 5 stayed here for 4 nights over the New Years in two rooms next to each other. Here are what we liked about the hotel:Excellent location, very close to various department stores, restaurants and Tsukiji market was only 10 minutes away by foot. Many other attractions were also close byThe hotel was busy but the rooms were always quietThe staff were helpful and friendly. Due to our flight departing late in the evening, we asked if we could have late check out so that our young children could nap before we leave, they were kind to let us check out late for one of our two rooms.Breakfast buffet had a good selection of western and traditional Japanese foods. The only thing we wish they had was soy milk at breakfast -as 3 out of 5 of our family are lactose intolerant, when I asked the staff said they didn't have any... Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

I booked through booking .com , i travelled with my 2 teenage kids and 1 child so requested 2 rooms close to each other which wasn’t guaranteed.We did have deluxe twin rooms side by side , the rooms are great size comfortable beds , very clean and tidy .The staff are friendly helpful and speak English location is perfect the subway is a 2 min walk if that.So many great restaurants ( book if it’s popular )and shops all within walking distance .Our rooms were at the front facing the main road which was a bit noisy with sirens , but not too bad .Would stay again

If you want to be central in Tokyo, the location is just perfect - heart of shopping center, great restaurants, easy walking to Imperator palace, fish market etc.The rooms are fairly big and modern, beds are big enough. You’ll have to get used to washing basin being in the room, othervise the wet area (with a bath) and toilet are well organized. The views from big (almost full wall) windows are mesmerizing. One can understand no swimming pool/spa/gym in the hotel (there is a big spa center just next door if crucial), but internet being really slow is very annoying.

review_body: My family and I spent the New Year in Tokyo and stayed in this lovely hotel. My sister and brother in law’s previous stay made it memorable so this trip we decided to stay here again. It was my first time and was happy with the location because of its proximity to convenience stores and little restaurants around the area. My favorite shops like Uniqlo and GU were also beside our hotel. The train stop is also 2 mins away from the hotel. I would like to make mention of the extra mile the staff of the hotel made for me. I needed a translator bec I needed to meet up with my Japanese friend. The front desk personnel helped me with the phone call thru the hotel phone and spoke on my behalf to my friend. The second experience was when I forgot to remove the do not disturb sign on my door, hence our room was not cleaned for the day. I called the front desk and asked for new towels and new plastic bags for the trash. Immediately hotel staff went up tomy room and gave me the amenities. I will not hesitate to stay here again because of my enjoyable experience with them. Worth the cost.

Excellent location in Ginza, near various stations and shopping centers. Plenty of food outlets nearby more than enough for a weeks stay. Doesn't make the price seem expensive, although in reality it was probably one of the more expensive hotels in that area!

If you’re seeking shopping and amazing restaurants, this is a perfect property. The rooms are modern and well appointed, and fairly large (for Tokyo). We had a corner room overlooking Ginza that had 2 double beds pushed together. The shower was one of the nicest I’ve ever experienced, and once you get used to the automated toilet, you’ll be thinking about buying one for home. The staff was friendly and helpful. Another nice benefit of this hotel is it is a 10 minute walk to the Tsukiji Fish Market, which is a great place to eat and shop. We didn’t go at 5a, but got there about 9a and stayed through lunch. The hotel is also close to a couple of subway lines, which are easy to navigate once you get used to them. Upon arrival in Japan We took the Narita express train (about 1 hour) to Tokyo Station, then it was a 10 minute taxi ride to the Millennium Garden. Leaving was a 20 minute taxi to Haneda Airport. Next time in Tokyo I would definitely stay here again.

We had a corner room, with extra bed and still plenty of room. Rooms are bright with light colours, excellent modern electrical gear, but easy to use. The separate bathroom and toilet very good. Love the wet area bath/shower, enclosed in opaque glass. Front desk folk very fast and efficient, could not be more helpful. We have stayed at many Tokyo properties over the years, but this is the best. Many restaurants right at the door step, from Ramen down the side street, to the best pork tonkatsu just across the side street. Would thoroughly recommend. Only issue was Wifi, quicker posting a letter.

I had biz meeting in Parliament Hall of Tokyo. Due to shore notice, it's difficult to find hotel nearby. Some hotels were still have few rook available, the price however is way to expensive, which is USD 65-700 per night. Fortunately, my wife helped to find this hotel. I stayed 2 nights in this hotel.Great Location- Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel is located in Ginza area, only one stop away from my meeting place. The hotel is close to all transport station, like metro, training and shuttle bus. There is shuttle which is between airport and hotel; Reasonable room charge - we all understand the hotel price in Japan is quite expensive, especially in big city like Tokyo. It's around USD 240 per night, so completely acceptable. Full facility and super clean - the room is not big, but with fully equipped. Nice design, and all facilities are pretty new. More importantly, it's super clean. That's the one of main reasons why i like to travel to Japan. Nice hotel staffs - staffs in front desk speak quite good English, which is a bit surprised me as communication is main issue when traveling in Japan, and majority Japanese don't speak English. Therefore, communication won't be issue in this hotel. All staffs are very patient to answer all questions. Breakfast - that's the only thing which i believe it can be improved a bit. It's Japanese style breakfast with rice, soup.Overall, very satisfied experience in Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Toyko.

The rooms are clean, new and nicely decorated. Note: They are a bit small by western standards (you can probably only get one full-sized suitcase and one small one open at the same time) and not much of a view.The breakfast buffet is exactly the same every day, but the food was good and flavorful. The location is also great, just steps away from the metro.My only complaint about the hotel was the WiFi. It may be free, but it was either so slow nothing would load or outright unconnectable. We arrived at close to midnight and no one in our party was able to connect. We called the front desk and they said probably too many people were using it.We couldn't connect the next morning either, and spoke to the front desk again on our way out. The guy offered us a WiFi box/router that we could pick up when we got back to the hotel.When we got back, the woman at the counter said they were "out of stock" and we should just keep trying to connect to the WiFi every 10 minutes. She said she had no idea when the guest(s) with the router(s) would return it and there was nothing she could do.Long story short, we didn't get the router until the third night of our stay. Until then, their Wi-Fi was useless regardless of time of day (midnight, 6 a.m., 8 a.m.) which was extremely vexing as some of us had urgent work matters to attend to.If connectivity is important to you, make sure you reserve a router with the hotel (and confirm it with them) before you get there.

Traveling over 3850 miles from Hawaii to Japan, we found this gem of the hotel. Very easy access from Haneda Airport. Only 35 minutes by train. We we’re traveling with a party of six one of whom was a 92-year-old woman in a wheelchair. I really had my reservations about taking her to Japan but lo and behold everything worked out super. At the train station the attendant provided a ramp were in Japan they call it a slope to get on the train. And that are stop another attorney is waiting with another rap so we could get off easily and pointed us to the right direction of our hotel. The hotel literally sits right on top of the subway line so As you exit the train station, Mitsui Millennium hotel is right there in front of you.The lobby is very modern and bright with a whole wall of LED lights that changes color periodically. The staff all speak english and are super attentive to every need. Check in was smooth and fast. We had booked a room with two double beds a walk in shower and a soaking tub known as a Furo in Japan. Room size was average compared to other hotels in the US. Room amenities included a flat screen TV, two bottles of fresh water per day, two sets of drip coffee which is excellent I might say and The usual shampoo and body lotions that other hotels provide. And also a selection of Shisado Beauty products for the women. Toothbrush toothpaste, razor blades and shaving cream we’re also provided by the hotel.The hotel is located in the heart of Chu. Walking distance to the famous to Tsukiji fishimarkte, the Mitsukoshi apartment store and of course the largest Uniqlo in the world! Definitely stay here again if you ever find our selves back in Tokyo.Hope this helps all of you

Room was great, not cheap.Breakfast was ok, nothing fantastic.Location is excellent, close to the shopping area of Ginza and 10-15 min walk from the Tsukiji market.Really enjoyed coming back to the room to rest each day.

Great hotel, comfortable and excellent location very close to Ginza shopping strips and 2 metro stops are very close by. Staff were helpful and good room layout. We received complimentary chocolates and a great room on the 14th floor as we mentioned that we were on our honeymoon. Good value for Tokyo

I visited a number of hotels, but the customer service was abysmal.I sent a request for a reservation for a restaurant in the hotel website, but I replied in a week.Although I sent everything I needed to reserve for a restaurant, the contents of the reply were to confirm the hotel reservation.I once again sent about the reservation of the restaurant. But they didn't reply, and I called the hotel twice a week.Their phone calls were abysmal. After hearing my long request, they always spoke only one word. "Send an email."The answer to them afterwards was that they failed because the restaurant was fully booked.I was very disappointed and angry.When I sent them a letter of protest, I received a reply in a day. An answer filled with excuses.I immediately asked for another restaurant reservation to the card concierge, and they did it.And when we finally arrived at the restaurant, our name was not listed on the reservation list.The restaurant provided a dining table for us, but it was embarrassing.After the diner, I contacted the card concierge. When I checked, the restaurant called to the hotel because they found my reservation was double. And the hotel cancelled my whole reservation. So I went to the restaurant they couldn't found my reservation and I felt so embarrassed.But when I entered the hotel, even when I checked out, I wanted them to apologize but they didn't say anything to me.I can't control my anger against them.It's all too upset but this is what you can do.Please don't go to this hotel!!!!!!!!!

We spent a couple of weeks at this hotel. Brilliant location, compact room but larger than others I’ve stayed in in Ginza, and really exceptionally well equipped. Was great to have good wardrobe space, which is unusual in this area, especially since we had a longer stay. Spotlessly clean of course. The staff though could have been more helpful, and I wouldn’t recommended the restaurant. Though a new restaurant has now opened, you don’t actually need it as everything you could want is right on your doorstep. I slightly prefer the other Mitsui Garden hotel in Ginza (more luxurious, modern and great food) but this location is better and you can’t beat it for value. Will definitely stay again. Great for business or vacation.

On arrival greeted by a very friendly, English speaking receptionist, Yoshi.Room size good, bathroom, toilet apart. Area is great - accepting that Ginza is expensive. Fish markets a short walk but busy. Subway line under the hotel, only 2 stops to the Imperial Palace Gardens. Untold restaurants of all persuations within a short walk. About ¥1,000 from the main railway station by taxi.Highly recommended.

Main draw of the hotel is its location, which is fantastic. Two subway stations (Ginza, Higashi Ginza), main Ginza shopping district, and Tsujiki Fish Market all within walking distance (~10 minutes to Tsujiki, which was the furthest). Lots of transportation options available: taxis were always parked outside the hotel and subway was directly below the hotel. 10 minutes drive to Tokyo station for travelling to/from Narita and other cities. Lots of good food around the hotel. I'll definitely recommend Ramen Takahashi, Ginza Noodles, Kagari Ginza. Also great bars less than 10 minutes walk (Bar High Five, Bar Mimi and Lupin). Family mart around the corner. Uniqlo in Ginza also less than 5 mins in the event you need more clothes haha. Room was simple, but very comfortable. Slept extremely well for the six nights I was there. Amenities were well stocked and refreshed everyday. Breakfast was standard. Would definitely recommend staying here if you preferred base to visit Tokyo is Ginza.

The location of this hotel is fantastic. One block away from the Ginza main strip and right on top of the Higashi-Ginza station. The Ginza station is only a block away.There are about 6 convenience stores located within a 3-5 minute walk from the hotel.I got to the hotel via a NEX train from Narita to Tokyo station, then it was a short taxi ride to the hotel. It is also possible to skip the taxi and take the subway from Tokyo station, which I might do on my next trip.The service was great. I wanted to make reservations at several restaurants a couple of months before my trip and the hotel was happy to oblige to my emailed requests. Communication was good, my requests were handled by multiple people over the course of weeks and none of them dropped the ball and I did not need to follow up at all. Everything was confirmed before my trip. The hotel does put a hold on your credit card when you check in though depending on the restaurants that you book, as some restaurants have a cancellation policy. Rooms are not huge but not small by Tokyo standards. It was able to accommodate my 2 suitcases. I've been in other hotels where there isn't enough room to open a suitcase and you have to do on the bed. No problem here. I have a very large suitcase and I had enough room to open it. Housekeeping is efficient and the rooms are very clean and tidy.The layout of the bathroom is a little funny, so it might work better for a couple than say 2 people sharing. The main sink is in the hallway between the front door and the bed. The shower is excellent though. I love the idea of a shower room. There is a small open closet just by the door to the room which is convenient. I know some hotel rooms in Tokyo are so small that there isn't anywhere to hang anything. As I was staying for 9 nights the wardrobe space came in very handy.The bed was a little hard for me, but was acceptable. Personal preference really. The trade off to the fantastic location of this hotel is the noise from the street. I think there might be an emergency services depot nearby because I heard many sirens throughout my stay, day and night. I didn't hear much noise from other rooms though, which was good.All in all a very pleasant stay. I will definitely be back.

The hotel is situated in the heart of Ginza, with metro/subway less than a minute walk away. It must be one of the most convenient location for one to get around Tokyo to key sights, shops and restaurants.Rooms are considered to be of good size for a Japanese hotel in the heart of Tokyo, with very well organized lay out. However, a two occupant room really only fit 2 person, and if you have a teen, you need to either get a 3 bedroom or an extra room and I did not see any adjoining rooms. Rooms are clean with ample sunlight that comes with good quality toiletries and a change of pajamas daily. However, there is no gym nor swimming pool, so if you want to run, you can do that nearby around the Imperial Palace which is just a few minutes run from the hotel, definitely a much better choice than to run in a gym. Front office and concierge speak English and are helpful to help get you around Tokyo. However depending on who you speak to, not every one is able to provide you with good restaurant recommendations. Overall, it is definitely my no. 1 choice hotel in the heart of Ginza, Tokyo.

Stayed there 3 nights in October. Reception very responsive to all my emails prior to my arrival. Very good room . Comfortable bed. Good size of this room. Excellence breakfast. And fantastic great location. They helped with parking garage and restaurant booking. Very much highly recommended

Was ready to say this was between a 4 and 5 star hotel as the staff was very nice, rooms and property are very clean and great location (metro right outside hotel and access to shopping and restaurants). But we struggled with being on a western time zone for several nights. No room service, no bar, no restaurant except breakfast and when my friend joined me for breakfast and wanted a just a coffee early in the morning, they denied her unless she paid for a full meal at 2500 yen. Cost of breakfast isn’t worth it for the food, but it’s also hard to find anywhere to eat early if you are jet lagged or up early. So if you plan to cover all meals outside of the hotel, this is a good choice. If you want some flexibility and options, this probably isn’t the place to stay.

Perfectly located in Ginza where there are many brand stores and restaurants around. Close to Mitsukoshi Department Store and Higashi-Ginza Station. Tsukiji Market is within walking distance. The closest airport limousine station is situated at Courtyard Marriott Hotel just 2 blocks away. Our twin room was spacious, nicely furnished and very comfortable. Our favorite bathroom layout: separate bathtub+shower area, toilet compartment and wash basin area. Friendly reception staff gave dining recommendation and helped make dinner reservation and airport limousine reservation. We will definitely return.

This is a great hotel if you're looking to stay in Ginza and near Tokyo Station and the Imperial Palace. The staff were very friendly, even helping us mail postcards and giving us some stamps for free. There's not much of a view from the 14th floor but that's to be expected given the cramped area.If you're looking for a well-appointed room at a reasonable price (given the location), this one's hard to beat.

One of the best hotel to stay in ginza, Tokyo. Great proximity to the whole shopping street on ginza ,great restaurant s near by, the hotel has an excellent choice of food for breakfast, rooms r well designed nice and compact , the staff is brilliant and extremely helpful.

First time in this hotel. My colleague chose this hotel and it turned out to be excellent for a business trip! Great location in the heart of Ginzha. A metro station right near by and also many restaurants, coffee shops and shopping. Room is small but very clean. Bathroom is spacious. Breakfast was provided but it's just ok. Will definitely stay there again.

No greeter, they don't take your bags, small room, no concierge. The woman who checked us in said she was the conciege, but she didn't speak much Engish and didn't know much. Good location, in the heart of Ginza.

My family and I (total of 5) stayed at this hotel while we were vacationing at Tokyo for 4 days at the end of September. First off, the location of the hotel is prime because it's right around the corner from beautiful/bougie shopping district: Ginza. It's not in the middle of all the shopping commotion, which is preferred because you have the luxury of getting away from all the crazy. Additionally, the Higashi-Ginza train stop is conveniently in front of the hotel for those that are brave enough to explore Tokyo by it's rail station (highly suggest it with the help of Google maps, which is surprisingly accurate!). The staff here were attentive and very helpful from beginning to end. The consistently available multi-lingual staff was greatly appreciated. Lastly, the most important detail of all is cleanliness and I can say the hotel is very clean and exceeds expectations. The reasons I did not give an 'excellent' overall rating is due to the following: the max number of persons per room is 2 and is strictly enforced. This insinuates that the rooms capacity is at most: 2 persons. Do not take this fact for granted because the rooms are quaint! It is well stocked and has all the amenities you may need while away from home, but for a second person to move around the bed - is almost impossible unless you hop over the bed from the same side as the other. Secondly, the mattress and pillows are quite tough. I felt as if I was sleeping on a tatami with no cushion whatsoever. Other than that, I would stay at this hotel again!

I booked this hotel via Relux. The experience was pretty well, especially the staff's kind service. They were kind to keep our luggage 1 day prior to our stay. The room was also cozy and new. They also provided recommendations of dinner for other visitors while we were waiting to check in. Its location was also very convenient that it was only 1 minute walk away from the subway station. However, the breakfast was a little disappointing cause we might have looked forward to it too much for it's good reputation. All in all, I still recommend this hotel.

Stayed for two nights here instead of going to Okinawa, it was smaller compared to Mitsui premier ginza. As you walk in the toilet is right next to the door and in a separate cubical is the shower and bath wash room area. Weirdly, the sink is in the entrance way of the room. Other than that the room is small with just enough space for the double bed and a small chair, but not much space for suitcases or hanging any clothes up. We had a naff view of some offices as well. The room was clean through Outside this hotel is the subway entrance so it is very convenient for the subway. Good for a few days but no longer than 3 nights, very tight space if you need to sort out four cases like I did. Quite pricey for such a small room though.

I recently stayed here 10 days on business. The hotel is clean and in a nice location close to a lot of shopping and restaurants. The staff is very courteous and helpful. While I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to someone looking to stay close to Ginza, it wouldn’t be my first choice for business travel. Things I loved – 1. The front desk staff is lovely and helpful. They answered a plethora of questions from my co-workers and myself. They also provided us with a small business card with a map/address of the hotel and wrote out the address in Japanese for our office so we could always use with taxi drivers and limit the communication gaps. Not all hotels will do this. 2. They will mail your post cards for you and the postage is complimentary. That is a small perk but a noticeable one. I send my kids postcards from every business trip and sometimes it’s a pain. Some hotels will just bill your room, others make you pay, so it was a nice surprise to be told they will post and mail them free of charge. 3. Walking distance to wonderful Ramon, local food and all sorts of shopping. Close to Tsukiji Market and the Kabukiza theater. Location is excellent. 4. Taxi’s are always out front if you need them. We never waited for a taxi. 5. Train station is close and easy to access. Airport Limousine Bus stop is a about a 5 min walk from the hotel. Just be mindful if you have a lot of luggage that you can’t navigate without a cart. 6. Complimentary water – 2 bottles a day in the fridge in the room7. Wi-fi worked well for me and I could download and watch movies. Things I wasn’t too excited or happy about – 1. The rooms are extremely small. Yes, this is Japan and yes, most hotels in Japan have small rooms. However, I’ve traveled to Japan numerous times for business and I’ve never seen such a small room. (Someone else on our team choose this hotel so we had no idea how small the rooms were compared to other hotels we’ve stayed in around Tokyo.)2. The restaurant doesn’t offer any western selections. While I love Japanese food, when you are on the road for business for weeks at a time, sometimes you just want some English tea and toast etc. They do have a large breakfast buffet that we ate at once but felt it wasn’t worth the price for the overall selection offered compared to other large hotels. Dinner is a smaller menu and again not a wide selection. Also, no room service, that was disappointing as well. Sometimes when you spent a day traveling you just want a shower, food delivered to your room and a bed. Also, can we just get some English breakfast tea in the room please? This is pretty standard in most hotels I’ve stayed in while in Japan. 3. There is only one English speaking channel and unfortunately that is CNN (constantly negative news). Not only is this the only English channel on the TV selection, certain times of days they voice over the English speakers with Japanese. No English movie selections, pretty much not an option whatsoever. So if you want English be prepared to watch on your own device or not watch at all. 4. Views - I was traveling with three other co-workers and non of us had a view. Two of us faced a building and you could see people working and what was on their computers so we left our blinds down always when in the room. One co-worker faced the street in front of the hotel and even with the blinds down there was a billboard across the street that lit up at night and woke him up every night. Views aren't everything but it is nice to be able to have your blinds open, especially with such small rooms.

We chose to stay at this hotel because we have mobility problems and it had a walk-in shower. What a lucky choice! Arriving exhausted at 5 .30 a.m. and no check-in until 2 p.m. or 3 p.m., we opted to take a room so we could sleep. Good choice again.The check in was seamless and the staff congenial. Upon entry into the foyer, you are welcomed by the subtle perfume of roses - a lovely touch. The decor in reception is contemporary and delightful - artistic and restrained.Whilst the hotel has no porter service, with modern travel bags this is unnecessary. Our room was the epitome of good interior design, providing carefully thought out arrangement of all necessary amenities. On 13th Floor, we had a view of the city in the background and a rooftop garden of a nearby building where there was rice being cultivated. The bed was very comfortable, shower room with soaking bath and Hansgrohe thermostat-controlled tapware were just great. Every aspect of the design was so well thought out. So good, too, to have an ironing board and steam iron provided. The only quibble was that no English language TV available. Even CNN news over dubbed in Japanese. This would not ordinarily be a problem, but we wished to keep au fait with the North Korean situation. This lovely. quiet hotel is located in bustling, sparkling, interesting Ginza close to the famous fish market and on top of a train station. It is a flat surface walk to some of the most interesting and elegant buildings in Tokyo. The hotel has its own restaurant operating day and night and is close to other good restaurants and, of course, to the wonderful, new, impressive Department Stores whose basement food courts are like Bon Marche Paris on steroids. I unreservedly recommend this hotel and upon return to Tokyo, this would be my first choice of accommodation.

First time staying in Ginza area! Great location with close proximity to Tsukiji Market and Ginza main shopping area. Rated 4 star as I've never been charged on arrival but usually on departure. As business traveller, I would preferred to consolidate my bill in one invoice rather than one invoice for room and other invoice on incidental charges.

We spent 2 nights in this hotel and admittedly, its main advantage may be its location: really close to the Higashi Ginza subway station (Hibiya and Asakusa lines) and the Kabukiza theater if you want to experience it, close to Ginza shopping area and restaurants. But you have to pay for it ! Which is ok if the rooms were large enough. But ours was about 16-18 m2 where a double bed and a modern Japanese style bathroom were squeezed in. The space left was just enough for 1 big luggage. And there is no fitness room.I guess the pictures on the website show much bigger rooms but probably also even more expensive.Otherwise, nothing to say about the cleanliness of the hotel.Next time, I'll probably choose another place with a larger room and further from Ginza.

Good hotel just to put your stuff, safe, clean, and around the area will have food.. close to train stations which is ideal if you plan to take train to airport because you don't carry your luggage all over the city. Stil have to walk a good amount of time once you get off train with luggage to hotel, but not bad since most of the walking is stil inside the train station not streets!

Just came back from spending 6 days in the hotel, very modern and funky, rooms a little small although for Tokyo there decent although everything you need is in the room as thay are designed to maximise the use of the space, very helpful staff and housekeeping did a great job keeping the room very clean and refreshed - the hotel is in a great location in the centre of Ginza with the metro steps away so very easy to get around once you figure out the metro system - Overall a great stay would defiantly stay in this property again

the best thing about this hotel is most definitely its location! it's near everything in Ginza, a couple minutes walk to tsukiji market and its near most of the popular shops and department stores in Ginza. Hotel facilities are good but small, it's perfect if your traveling alone. No gym or pool though.

This hotel is situated at the heart of Ginza district, best place of Tokyo. Just few steps to the metro. Rooms are clean and comfortable, larger than Tokyo standards. You can find a 24 h open shop at the corner. Our stay did not include breakfast, we could find nice cafés around. Enjoy!

I was glad to be back here again last June 2017. It made me further appreciate the hotel and the area surrounding it. Take note that the hotel has a lot of room types, so choose wisely and take note of the room sizes in square meters. As usual, the rooms are ultra-modern and the service top notch. We could not have asked for more.There is a great shoyu ramen place accross the main road fronting the hotel. It is right beside Ichiran Steak. There'a also a Don Quijote a few blocks behind the hotel. The great Mitsukoshi Ginza is also almost right accross the street. Tsukiji fish market is just a few block away. A few meters just outside the hotel's front door is an elevator access to Higashi-Ginza Metro station. This is where we took most of our Metro rides from.Overall this hotel has everything great going for it, and I will stay here again.

I really loved this hotel. This was my first trip to Japan and I speak no Japanese. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and make me feel at home. Within walking distance to the subway, amazing restaurants, high-end shopping, and the famous Tsukiji fish market. The rooms are small, but they are laid-out so well that you hardly notice. Clean. Quiet. Comfortable bed, sofa, desk, modern bath, and yes, one of those amazing Japanese toilets! You will be spoiled!! Highly recommend.

Stayed in a deluxe room for 10 days on a business trip, chosen due to proximity to govt. ministries for work. Super clean and well equipped rooms. Also very sizeable considering the rates and that its in Ginza. Amazing breakfast spread with a variety of traditional Japanese fare on offer, as well as made to order options. Staff are highly conversant in English, and can address most queries. Location: 15 mins walk to the Imperial Palace, and 10 mins walk to the infamous Tsukiji Market. One of the best Kabuki theaters just across the street, and multiple Tokyo Metro stations within 5 mins walk as well as a JR rail in about 12-15 mins walk. A host of excellent restaurants around too from 1200 yen walk ins to 10,000-14,000 yen p/pax shabu shabu and sushi-ya.

As mentioned by others, this location is really right in the heart of Ginza. So that is the huge plus. It is modern and perhaps even new. Check in can be pretty fast if you do not meet any tour groups. The only issue is that the rooms here are really small, so if you have huge baggage, I would think twice about this place unless you book a much bigger room. Service was professional and efficient. One last note is that if you are coming down from Narita and/or heading to Haneda, you cannot quite benefit from the ideal lift which is right outside the hotel. It just does not get you to the platform without stairs.

We just returned from a family vacation in Tokyo, where we spent 6 nights at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Ginza Hotel. We needed a room that would accommodate 3 adults. I have status with Hilton and IHG, but the rooms I found on their websites would have beds for 2 and then a rollaway. I did not want this. I searched on a website that allowed specifying bed types and found the Millennium. At first I was uncertain, but then I remembered staying at a Millennium hotel in Rotorua, New Zealand that was very comfortable.We booked the Millennium Mitsui as part of an American Airlines vacation package that included flights on JAL. The hotel is less than 3 years old, and everything about it is modern. Our room had a dressing area with vanity sink, a separate toilet area, and separate tub/shower area. The bedroom had three oversized twin beds that we all felt were comfortable. The location is right in the heart of the Ginza district, and there were several subway lines within blocks of the hotel, including 2 lines right below. There are many restaurants nearby and top name retail stores all over.I did mention several drawbacks in the hotel's survey questionnaire. The first is that they charge 2,500 yen for breakfast. We did not want a huge buffet to start the day. Instead we went to Denny's and Cafe Noa where breakfast for 3 was less than 3,000 yen vs 2,500 per person.Many major hotels offer special 24-hour, 48-hour or 72-hour transit passes for out of town guests. These offer a discount over tickets or passes bought at the subway station. The Millennium does not do this and I think they should consider it.Another minor downside is that CNN and Fox Sports are the only English language TV stations offered at the Millennium.This was our first trip to Tokyo, and I had concerns about getting from Narita Airport to the hotel. Access Narita is a great bus service with frequent trips to Ginza station. The price is only 1,000 yen per person, and it only takes about 10 minutes to walk to the hotel from the bus stop. There is also the Limousine Bus service that costs 3,100 yen per person and stops at the Courtyard by Marriott, which is a shorter walk to the Millennium.The downfalls I mentioned are far over weighed by the positive aspects of the hotel. If we return to Tokyo in the future, the Millennium will be at the top of our list of places to stay.

If been here almost two weeks and outside of China this is the worst internet ever. It is so poor my tablet won't connect and when it does it's dropping in and out constantly. Front desk has no clue and best you get is sorry. Forget watching TV they have only one English Channel. It is so bad I would have left but they charged me my 17 day stay up front.

It is very convenient since it is located in a middle of Ginza! Just 200m from Mitsukoshi. The service was exceptional and they helped me in every request for restaurant reservations, transportation logistics, etc. it is very modern and the service is also very relaxed and friendly.

The hotel is right in Ginza and is within walking distance from Ginza subway station. The hotel is very new and facilities modern. Staff are quite polite although their knowledge of Tokyo area can be improved. Breakfast has good variety of food. The only thing worth mentioning is the room size is a bit tight for 2 people.

We traveled all over the place and we were super impressed with this location and outstanding level of customer service. One person stood up during our stay and he was always there to assist, he was so curious to know about our day plans and offered to help. Kensuke shintani was amazing and I'm sure he will a great addition to your team. This hotel is 1 minute from the higashi-ginza. Very centered location (very very quiet and safe). You can walk to a lot good coffee shops and restaurants.

We landed in Tokyo at 7am and came straight to the hotel to dump our bags. It's in a great location and the Ginza district was wonderful - one of the best bits of Tokyo, I thought. The hotel was a smart one, but as my research showed is so common with hotels in the city, the rooms was a bit pokey.However, it had everything we needed for a couple of nights while we got our bearings, and while the reception staff were fairly useless for anything other than checking in and checking out, it was clean, not too expensive and in a great location, so if all you want is a good base to explore this area of Tokyo from, this is a great hotel to do that.

We stayed at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel for 4 nights - it was really the best place for us for a number of reasons:- Hotel Location: The hotel is one block from Ginza station which was key for us. The best and most convenient way to get around Tokyo is via train and the staff was very helpful in giving us directions.There are a lot of nice restaurants and cafes nearby so there are plenty of options for meals. The hotel is very close to the newly opened Ginza Six shopping complex and is about two blocks from a lot of the huge shops and luxury stores in Ginza. Right across is a Mitsubishi - a huge department store that has a great food area (as most Japanese department stores do).-Rooms: The rooms were larger than most Tokyo hotels and very clean and well maintained. The bathroom was unusual in that the shower and the toilet were separate but that actually worked well for us. -Front desk/Service: The front desk staff were fluent in English so communication was very easy. They helped us with directions and answered our questions patiently, sharing maps and giving detailed instructions so that we would maximise our days in Tokyo.I would definitely stay here on my next trip back.

Excellent location for shopping, bars, restaurants, taxi and train station!!!Room is modern and small for the price. Bathroom set-up is a little weird but can get used to it.Paid $200 per night without breakfast. Anyway there's Familymart with value for money breakfast.Only request is that they have room service for food!

Great location, modern hotel, personally loved the toilet greeting you (which made me laugh), clean and well connected. Pleasant bar, good Belgian bar around the corner with a great atmosphere. Overall would recommend.

Nice rooms, slightly bigger than the small Tokyo rooms we'd gotten used to. Still not palatial. The bathroom setup was rather unconventional: toilet in its own small stall, a larger shower + tub in an adjoining but separate stall, and then the sink sitting outside of both in the middle of the hallway. Not a deal-breaker. No fitness center, which seemed odd for a hotel of otherwise nice quality. They they have some sort of discount promotion with the Gold's Gym Ginza nearby. Free waters in the room a nice touch. Staff was insanely helpful and friendly. Location could not be better if you're looking to stay in Ginza: right in the middle of all the action, and a block away from the famous ginza mitsukoshi dept store.

Very pleasant hotel. Great personnel, location, transportation, restaurant. Modern, clean and tidy rooms. Most value for money in Tokyo. I spent vacation time with my girlfriend, and the location is great. The subway elevator is 10 metres from the hotel exit, with great lines/ connections. Taxis always available, if you need them. Walking distance to lots of sights, and shopping. Highly recommended.

As you might know that Ginza is an expensive area in Tokyo, there are not that many affordable hotels. Millennium Mitsui Garden was my pick for travelling with grandparents who are in the late 70 and late 80 and everyone loved it very much! The location is very central. The Wako building junction is less than 5 min away and the newly opened Ginza Six department store is one block away. It is ideal for a more relax shopping experience with pleasant walk along the streets. There are at least 2 subway stops nearby and around 8-10 min walk to Tsukiji Fish Market.The rooms are compact (well, they are standard Japanese size) but I like the fact that they separated the toilet, the shower and the sink. So basically, you can wash your face or use the toilet while your friend take a shower. Quite a good set up!The staff are all friendly and many speaks very good English. They helped me with restaurant reservation and also airport transfers. Will definitely stay here again!

The hotel is located in Ginza on the Best Shopping Streets, the Safest Area and next to the Subway to connect all over Tokyo and Its main station to go all over Japan!My first stay at the hotel was 4 nights and we had 2 rooms. The rooms we had were very Beautiful with everything you needed and a bit more and a very comfortable bed. The problem my father is a bit claustrophobic and needed a room with more of a view which gave him more natural light. The hotel was full but the friendly front desk did everything they could to meet my fathers needs and moved him the next day and me too! The rooms were exactly the same but on another side where there was more light and my father was happy!!So, I came back again and spent my last days in Tokyo at this hotel!The Concierge helped us in many ways with information and got us tickets to see the International Sumo Championships!! A Big thanks to Shoko, Lee, Kaz and especially Koji because of you we had a Wonderful time in your hotel!All the Best from Los Angeles!Paul Taicher

This hotel was recommended by a friend. I chose it because of its location and price. I rented a car from the airport and was at one point concerned about parking. As it turned out, there was a car park just round the corner and it was very convenient but one has to be prepared that it is not cheap to park in Central Tokyo. Fortunately, most if not all car parks cap their charge. For instance, the car park where I parked charged Yen2,800 to stay for the full time between 7 am to 11 pm on the same day. Night time is Yen 1,500 from 11 pm until 7 am on the next day. Now back to the hotel, the room is small and this is as expected. Facilities however are thoughtfully and at times ingeniously laid out to give their guests maximum convenience. Free internet and free use of computer in the hotel lobby (good for checking in etc). Staff are friendly and helpful and are fluent in English. The Metro entrance is literally at the door step of the hotel. Another advantage of the hotel's location is its proximity to the Tsukiji Market, just three blocks away. Good for visitors like us who want to take breakfast there. The hotel comes with my high commendation. Unfortunately, I did not try out the hotel's only restaurant .

We absolutely loved this hotel in Ginza. The location is perfect in the shopping district and with easy access to any part of the city via train or subway. We will definitely make it out go to hotel in Tokyo!

A nice clean hotel. Staff is very nice.. It is at a very good district close to many places.. The only thing strange about the hotel is the entrance. It is not on the ground floor of the building but you get use to it..

This is a friendly and efficient hotel which feels like It was designed by people who use hotels! Our room was small but everything we needed was cleverly stored away. Comfortable bed, blackout blinds, the safe is in a drawer, and the reception desk had adaptors to lend us. The toiletries are Shiseido and generously replaced every day. We ate breakfast in the hotel once and it was a wonderful experience; the food was beautifully displayed and the breakfast room felt calm and peaceful. The staff answered any queries we had and were charming. The room was sparklingly clean. This hotel is central for major sightseeing, such as Imperial Palace (closed Mondays and Fridays), the amazing fish market, the subway is a few minutes away and shops, bars and restaurants are all nearby. A really good choice for a city stay.

My son and I stayed at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo for 4 nights. Everything about this hotel was excellent. Our superior room was large by Japan standards and very comfortable. The breakfast was more than plentiful. The staff was accommodating in every way. The hotel was conveniently located close to the Ginza upscale shopping area, back street restaurants and the amazing Tsukiji Fish Market. We also stayed at a Mitsui Garden hotel in Kyoto and would heartily recommend this brand to all travelers.

We arrived directly from the airport and really love the hotel. The rooms are spacious, the location in Ginza is extremly central, the rooms are quiet and we felt really welcome. The bed is perfect and the view stunning. We loved it!

Hotel very nice, clean and cozy. Perfect location in the Ginza district close to the shops and great restaurants. A 10 minute walk to the imperial palace. Hotel staff very friendly and efficient. Rooms always cleaned every day, complimentary water bottles and clean pajamas to wear every night. Great hotel has everything to offer. Will stay at this hotel again on my next visit to Japan. Many thanks for the great hospitality, service and fun visit to the Millennium Mitsui Garden hotel staff and management. Blessings A. Cajigal

Yes, the room is small, but it was nice, clean and stocked with EVERYTHING we needed. The staff was extremely kind to us our entire stay. Major perk was that a train station was directly underneath the hotel!!!!The breakfast bar was just, OK. Everything was pretty much cold, even the meat. Now the coffee was fresh every morning! :)This isn't the best place to stay with kids, but it's perfect for couples. Super comfy bed and pillows! WI-FI speed was great! One more thing, the only English channel on the TV was CNN. This wasn't a problem since we were out exploring most of the day, and only used our room to sleep.

Awesome people at the front desk, very helpful. right next to asukusa subway line exit 1. Room is large with soaking tub. Perfect spot for exploring the ginza district. Air conditioning was huge to have and worked awesome.

A nice hotel near train station and transport. Not a 5 star but a very good hotel with a very friendly staff typical of the whole of Japan. The food was ok but we tended to eat outside which is normally near bye. The railway stations have many good restaurants which normally doesn't tend to be far

Traveled to Tokyo with work associates and friends to do some touring before traveling Akita/Omagari for a Symposium. During a previous visit I stayed at a Mitsui Garden Hotel in Chiba prefecture.My wife and I were impressed with the quality and value and our friend recommended this one for our stay. Location is great as the Haneda Express exit is next to the Hotel making getting to the hotel easy. It is located about a block away for the Kabuki theatre and about 2 blocks off the main shopping street in Ginza. The wife and I are Starbuck-a-holics and the first one in Tokyo is located about 2 blocks away as well. The rooms are very roomy for Tokyo, a little small by Western standards but not cramped and very contemporary. Most staff spoke reasonable English and tolerated my poor Japanese. They do have a cash exchanger on the lobby to change USD and other currencies to Yen. Plenty of ATMs in the area as well. Most 7-11s have one in Tokyo.There are plenty of photos on the hotel website and posted by others here so I wont be redundant. Definitely worth a stay.

I like this hotel because placed almost at the center of Ginza area. A few steps to Ginza line subway station. Near many cafes and dept stores.The quality of the breakfast is very good. I love it. Please try their Egg benedict. so delicious.The room has modern design and quiet spacious.

review_body: Short ride away from Tokyo station with traditional shopping around. The rooms were small, but very thoughtfully laid out. We loved having the open closet in our 3 bed layout at the corner, making it very easy for a family of 3. The Shishedo face wash products were also a great with the girls in our family.

Stayed in this hotel during my business trip. I don't have much expectation as most rooms I have stayed in Japan were fairly small. I was surprised to see a sizable room that was newly furnished and clean. The lift to the train station is just outside the hotel while the main Ginza Street is a min away.

The lobby of the hotel was filled with customer's left luggage,And there is no Space to move around.The way to the elevator is also blocked by Hills of luggages,And it is not easy to get to the elevators.This Must be improved.....

I stayed at the Millenium Mitsui for three nights as a single traveller. The hotel is very conveniently located when coming from Haneda and also just a short hop to Tokyo station. It is easy to reach all parts of Tokyo by subway and there are a lot of restaurants and shops around. The rooms are not big, but decently sized for Tokyo and the price. As long as you don't travel with too much luggage, it should be fine. There are all necessary amenities and then some in the room. The design is modern and pleasant and makes most of the limited space. My room was immaculate when I arrived and was cleaned thoroughly daily. The staff is very friendly and was extremely helpful when confronted with special wishes or inquiries. They are not only polite, but genuinely seemed to care and make sure you were well taken care of. I didn't have any food at the hotel, but went to Turret Cafe for breakfast, which is a ten minute walk away and serves up a great cup of coffee. All in all, I would not hesitate to come back again and can recommend the Hotel wholeheartedly.

Very centrally located , this hotel offers a convenient choice for Tokyo travelers Right next to the Ginza subway line, very easy to reachHas a good lavish breakfast & good staff , very courteous & helpful Easy walk to fish market & other eateries for excellent sea food

A typical Japanese business hotel - small rooms, small bathroom. Don't expect much glamour there. Everything has been thought in terms of practicality although the space does not allow for much practicality. There is a breakfast downstairs and a few restaurants nearby. Ok but clearly better options in town for I guess equivalent prices.

Well-located hotel just next to a train station. Prompt service at the reception. Room is a bit small but sufficient for one. Like the toiletries provided and the drip coffee bags. Keep up the good service!

We read all the reviews and decided to stay at the Millennium Mitsui. We were not disappointed! The hotel is modern, cool, fashionable, contemporary, and spotlessly clean. The foyer was funky and pristine, the lift glided from floor to floor without so much as a whir. The toilet int he room flushed itself and the lid automatically lifter as you approached it. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. A little on the small side, as some reviewers had noted, but had everything that one needed and the shower was marvellous! We did not have a room with a view, but it didn't matter int he slightest. Ginza is a vibrant area full of great bars, restaurants and cafes. It's refined and in places reminiscent of the most exclusive shopping streets in London and LA. The breakfasts were lavish, and expansive, and everything was immensely fresh. You can't go wrong with this hotel, and I highly recommend. It's reasonably priced and an ideal entrée into this fascinating and high energy city.

review_body: As I'm here for leisure, the location of the hotel must be in close proximity to subway/trains , shopping & restaurants. This hotel has all that . It's only a 3min walk from the hotel entrance to the lift that leads to the subway. Great restos & popular stores like Matsuya & Mitsukoshi are just a stone throw away. Many designer brands are every few steps away too. Next, the size & cleanliness of the room. I'm rating this 4 stars because I feel the housekeeping is slipshod. Room size is fair. Service staffs' overall attitude of the front desk is generally good. So yes, I'd definitely stay here again .

A very good choice for those who want to explore ginza shopping and Tokyo attractions.Very accessible to subway and is surrounded with all basic requirements like restaurants and cafes.We got superior double room and was ok as we only want somewhere cozy, clean and safe to sleep :)
