princess-ftm
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: This is a very good if unexceptional hotel. Modern, clean and comfortable with good service. It lacks a bit of personality and has no bar to act as a focal point. Rooms are a good size and importantly very well soundproofed. Great location for Ginza bars and restaurants, the metro and a 15 minute walk to the Imperial Gardens or Fish market. Bottled water in the room - no charge- breakfast just ok . If you are heading out and want a quirky exceptional , choice and price, whisky bar try Bar Dice - tiny and hugely expensive - but a real sophisticated experience. Would return to the hotel again as it does the basics well for what you need from a comfortable hotel.

Rooms clean and spotless and very functioning . This is a no frills and no n fancy hotel. Staff very polite and efficient. Situated in the heart of Ginza so perfect and next to a subway stop. Tv doesn't have cable , so anyone hopping for sports or HBO will be disappointed . Room decor simple , my room was non smoking but did have a trace of cigarette smell , which is hard to get rid off. Rooms cleaned and dealt with very efficiently. No gym I think.Location perfect

Pros:1. Location - This hotel is very well located - just off the main Chuo Dori2. Free Nespresso in each room3. Staff are VERY helpful, they took our wheelchair deliveries and sent it out for return for us, made restaurant reservations for us4. Rooms are very clean and modernCons1. The rooms are just too small and you can feel claustrophobic after a while. We already got the 'bigger' rooms offered by the hotel (A corner twin) They also don't have connecting rooms so it's hard for us, a family of four, to get comfortable in this.Overall would probably still stay here, as it is quite a good deal, with a good location.

We stayed 5 nights in this Hotel close to Ginza. I expected small rooms like most hotels in Tokyo have and was nicely surprised that the shape and size of the room was really good. No need to talk about cleanness and conditions of the whole Hotel. Outstanding as at most places in Japan :-) The only thing I didn´t like too much was the breakfast buffet. Could be a bit more variety for the different type of guests. Therefore the G-Line subway station was just 100m away from the hotel.

I have gotten pretty used to staying at luxury accommodations over my years of travel, and this place is actually very nice for mid-range budget! Rooms are small, but most are in Japan. Hotel is very nice, clean, with friendly staff. Bathroom is very nice! A lot of the staff has a hard time communicating efficiently with us English-speaking guests, but nothing we couldn't understand. Best hotel you will find in this price range! Right by the Tsujiki Fish Market, and right by Ginza station.

Location 10/10. Staff all super friendly eager to assist and flexible. Facilities were v good, no gym or spa handy if thats a mandate for u. Minor drawback their payment system didn't accept NAB VISA other than that would return visit.

I stayed at this hotel for a week.It was amazing.Hotel staff was so friendly and helpful.We were trying to find recommendations for restaurants, and they spoke English well.Moreover, it was raining and they gave us umbrellas to use for free!So nice!!There's convenience store right across the street so you can get anything but they provide a very nice brand (Shiseido) lotion and personal care items.Hotel literally has towels to cotton balls and ect!I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. Centrally located but extremely quiet. No noise complaints for a light sleeper like me.

For Tokyo a good hotel. Well situated for my work. However rooms are small (most hotels in Japan). No room service. Price is high and for that price you would expect more: there is no gym, no room service, no international TV channels (except CNN), no pool and the buffet at breakfast is good but again for such a price you can stay at a Shangri-la in many Asian countries. All rooms are perfectly clean, perfectly maintained and personnel is friendly but also here limited in their 2nd language. But that's the same in the USA, there nobody speaks a 2nd language...

We recently stayed here for 4 nights.....even though our room didn't have a nice view, it was clean, comfortable and a good size by Japanese standards! Our deal included breakfast which consisted of Japanese and western buffet.....very organized and heaps of choice. The staff on reception and on our floor were all lovely and friendly! We were able to catch the Airport Limousine bus to Narita from the Marriott a short walk away.....a bonus not to have to lug cases on the train! The area seemed fairly quiet and upmarket , lots of shops and restaurants on the doorstep, and not far to walk to the Imperial Palace gardens, fish markets, and train stations.......great location ! Would love to stay here again !

Great location ! Just few steps from the Ginza metro and walking distance to Tsukiji fish market !! Around the hotel you can find many restaurants for meat and sushi lovers .The hotel stuff was amazing !!! Strongly recommended !!!!

It's a late review. My husband and I stayed at the hotel from 11th to 16th December 2016. We love Ginza and we enjoyed our stay at the Millennium Mitsui . The size of the room is good compared to the Japanese norm. I like the layout of the room with the separate toilet, shower and outside wash basin. Impressed with the efficient front desk staff and the female trainee, sorry forgot her name by now, was courteous and helpful.

We keep coming back and this was our third stay at the Millennium in Ginza. You can't beat the location if you want to be in the heart of Ginza, being directly across the road from Mitsukoshi and right above Higashi Ginza metro station and very close to Ginza metro station. Rooms are spacious by Japanese standards and the showers are amazing.

Japanese interior design is very practical and a good job is done with making these small rooms comfortable, in terms of placement and storage. There is even a bath. The hotel has Ginza at one's doorstep, including great shopping, (and good eateries in the department stores themselves), quirky laneways, and the amazing Tsukiji fish market. Two metro stations provide a lot of choice for getting around Tokyo. Arriving direct from Haneda to Higashi-Ginza was a breeze using the Keikyu line. Price of hotel was reasonable, given how expensive the competitors are...

Location was perfect, center of shopping, tourist attraction, food and restaurant within walking distance, subway station a block away. Very clean hotel, we got fresh pajamas and slippers everyday! Staff were very friendly, will go back to this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Booked it for a night on my way out of Tokyo. Luckily and unknowingly got the Pearl room which was so nice and comfortable. Not sure if other rooms are this nice but I loved the hotel. The restaurant was a disappointment as they did not have many options for breakfast buffet nor was the food labeled properly. There was pork in most items without a proper description. They also had NO bread for Breakfast which is a bit odd. Otherwise I absolutely loved my room. I'll definitely stay here again.

We had three nights in Tokyo and this hotel was so perfect. The staff amazingly nice and helpful. The breakfast really good. Nice size and comfortable room. Very clean and comfortable bed. Definitely recommend. Good for business and families. Great location, we walked and took the subway that is right adjacent to the hotel. Great great place.

This hotel is basic because it only has one restaurant and no other facilities. Products from the vendo machine are even limited. The restaurant is not recommended unless you have nowhere else to go. Breakfast is not worth the price. I doubt if the hotel even owns it. The property makes up for it with its futuristic looking lobby and very nice rooms. Make sure you check the size in square meters of the room you are booking to avoid disappointment.Various Tokyo Metro lines are within short walking distance from the hotel, one directly in front and others up to 5 minutes of walking. The Tsukiji fish market is only 2 or 3 blocks away. Also worth walking up to 15 minutes is the Yurakucho station/Marunochi area with a huge Bic Camera building, Shake Shack, and gigantic Muji and Loft stores. And of course, this hotel is in Ginza.The rooms of this hotel are very very nice and modern. Highly recommended.

Brilliant location in Ginza district with easy walks to Tokoy Station, Imperial Palace, shopping and restaurants. Highly recommend this one, friendly staff and really great value. Rooms are small as usual in Japan but very well designed and orderly. We would not stay anywhere else in Tokyo.

Great modern and clean. Nice and close to Ginza station - very central. Close to shopping and good choice of restaurants just round the corner. Breakfast is nice. Short walk to all that the Ginza district has to offer.

Rooms are modern and very clean. Beds are comfortable and they come with both soft and firm pillows. I would not say the rooms are small as there are many other smaller rooms in Tokyo but for this room rate range , I would say the size is acceptable. Good shower pressure and in room amenities. Their check in time is strictly after 3pm.I did quite a bit of research before choosing this hotel and chose this in the end due to the location. Staircase exit A5 brings you to the hotel and there's a lift nearby at A7 or A6 if you have luggage. Being on Ginza line, it brings you to Shibuya on one end or Ueno/Asakusa on the other without changing trains . It's a 5mins walking distance to Tsukiji area while about 15-20mins to the national palace gardens. Lot's of izakayas, ramen, yakitori, sushi bars nearby in the area.A very good stay and will return to stay however I would want to try out other areas as a new base for exploration

The price was what attracted me to the hotel as it was a last minute trip to Tokyo. I was really surprised by the amazing location of the hotel. It is right in the middle of Ginza and great to have as home base to walk around. The room was amazingly small BUT if you don't have a lot of luggage its not going to bother you. It's cozy. There also is a 24 hour sushi restaurant within 100 feet of the front door that was a great find the hotel told me about. If going back for a few days to Tokyo, and not needing a lot of room in a hotel, i would certainly pick this place again.

This hotel is in a fantastic location for walking around. It is close to quite a few worthy visit sites or short cab rides if you don't want to venture the subway system. The room were very well appointed with just enough space to move around. These are not rooms you can let stuff pile up or you will start tripping over things. Every question we had for the most amazingly courteous front desk was answered to our satisfaction. Most if not all front desk staff had enough command of English to meet our needs. There lots of places to dine around the hotel enough to suit all tastes and budgets.Taken as a whole this hotel and all of our experiences throughout Tokyo cleanliness is second to none on the planet. Not that you would want to but you could literally eat off the streets. There is a great local pride in cleanliness North America cabs drivers could learn some good lessons here.

I have stayed here twice in different occasions ( business and leisure). Firstly, the location is very convenient, in the heart of Ginza closed to many great restaurants, bars and shops. Easily accessible from both Haneda and Narita Aiport , the stop in front of the hotel connects directly to both airports so if you are traveling by train it will save you the hassle of carrying around your luggage while changing trains. If you are traveling by taxi, it is around 20-30 minutes from Haneda Airport.While room is small, it is very comfortable and very well designed. Room rate is very reasonable for the location and quality you get. Breakfast is delicious as well with great spread to choose from. Overall it is a great value for money and recommended for both leisure and business.

The hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to the Ginza metro link that takes you to all areas of Tokyo. The area is quite during the day and evening but not far from the shops and evening entertainment with coffee shops, quite bars and restaurants. The hotel is exceptionally clean with amazing service. The rooms are small however this is normal for Japan and everything you expect from a hotel room is there. The hotel is very well priced and I would not stay in any other district of Tokyo after finding this place. You can travel into all the loud neon light districts and then return to a peaceful location for a good nights rest. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, however if you plan to be drinking every evening and having very late nights then this hotel is not for you. If we were to return back to Tokyo, this is where we would stay again and again.

This place has a pretty average breakfast. Not the worst I have had but could not have more than a day or so in a row. rooms as stated are very small. It has no gym or pool, or any real lobby to speak of. It is very efficient The staff are very friendly and the service is good.

Would highly recommend and would be certain to return. Hotel very well situated for ginza and the fish market-before it is relocated--but it is the warm thoughtful touches of the hotel and staff that would make be a repeat visitor. There are many excellent hotels in Tokyo but this one provides fabulous service at a surprisingly reasonable price.

I was travelling in Tokyo for ten days for a business trip, and we stayed here as it's very very central to everything in tokyo. I was very happy with the hotel on nearly every front, however i do not think i would chose to stay there again, as i would prefer to be in a different area of Tokyo next time. Highlights: - Cleanliness- Bathroom size- Modern room- Comfortable bed- Good wifi- There was a small issue on arrival with my room - and the staff quickly resolved it. Low points:- I found the low English language skills of the reception staff a bit difficult. - The room was small, and luggage area smaller- The fridge was really small- I felt the price was high for a hotel with so few amenities. - The area is a little bit stale - no hip cafes, or hip shopping - a bit concrete for me. Next time, i would prefer to stay somewhere with more modern options.

The location of this hotel it's excellent. You've the metro in the same door and walking 1 minute another metro line. 15 minuts walking you're in the central train station. A lot of restaurants near and 7eleven in the corner, amazing for take away breakfast and coffe and take your train to explore this amazing country.The room was very clean and big for the normal size of rooms in tokyo. Very comfy bed. Highly recommended

Stayed for 5 nights and everything was really good. The room was great, everything was at the right place. Staff is friendly, attentive and speak good English. Location is in the "hearth" of Tokyo and near the Metro station. I will be back here again.

This hotel was in a great location. Close to many attractions, inc the subway, tsujiki fish market, cafes, 5* shopping..As Aussies trying to negotiate Ginza for a few days it was ideal. We had a beautiful big room..very unexpected..5* amenities, the mattress was a bit on the hard side but it was fine for my husband..we only ate once in the on site restaurant as we felt a little rushed and overlooked..a bit pricey also.

This hotel is right in the middle of the Ginza shopping area. The rooms are very modern and clean and the beds are really comfortable. The one disappointment was that it does not have a bar where you can go and meet people or have a drink before going out for dinner. This is a minor point and it would not prevent me from staying here again as everything else was fine.

The title sums it all up really but to help future travellers I will continue.The hotel is literally at the lift exit/entrance to Higashi Ginza station perfect when you have luggage. The Akakuso line will take you directly to Haneda airport.The hotel is opposite one of the department stores and a very short walk from Yurakucho station which is on the Yamanote line (JR line) and where you can use the Japanese Rail Pass if you have one. This is a circular line that is a great way to get around.The location makes this a great base but the hotel itself is much more than a location. The reception area is very modern and the staff is very polite and friendly and speak good English.The lift is very quiet and fast. We were on the 11th floor. Note vending machines are on the 2nd. The room was a superior one and was not very big but then not many are in cities like Tokyo. It was a very comfy queen bed. Has an excellent shower and as western stile toilet with heated seat of course....Nightwear is provided as are slippers and a good selection of amenities. Excellent coffee and tea plus water daily.Overall this is a very good hotel. Not 5 stars as it does not have all the extras that some have such as pool and the bar area is lacking but as a hotel to sleep and Base yourself at it was very good.

Just the ticket if you plan to spend most of your time exploring the city. Clean, friendly welcome, efficient if very small room. Walked to the fish market for breakfast both mornings of our stay; 2 minute walk to Kabuki theatre,easy access to subway.

Very nice location, walking distance to Ginza & Tsukiji fish marketNice modern hotel but small compact rooms although complete facitlities & toiletries.Only 1 restaurant located in the basement.Staffs are courteous, well trained & efficient.

Everything the reviews say is spot on. Great location directly above hitashi- Ginza metro (exit A1). On the Narita-Haneda airport express line. 45 to Narita- 30 to Haneda.Great location to all tourist attractions. Great food and Mitsubishi department store across the roads, heaps of family marts and great coffee shops. Good size rooms, weird bathroom setup but hey- different culture and experience. Staff were so gracious at front desk- great English.

Upon arrival at the hotel there were no person attending with the bags to help us so we have to carry our bags inside the hotel bad first impression We are family of 5,we booked a twin room for our 4nights stay upon check in, the staff said that we need to book another room for our stay because the room only accomodates 2 person, so i asked how much we need to pay for the other person because we dont want to book another room, and we will have a room change after 2 days and we have to pack our bags again and get into other room So stressing! I am pregnant and travelling and this is what we get for paying a hotel in ginza They were not really accomodating and insited that we have to book the room So at the end we avail the additional room, Room was new clean and sheets were also clean Breakfast was really not good You have to pay 2000 yen for a few dishes Few breads and 2 viands of juices They dont even offer to cook omelets for you They only have saggy scrambled eggs So i suggest never to get their breakfast and just have a good breakfast outside the hotel I would never book again at this hotel

Great location and service. Perfect spot for our first visit to Tokyo. Lots of great restaurants very close by and central to shopping with easy access to trains. The hotel amenities were great and staff very helpful. Rooms were a good size and very clean.

Very close to the metro and a short walk to the main shopping area of Ginza.Many places in walking distance to see such as the theatre and fish MarketRoom was small but everything was clean and the staff were friendly, there is complimentary drinks that are replaced everyday and free pijamesAll in all I enjoyed the stay

We stayed here in 2016 and we simply loved everything about this high-end, modernized hotel. It was a little expensive but it was worth every penny of it. The bathroom was split into two sections: toilet and shower. In addition, the spa-quality amenities, pajamas and the small details here and there made our visit just perfect.

It is a perfect accommodation as everything is so close to the hotel. Just walkkng distance to the restaurant and shops. The room is very neat, tidy and modern. And the staffs are polite. Excellent choice!

This hotel offers great accommodations, convenient location and attentive service, at a very reasonable price. The rooms' size is comfortable, if not particularly large. I travelled with my wife and two teenage daughters, and opted for two adjacent rooms, with king-sized beds each. The style is modern and practical. The hotel is located a short walk from the Tokyo fish market and the Imperial Palace, in an area that feels very much like Mid-Town Manhattan. It is also right next to a subway station, providing easy access to other destinations across Tokyo. The service was attentive and subtle. The one thing that was not optimal was the view from our room, which simply gave to another building across the street. By far the best attribute of this hotel is what you get for the price. We also stayed recently at the Tokyo Hilton, in rooms of similar size, and in a less central location, for a substantially higher price.

We stayed here for 3 nights for our honeymoon and it was a very well positioned base for us to start our Japan adventure.It's really close to a couple of metro stations and right across the road from a convenience store. You're right in the heart of the Ginza shopping district with some amazing architecture and shops to explore. The room was really comfortable and had enough space for the both of us with two suitcases. We went during the summer, so the air conditioning was a welcome relief! The tea and coffee facilities supplied in the room were very welcome and everything was cleaned and tidied whilst we were out exploring each day.

Location is fantastic. Right in the heart of Ginza and next to a taxi stand. Very clean and staff very nice. No room service and restaurant was booked for a party, but plenty of restaurants at your doorstep. Otherwise breakfast was very good, very very different from what we used to but we were pleasantly surprised how delicious everything tasted. Would definitely recommend

The absolute strength of this hotel is the location. Ginza is an upmarket area of Tokyo, fantastic for shopping and restaurants but not as noisy as Shibuya for example. The Hotel is less than 2 minutes walk from Ginza station, which allows you extremely easy access to anywhere in Tokyo. For example one subway stop to Tokyo station (on the Maranouchi line) and from there you can catch the Narita express to the airport. The Hotel is modern and whilst the rooms are small (This is the heart of Tokyo after all), the space is very well used; the bathrooms are well equipped and there is a bath in most rooms and a small desk area and reasonable hanging space. Complementary water bottles and pyjamas are provided every night.The hotel restaurant is fine (we dined in one night) but really in this area of Tokyo there are literally scores of eating establishments within a 5 minute walk.There is no Grand Lobby; this is more of a boutique hotel but staff helpful and very friendly. All of the staff speak English although only a few would be considered fluent. Free wifi of excellent speed. I was able to watch Netflix one evening without interruption when tired from a long day of travelling.I would definitely stay here next visit to Tokyo as its location overrides any minor issues.

The hotel was room was extremely small however they make great use of the space and it was perfect for us. Our room offered an incredible city view and the staff was extremely accommodating.. I got engaged while on this trip...I can't wait to go back...

My first stay in Tokyo and over New Years, a very expensive exercise. However, if I would have stayed in one of the main stream hotels, it would have cost double. This hotel is still very new, rooms are tiny (as most things in Japan) however, it is more than comfortable. Best of all, is the location! You can catch the train from and to the airport only 50 meter away. Access to any location in Tokyo is easy and it is in the most upmarket CBD area of Tokyo with all your top brand fashion outlets within easy walking distance. I can highly recommend this hotel

Staying here now. Great location with easy access to Ginza and the subway. The hotel people are friendly and the rooms new clean and comfortable. The restaurant is great, try the sushi. Location is surrounded by restaurants and cafes.

Stayed at this very nice hotel for 5 nights week between Christmas and New Years on a father-son trip to Tokyo. Got a very good deal through Travelocity.LikesGreat location in Ginza. Subway elevator (Higashi-Ginza) just outside of hotelModern, cleanComfortable single beds, not hard like most Asian hotelsSmall laptop safeHotpot, small fridgeHooked up a portable hotspot to WIRED internet which was VERY fastFriendly front deskNeutralSomewhat small room but good size for TokyoLack of amenities (workout, pool, lobby) did not bother usRestaurant in hotel, but expensive breakfast which we did not partakeDislikeNo drawers to put clothes (had to live out of suitcases)1-ply thin toilet paperNoisy (at least in our 2nd floor room), but hey it's Tokyo and not hotel's faultWe would definitely stay here again next time we are in Tokyo

The hotel has a very modern feel to it and it's location is one of its greatest strengths. It is close to both Ginza and Asakusa metro lines and also has direct access to Haneda Airport. Tsukiji, Yurokacho and Tokyo station are very walkable from this hotel. On the hotel itself, as mentioned, the decor is very modern throughout. We stayed in a superior double room and it's space is significantly larger than most other 4 stars and business hotels. Bed was comfortable. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel. Hotel staff strives to meet guests' request but this is a very full and busy hotel - the lobby is always occupied by people. A minor irritation is that the hotel did not clear our trash (medium sized boxes from packaging) throughout our 3 night stay.

This is a nice hotel, with a few minor problems with their staff's attitude toward the customers. I stayed several times in this hotel mainly due to its location. The Hotel is good and central to Ginza; however, rooms are small, but it's Tokyo.During my last visit, the restaurant staff showed no will to listen, nor to collaborate to my simple request. It felt more like someone's need to prove something other than a logical argument. Hopefully a one-off.

The hotel was clean and modern however lacked basic amenities for a 4 star hotel . For example , there is only one English Channel and nothing else . For a hotel that aim to house tourists promote tourism they accommodate the tourists who are likely not to speak Japanese . There is hardly a lobby or other amenities like a gym or sauna . The staff were not very friendly or helpful either . The rooms were smaller than most 4/5 Star hotels.Overall , I was underwhelmed and think money is better spent at a different hotel .

We stayed here one night before heading back to the US. This hotel is beautiful! It is modern, clean, and bright. We stayed in a deluxe corner room, which was good size for 2 people, and had an amazing view. The location could not be better. Breakfast was so-so, and wifi was not great in the rooms. But we wished we could have stayed here longer, and we will definitely come back!

The hotel is located right next to Higashi Ginza station (if you use the lift it is literally about a 30 second walk - bizarrely it looks further away on google maps). It is also very easily located from Haneda airport, using the Keikyu line (you can also buy in the airport 1 day / 2 day tube passes with the train ticket add-on from the airport - as this is not otherwise part of the tube pass).Rooms are not massive, but are certainly adequate. I would describe the hotel as functional, and good value. An excellent choice, if you are looking to stay on the East side of Tokyo away from the craziness of Shinjuku and Shibuya. Tip: you CAN buy train tickets to Kyoto (plus we bought a Haruka line ticket) in Haneda airport on the arrivals floor. We also found using ATM (or ordering cash online before traveling) was cheaper than the change places in Japan.

Perfect location in ginza, in the main street. Next to a convinient store, 10 m to a train station. Good breakfast, wifi is a bit slow though. Service is excellent. The room is pretty big. Just perfect for a familly of 2 + 2 kids. 50 m walk to a 24 hours sushi restaurant.

I had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. My room was a superior one, on 14th floor. It was silent and clean. Althorugh a visible effort to optimise the space, as usual in Japan, the size of the room was adequate. Complimentary mineral water, coffee, and tea. Large TV screen. The bed was OK. Wi-Fi was free, fast and reliable. The staff was kind and quality of their English was above the standard.The location is perfect, 30 meters from Higashi-Ginza station (Exit A1), and close to the centre of the district. I had no opportunity to taste the breakfast (not included in the room rate).Although I stayed there for leisure, I think this hotel is perfect for business trips as well.

In the middle of Ginza where everything is a 10 minute or less walk. Very modern with attention to detail and thoughtfully designed rooms. Rooms were bigger than expected with a separate toilet and immaculately cleaned. We've been lucky to get a room at the end of the corridor so it was quiet for us and can't comment on sound proofing. Extremely helpful staff. Restaurant recommendations by staff were honest and what we asked for. I'd definitely stay again. Restaurant downstairs was ok. We tried the lunch buffet which was decent but nothing to write about and is what you'd expect at a hotel in Asian.

Located closer to higashi-ginza station rather than ginza. I didn't take hotel breakfast but had no problem finding places for breakfast nearby. Hotel restaurant was nice but fairly expensive. Room beautiful and well sized for Tokyo. staff very friendly and helpful.

This was my fourth time in Tokyo. Since I know the city much better now, I decided to stay in Ginza, which is one of my fav. neighborhood in Tokyo. It has plenty of bars, restaurants and shops. It's very close to Shimbashi station or to Yurakucho, where you can find multiple different options for lunch or dinner. From the subway station, you can reach all the main sights in Tokyo without any trouble. The hotel itself was very comfortable, clean and quiet. It offers a very good Japanese breakfast. In short, having tried different hotels in different areas, I would definitely pick this one again.

Located in Ginza, alot of good food around. Room is well maintain, clean, silent, staff are very friendly. Most of them can speak multiple language. Name your problem and they mostly can help you. Highly recommended

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I think it is great for solo travel, couples, and friends. The rooms lean more on the small side, but you will not feel claustrophobic. I had to do a little business work while there and that was fine for a couple of hours. It may get a little cramped if you have to work longer than that. The rooms are also well maintained, beds are comfortable, and the room was quiet. The staff's English is very good. I had no problems getting directions or recommendations. If you enjoy shopping, this is the area for you. All of the best shops and the Tsukiji fish market are within a few minutes of walking. There is limited nightlife in this area, but the metro station below the hotel makes it very easy to navigate to other well-known districts.

A nice Hotel with one of the nicest staff. Polite, down to earth and ready to help. The food depends on your taste. If you are adventurous then you will enjoy the food. The food tends to be very exotic and fatty at times

Al Ain, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Very conveniently located in the middle of Ginza. Was my first time in Tokyo and was travelling with a friend who visits Tokyo often. She recommended the place and booked the hotel. The location's pretty much unbeatable and price was very fair. Stayed for 2 nights and have no complaints.We had a double room - it was quite small but very cozy, modern and clean. The lobby was bright and very well furnished. Overall a great stay and would recommend to anyone!

Best night sleep we had in Japan in the comfy beds and pillows. Great service, friendly staff, clean rooms, fancy toilets (love these in Japan). Good location in Ginza close to all the shops. It's about a 10min walk from the nearest JR station though, and around 20min walk from Tokyo station. Very close to a subway station though if you're not travelling on a JR pass. Would recommend if you can afford it!

The hotel is well located and the rooms although small (nowhere to put a second suitcase) are very well appointed, clean and well looked after. The biggest weakness is the lack of anywhere to sit (the rooms are too small to have a comfy chair) and have a drink/do emails/chat. The only communal area is the all day diner and guests are not encouraged to linger. We felt it was very fully priced (even using a booking website), and breakfast costs extra ¥25,000 (£25) a head. However it seems very fully booked and busy so maybe others don't feel the same way. The hotel is in a reasonably convenient area, but I think we would try elsewhere next time.

We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our 3 week trip having previously stayed 6 nights in Shibuya at the beginning. This is a great base to explore the Ginza shopping area & also easy to get to other areas such as Asakusa by sub way. Our room was tiny, the smallest of our trip so was really only suitable for a short stay. It is new & modern & has an unusual bathroom set up with the handbasin in the hall, toilet separate & the shower on the floor beside the bath! We did not eat at the hotel, there are plenty of dinner options nearby but less so for breakfast. The concierge directed us to a cafe for afternoon tea that offered good drip coffee & nicely brewed tea (with leaves). Like everywhere in Japan tea & coffee was expensive $7AUD. Forget about cappuccinos - we had one decent one in 3 weeks! Tip: bring tea & coffee bags from home.

This hotel is in a terrific location. Right in the heart of Ginza. Close to restaurants, transportation and shopping. For this I would highly recommend. The room was pleasant. Even if our view was of a stone wall.However, now for the bad points. Firstly, this was not cheap. We were there 6 nights and were given a room looking onto a wall. Okay, I can live with that. But what no one says in their reviews is that the beds are hard as rocks. I contemplated sleeping on the floor instead - thought it might be more comfortable. Also, the pillows were extremely uncomfortable. I had a hard time sleeping the whole time I was there. The hotel is extremely convenient for getting around, but it lacks any kind of ambience. The hotel lobby is small and was always, always crowded with people and stored luggage. This is my third time in Tokyo and I enjoyed the convenience of this hotel's location, but I could never recommend it to friends going to Tokyo. I have to say I didn't get all the positive reviews, to me it was kind of a glorified hostel. I saw some reviews of Nespresso machines, stocked free mini bars, tubs, views and so on. We had none of this and we paid an average of $260 Canadian dollars a night and we were there 6 nights. Don't know how much you would have to pay for these upgrades. I would recommend shopping around instead of staying here!

I visited Tokyo for the first time in Feb 2016 and was recommended by my friend to stay at Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel due to its excellent location, Ginza. The hotel is located just above the Tokyo Metro station and also near the Tsukiji Fish Market. The layout of the room is very efficient, the toilet cubicle and the bathroom are separate, the wash basin is outside the bathroom which made it convenient for room sharing. The room is small which is expected. The hotel staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Overall was a good experience and I would stay at this hotel again.

If you choose the lower room rate, you might get a room facing a wall, which really was fine with me, but it was dark versus rooms which faced the streets and were very sunny. The sink is outside the toilet and shower area, so your travelling companion will have to be comfortable with that situation. We were on the 10th floor and it was very quiet despite the many families with children. The lobby was busy but everyone would retreat to their rooms and the hallways were quiet. We were never bothered by housekeeping early in the morning either. I would stay here again. So convenient.

Ginza is the perfect location for us and this hotel is an answer to our every specification. The rooms are stylish and the design makes excellent use of space. Amenities were excellent and the Toto toilet alone makes Japan worth visiting. Service was excellent from the moment of check-in. We were upgraded to a lovely corner room with a fabulous view. Hotel is a quick walk to Tsukiji Market and the subway stop half a block away is serviced by 3 major lines which makes it a breeze to go to most places we wanted to. Only disappointment was the breakfast which in our experience was not comparable to the other hotels we have stayed in Japan. The plus is there's so much food wise in Tokyo, one won't go hungry. The Nespresso Machine in the room is always well stocked and the contents of the Mini Bar are complimentary. This will be our Tokyo Hotel henceforth.

Me and my family stayed here for 6 nights. We had two superior rooms which were both great. Quite large with 2 separate queen size beds, unfortunately they were quite hard. Nice, clean and great hospitality. Breakfast might have been the only downside. Quite expensive and mostly suitable for asian quests. However great location. Close to subway and shoping in Ginza. Easy to get to by subway directly from Narita airport.

Arrived at Haneda airport and took the train direct to the Higashi Ginza station. I emerged from the underground and the entrance to the hotel was literally right behind me. After an easy checkin with very helpful and friendly staff, I headed out for a quick sushi dinner at a 24 hr sushi restaurant 3 minutes away by foot. The location is ideal, right on the Ginza, close to subway stations. The 83 item breakfast buffet was fantastic. The room had two single beds and a very modern and clean bathroom with separate toilet and shower/bath rooms. It was a quick 15 minute walk to Tsukiji Fish Market. There are so many restaurants within walking distance, coffee shops, shopping. The location is ideal.

Very nice hotel, centrally located in Ginza, close to many stores, shops, and restaurants. Subway station right outside the door. Lovely rooms facing Ginza, huge windows, well furnished, bath, toilet and powder room separate. Good service at front desk.

Literally above a subway station so fantastic location..right amongst a huge selection of mid range restaurants..staff very helpful..the beds were comfortable and while the rooms are somewhat small they were very well designed and it wasn't something that you noticed after a couple of hours..walk in shower

Great location for shopping in Ginza. Convenient to the metro. Had a twin superior room on the 14th floor which had a nice view of Mitsukoshi department store. Small empty refrigerator with complementary water daily. Smart toilet was definitely a bonus feature. The room is small but doable for two. The shower exits directly to the sink area which is open to the room however there is a curtain you can draw for privacy. Some noise from ambulances nightly. The hotel does not have a gym or spa. It is very accessible to many restaurants. My only gripe is that the housekeeping was subpar. For the price that was paid for the room, the room should have been cleaned pristinely. I don't think the sheets were changed except for the last day of my week stay. Some days dirty cups were not collected and new ones were not provided. The toilet area was not cleaned daily. The room was not adequately vacuumed or dusted daily. There is no concierge service for travel inquiries although the front desk is helpful with questions. Would stay again for convenience to shopping areas. The airport limousine bus does not stop here and the closest station is Marriott courtyard which is a 5-8 minute walk.

Hotel is locate close to Ginza department stores and right next to underground. Many restaurants just a minute away. Airport shuttle bus also stop nearby.Room is modern, tidy and clean, however not big. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Excellent value for money as hotels in Ginza are not cheap.

I have stayed in Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo for 5 nights. I love this hotel coz my hotel room is very clean, comfortable and smart design. Housekeeping staff did very good job, they cleaned my room very clean and tidy. Moreover, the hotel has a good location in Ginza. I could very easy to access any stores in Ginza, very convenient to buy anything I want in here. I will come back to stay next time. Thanks for your service!

As an interior designer, I was attracted to the design of the hotel by the photos online. In person, it did not disappoint. We were two adults plus a toddler and stayed in a Superior Twin Room with a crib. The beds were actually Double/Full size which was a nice surprise when we arrived. While the room was small (we have stayed in much smaller in New York) it was very well appointed so it had all of the amenities we needed, and the well thought out floor plan allowed for all of the appropriate storage space to make the stay comfortable. The design and décor is modern and chic. Our little one loved looking out the window to the busy street with neon lights. We had a higher level room and even saw the Tokyo Skytree in the distance and the Kabuki theater just down the street. Before our arrival, Guest Services communicated quickly and easily in order to coordinate the crib and appropriate room size for our family. They were really great in working out the details. There is a money exchange machine right in the lobby of the hotel which made it very easy for us to get cash. The location was perfect for our low-key, non-nightlife, shop happy family. Other parts of town felt either too crowded, too young, too noisy, too ____ , so I was pleased we chose to stay in Ginza. Public transportation was very convenient to and from the hotel so we could get to our destinations quickly and easily. The Higashi Ginza station entrance is outside the front door. The Ginza station entrance is one block away so you have access to several subway lines in the area. Mitsukoshi Department Store is across the street. It has a fantastic food hall in the basement, so grab some food and bring it to the department store’s rooftop terrace to enjoy. The baby loved running around up there with other babies doing the same. For dinner options, there were so many restaurant choices in the area. One word of advice, while English is spoken frequently and fairly well, it is not always guaranteed or at times may be a bit broken with the front desk staff. We had some miscommunications when asking questions. Try to come prepared with either a form of translation (app, maps, or a dictionary) or be ready to work a little to get the answers your need. After all, we are visitors there not the other way around. That said, we had an issue with the wi-fi device we ordered through an outside company, and one of the concierge took the time to call the Japanese help line and sort out the issue for us. It was a tremendous help. In all the hotel worked out perfectly for us. It was really wonderful. I would definitely stay there again.

A modern hotel in the renowned Ginza area. The spacious double room was great, although not sure if this is normal for rooms in the Ginza area. Close to the fish market, and the luxury shops are only 2 blocks away.

I had a short trip with my wife and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Definitely good value for money. For location, it is just next to the subway station, namely Higashi-Ginza, which is one stop away from Ginza station. The area provides you with plenty restaurants and departments. The famous fish market, Tsukiji, is within 10-15 mins of walk. In Tokyo, many hotels of this price range are quite old and need major renovation. But this one is very new. The size is also good. You don't expect a huge room but it is really comfortable for 2 people. One reminder: most rooms do not have much view from the window.

I chose this airport because it was close to my meetings, and frankly, it was one of the lower cost options I could find in grossly overpriced Tokyo. Well they eventually got me for $25 for the very pathetic, thoughtless, and limited breakfast....but the closet sized room was more of a problem...the worst of it all...is that this hotel practically sent the message...Japanese Only...first time I have visited a hotel in a major city with NO INTERNATIONAL CHANNEL...no BBC, or CNN...Nada....that sucked...so basically, I did not like this hotel...the Wifi worked...so that saved me from total misery.

This was one of the more reasonably priced hotels and it was completely worth it. While the room was small, the amenities and comforts were great. Very comfortable bed, quiet confines, and everything you need for a good night sleep. The location is excellent, too ... close access to the fish market, the subway, the bullet train, conference center and shopping district. I highly recommend.

Situated in the heart of Ginza - an upscale shopping and business district of Tokyo - the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel is ideally situated for luxurious shopping, with Chanel, Cartier, VC&A and the likes just round the corner. It is also literally sitting on top of the Higashi-Ginza (translated: East Ginza) underground station ~ turn right upon exit from the hotel and it's the elevator of Exit A1, right there! So it is also a good starting point for exploring East Tokyo by underground. The hotel itself is simple in terms of facilities. There is only one restaurant and no room service, and only an empty in-room fridge. The "business centre" is a single desktop computer, with printer, located opposite to one of the elevators, with no chairs nor privacy. The check in staff is friendly courteous and polite, as is the norm in most Japanese cities. The room I took is relatively large in Japanese standards, with a 3/4 length bath tub inside a shower cubicle (with hand held and rain showers) that is a delightful surprise in Japanese hotels (6-star hotels excluded), as well as a two seater sofa, which is very rare. The toilet is a fully automated monster that does nearly everything you need when using a toilet, and actually is quite enjoyable to use once you get over sussing out the buttons on the remote control. Clothing space is small but adequate, with other usual inroom amenities. The bed is actually quite big and very comfortable but more points would be awarded if different styled pillows could be provided. The walls of the toilet and shower rooms are made of semi transparent glass so try not to switch on the light when you use the toilet in the middle of the night or you risk waking your roommate (the toilet actually has a "nightlight" that lit up when you walk into the toilet so there should not be any problems in doing your business in the middle of the night). I have spent more time talking about the room cos really there is not much else to talk about the hotel.Being in Ginza there are good and bad points. It is very safe and relatively quiet at night, with excellent luxurious shopping, and relatively close to Tokyo station which is the main station inbound from the two airports. But it is also far away from where-it-all-happens areas such as Shinjuku, Harajuku and Rappongi.Overall this is a good hotel to stay in, but veering on the expensive side (for US$300 a night there are plenty more better choices in less upscale areas). Remember to take a stroll around the side streets neighboring the hotel ~ there are lots of wonderful restaurants in those streets.

Great location, in central Tokyo, right next to the metro station. Very cool design of the rooms, excellent amentities and friendly staff. We didn't try the breakfast but the meals at the hotel restaurant were good.

Check in / out - smooth and easy. No hassle at all. Location - perfect. There are 2 subway stations very very very close to the hotel (assuming you take the right exit) which makes the commuting around Tokyo fairly easy. Staff - kind, welcoming and attentive. The people we had interaction with had sufficient English skills, and were able to provide us with relevant information. Room - modern design, perfect use of space. Our room was on the 6th floor. Very clean. Housekeeping staff made a perfect job every single day. The room was spotless. Our TV had CNN in English. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Great shower. 2 complimentary bottles of water were provided to us on a daily basis. Cleaning - as previously mentioned, the entire property (our room included) was spotless. There is a currency exchange machine in the hotel's lobby. It does not offer the best rate, but it is very convenient and easy to use. We received an English newspaper (the Japan times) every morning to our door step. The hotel was perfect to our needs, and we would highly recommend it for travelers who want to be based in Ginza.

Ginza is the buzzing shopping area in Tokyo and the hotel is as central as you can get. It's a top notch hotel with one of the best breakfasts I have ever had - super fresh sushi and a wide selection of other choices. The rooms are super modern!

.Very nice hotel, cleanconvenient access to subways nice area.Rooms nicely equipped Bathroom is the Japaniz style .Size of room is a little bit squis mainly more storage places could be helpful. Recommended

First off, the negative - expect v small room. Was a bit of a shock at first but we quickly got use to it. Location is brilliant. At the heart of Ginza which is the best quarter in Tokyo, walking distance from the fish market. Service is good, efficient, very Japanese. Not all the receptionists speak good English. No gym, good free wifi. Good price.

Try it after its new built. Very good location as it is built at the core of Ginza. However, rooms are small, full of smoking smell even non smoking room, noisy at the restaurant at the basement, and no space for stay in travellers to eat in, look like for most of the local people to reserve. Not impressed.

This is a great, affordable business hotel in the heart of Ginza, walking distance to Tokyo Station and super close to Tsukiji Market. Staff were incredibly helpful and even upgraded our room when we asked nicely. The room itself was well-appointed, had a great view, and was relatively spacious as Tokyo hotel rooms go. Highly recommended!

Stayed here on our last night in Japan. We got off the train from Kyoto and it was so convenient - 10 mins walk max. Spacious rooms and very spacious bathroom (for Tokyo!). Everything was clean and extremely comfortable, beds were great and no noise at all. Great value for money!

This is a pretty good hotel - very well located (access to metro and fish market). Rooms are very small but clean and the bathroom setup is very good. No real complaints and decent value for Tokyo. Not much to do in the area at night but easy to take metro to other places.
