parkynyc
New York City, New York

review_body: We were absolutely happy with every aspect of this hotel and if we ever come back to Tokyo, we stay only there. The room was clean and modern, breakfast was delicious and the location is great. It was very, very nice.

This hotel is located perfectly. Ginza line metro out the front (so minimal metro line changes to most of the destinations you're going to want to see), walking distance to tsukiji outer fish market and the heart of Ginza (great nighttime window shopping with high end fashion brands), across the road from Mitsukoshi shopping centre (basement food area of scrumptious desserts !), and just up from Kabuki Theatre. Plenty of food options nearby (see my other postings), clean, new hotel (larger rooms than most Tokyo hotels) - can't ask for more than this. Great value for money.

A very clean and safe hotel, near mrt stations, shopping area and walking distance to the Tsukiji fish market which is a great place to have breakfast or lunch. The view is especially beautiful at nighttime.

Our group of 6 stayed 3 nights in 3 rooms on the eighth floor. Although the rooms had windows, they faced an interior space with solid walls on the opposite side, so privacy was not an issue. These rooms are labeled central rooms on the hotel website. They are small. As you enter, on the right there is a short length of an open area for hanging clothes, the sink, and the desk. On the left, the Toto toilet cabin more or less lines up with the sink, followed by a shower stall. There was a short length of sofa and then the king bed. The space between the bed and the wall is maybe 12", so it is somewhat inconvenient for whoever gets that side of the bed. The mattress was comfortable. The room was always clean and made up. We received excellent service from (forgive the spelling if I got it wrong) Yusuke Ozaki (YO) when we checked in. His english was great. Two in our group wanted to see a Summo fight, and visit the fish market (very near) so they had lots of questions and requests that YO answered and followed up on. Regarding our breakfast question, YO pointed us to the Denny's 3 blocks away, and we ate there one day. The Pronto restaurant about a block way was also a good breakfast option. The other interactions we had with the front desk staff were also fine. The housekeeping staff in the morning did not fail to greet us (in Japanese). Access to the hotel rooms required the room key in the elevator. The hotel has a very good map of the immediate area that it makes available. There is a post office no more than 3 blocks away where ATM machines were available. Taxis were available waiting outside the hotel, very convenient the day we left and had to go to Tokyo station nearby. From the two subway stations near the hotel, the Asakusa, Ginza, Hibiya and Marunouchi lines could be taken, so it was easy to go wherever our schedule took us.

Room was good size and had many toiletries provided. All the things you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Location was good and near the JR and Kansai Airport Express from Narita. Close distance to many eateries and shopping at Ueno area. Highly recommended if you would like to stay in a quite area away from Shinjuku.

My family stayed for 7 nights at Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo. The hotel was perfectly and centrally located near subway station,shopping area and restaurants .Walking distance to everything ,Hotel staff are very courteous and helpful. Rooms are clean and well organized .The hotel is sound proof . Almost everything you needed as a traveller is provided. Breakfast buffet was greatThis hotel gives great attention to details to make their guest happy and comfortable. Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo and their staff is the BEST. Thank you for making our holiday in Tokyo so wonderful .Thank you Tripadvisor . We choose Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo based on your Tripadvisor guests reviews .

Lovely hotel and the reviews dont lie. The hotel is well appointed with well furnished rooms that have good views and well appointed.The staff are friendly and loved the place.The breakfast looked good but was quite pricey at 2400 yen but you got a full buffet. Its a centrally located and we thought it was a good choice for that. There are lots of small local eateries worth trying.

We stayed 2 nights at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel. When you walk in, the front desk/reception area is large and very futuristic looking with the wall behind the front desk constantly changing colors. The front desk staff speak excellent English and were very helpful helping make restaurant reservations for us and providing information. Nice elevators, futuristic lighting in the hallways, going up to a very modern room. Decent amount of space for a Japanese hotel room. Liked the bed mattress and pillows (older Japanese hotels tend to have hard mattresses, but this was comfortable). Very nice bathroom area with good shower and bath. Lots of toiletries and extras provided. We also thought the toilet was pretty neat. When you open the door to the toilet area, the toilet seat lid opens up automatically and the base of the toilet lights up with a blueish glow. Almost like it was alive. Also had all the other bells and whistles like heated seat, bidet, the butt shower, etc. The hotel is only a few minutes away from the Ginza and Higashi Ginza lines, so very easy to get to the hotel and get around town. We enjoyed our stay and thought the price was pretty reasonable. Would definitely stay here again.

This is an excellent boutique hotel close to everything. Walking distance to great shopping centers, foods and train/bus. While it's a little small comparing to western standard hotels, it's still very comfortable with all the 4-stars amenities.

The Millenium Mitsui was a great stay. The room was modern, stylish, and clean, the staff friendly and attentive, and the location great. It's an easy walk over to the fish market, to the Tokyo Metro or JR lines, or to the stores of Ginza. If you're in to depachika dining there are some great options nearby too.

This hotel has a great buffet breakfast and a friendly professional staff. I would highly recommend the hotel as well as the Ginza area as a place to stay. We liked that it was just a few minutes walk to the Tsujiki Market although I understand it is moving from this location.

The metro subway station Higashi-Ginza is located right next to the hotel's entrance. There is a direct train from the Haneda airport to the hotel (Keikyu line to Asakusa line - cost ¥570 per pax). Going to the airport was a bit complicated, since there is a change of train from Keikyu station 11. Note: Pls ask the reception for specific instructions if you're taking the train to the airport.The hotel is surrounded by food & shopping outlets. But majority of the shops close at 9PM. There are 2 convenience stores nearby the hotel, one closes quite early & the other opens 24-7. Our superior room has a modern touch to it and it's quite small. We have a window view to the streets, which made the room a lot better! There is a separate bathtub and a shower area. Honestly, it took us a while to get used to the room size. Overall, we are happy with our 5 nights stay here but we prefer a bigger room for our next stay.

Stay 3 night with my wife, the location is extremely convinence as it is close to major department store in Ginza (walking distance) and good restaurants, the overall condition of the hotel is acceptable . A hotel highly recommend for people who want to do make shopping trip in Tokyo.

Great location, really nice bathrooms, quiet, helpful staff and very clean. Book early for some good rates. Two subway lines are less than five minutes walk and if you're inclined you can even walk to/from Tokyo station when you arrive or depart on the Narita Express. Loads of restaurants and convenience stores in the area too. Not to mention shopping.

Hotel was fabulious! Nothing bad to say. Clean, attentative and helpful staff, excellant location. We were here for a family wedding in another part of Japan. The family all met here and we will travel together to our next destination. The hotel is convient to the subway, fish market and Kubiki. We will stay here again if our travels bring us back to Tokyo.

It was a great stay. You have the asakusa A train station right next door (which you should use coming from Haneda Airport or Airport Limousine Bus if from Narita Airport). You have the main shopping area of Ginza a 2 min walk which is beautiful and SAFE!! Then on the opposite side a 7 min walk the Fish Market which you have to go before 9AM so you can get the freshest sushi straight out the auction from the morning. The room is small but comfy once you get used to it. The staff was really nice and English speaking when it came to asking questions about attractions and taxis. I really liked this hotel and I will book with them again if I visit beautiful Tokyo in the future.

Clean and simple rooms. Quiet. Great service from staff. Separate shower and toilet rooms. Fun automatic toilets. No hotel bar which is not a big deal. Plenty of great shopping and eating in the area.

First time to Tokyo, great location. Train station is directly below hotel for the Haneda Int Airport Express Train. New rooms, small but very compacted. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. The website mentions FREE in room Internet, but it's extremely slow. Had to spend most of the time in the lobby. Close to the Tsukiji markets and great restaurants.

Excellent hotel, with fantastic location, super sized rooms considering the usual tiny hotels in Japan, and great service. Right next to the subway for easy access anywhere and surrounded by great variety of restaurants and shopping. Would definitely stay here again

First the location its excellent rooms clean only problem its the breakfast its really not for Muslim and very small choice of food staff good space small but in Tokyo its normal we stay in room 914 from 30 Jul to 6 August 2016 not much TV channels

Nice hotel. Room are on the small side, very clean and service is excellent. Location is very convenient, walking distance to 3 metro stations, great shopping, great restaurants. Very close to Tsukiji Market..

Great location – next to the big shops of Ginza and close to Higashi Ginza metro station and a short walk from Ginza. Easy to get around the rest of the city from here. A short walk to the famous fish market, which is a must visit place! Tokyo’s hotels are famous for having small rooms, I found the room here to be of decent size. Great power shower – hot, hot water! Super modern toilet. Lots of amenities; all toiletries provided, iron, hairdryer, kettle, cups, tea, coffee making stations, flat screen TV and free wi-fi. Great staff – friendly and helpful. If this had been run by one of the big international names, this would have been far more expensive.

Minutes away from everything....shopping restaurants, metro....small rooms but cozy and clean...free wifi...ginza is a marvelous area to stay in Tokyo...you have all brand name stores within walking distance

The Hotel is located in a very good location, walking distance from the main street in Ginza The rooms size is dissent. very clean. bathroom is very small. In the TV I could not find any station in English The front desk team is very polite, my agent booked me by mistake a smoking room, although the hotel was fully booked, the front desk team did whatever they could to help me.The breakfast is a buffet. Cost around 2500 Yan. In my opinion the it is not a value for the price However, around the hotel, there are lots of coffee shops

Pros:-Good location, right in the center of Ginza. -Metro station exit next to hotel-Just few minutes walk from Fish market.-Lots of restaurants around-Friendly staff.-Speedy service during checkin and checkoutCons:-Compact room.

Location is great - in the mix of modern, cool streets with upscale hi-end shops, few blocks to the fish market.Rooms are spacious enough with the gorgeous view of the Ginza streets. Excellent amenities, good soundproofing and room darkening (you can get a good night sleep). Amazing serves. Clean, modern, comfortable. I would definitely recommend to pick this hotel.

Stayed here for five nights and loved it. Very easy to get to the different neighborhoods of Japan: Shibuya, Harajuku, Ueno and Asakusa are all accessible on the Ginza line, which is a two minute walk from the hotel. Ten minute walk to the Tsukiji Market as well. The room was great, very nice sized. Highly recommend for any travelers to Tokyo.

The location is unbeatable - right in front of the METRO Station, that links you to all the major lines. There is also a designated taxi stand in front of the hotel, to allow for easy accessibility.The room itself was compact, but well designed...it's very new, and efficiently laid out. Nice comfortable bed (although the pillow was a bit too soft and was not as firm as I would have liked), great toiletries (Shisheido facial products!), laptop safe, and excellent views. Service was excellent - staff were actually warm (and not "robotic", which is used to describe other hotels) - they were very informative about the area, and no language barrier here.

This was my second time at this hotel. The experience has been consistently excellent, but you can find just as good hotels elsewhere in Tokyo for a more reasonable price. Staying in Ginza is convenient for shopping and overpriced restaurants. You can just as well stay in less glitzy locations and take the subway to Ginza. One advantage though is that the hotel is about 10-15 min walk to the Tsukiji Fish market. Get up early and enjoy some of the best sushi that can be had.

No complaints about this hotel. The location was excellent, everything looked almost brand new, and we couldn't have been happier staying here, which was a huge contrast compared to Shinjuku. Staff were friendly and helpful.

We stayed for 3 nights . It located in city centre of Tokyo,Ginza . An elevator from higashiginza metro station directly to the hotel entrance, very convenient travel by metro. Check -in and check out was efficient and friendly. The room was not big, but adequate in japan standard. The pillow provided was wonderful.The window sound proof was good , I could have a sound sleep.The toilet was fancy and very clean. The bathroom shower was powerful. The wifi was strong. Lot of eateries and shops near-by. The down side was the buffet breakfast just basic japanese style.

Pros: less than five minutes walk to heart of Ginza, subway station is right at the door steps of the hotel, friendly staff, clean room.Cons: small room, no room service, house keeping service ends at 1PM, some staff speak little EnglishOverall a gem in Tokyo if you prefer location over room size.

The hotel is conveniently situated near two Metro stations and with an abundance of big stores nearby. Front staff very helpful. Room somewhat bigger than many Japanese hotel rooms; there WAS space to put down two bags which is not always the case. Only considerable downside is that breakfast hours are very strict and finish quite early for travelers who have just flown from Europe. We JUST scraped in but saw two people turned away a couple of minutes later. They were understandably not happy.

Great location with the shops of Ginza and two subway stations directly outside hotel. Room is compact but marvelously designed to take every advantage of the space. Many thoughtful amenities are provided. Service was to standard. Would definitely return!

Stayed here for 7 nights and booked 3 rooms for a party of 7 people. We thought that we could request for an extra bed for 1 of the rooms. They have NO extra bed policy.therefore,we had to open another room. Some issues during check-in and all were sorted out by the Manager, Mogi, who was very patience and tried to accommodate all our requests. Keep in mind this is newer than the Courtyard Marriot next door, which we have stayed at before. The rooms are very compact, but efficient. It is 8 mins walk to the Tsukiji market, so becomes convenient as a breakfast option when most of Ginza is still close. There is no Airport Bus Stop at the hotel, so need to alight on the Mariott Ginza stop which is a 5min walk. right across the hotel is Mitsukoshi Department store, and right behind it is already the main Ginza strip with Uniqlo, Itoya, etc. Location, Location, Location! There were lots of Chinese Tour Groups during our stay, thus, it became very rowdy. Breakfast option is limited too, but, as mentioned, breakfast in Tsukiji in the morning is still highly preferred and more authentic. This hotel has an elevator that connects directly to the Higashi-Ginza Metro line, and a block from it is the Ginza Marounouchi Line.

Good place to stay. Comfortable and cosy. Not huge but fully equipped with everything you need. Restaurant open all day long. Food ok. Room very fully and well furnished. Perfectly located in Ginza downtown. By the side you also have a wellness center and spa not belonging to the hotel but of easy access from there. Recommended for stay in Tokyo.

Perfect location to roam around Ginza as well as the whole city of Tokyo since the metro exit is right in front of the hotel - literally eight (?) steps from the hotel entrance. Modern decor both inside and outside the room, which is equipped with the latest bathroom technology (i.e., the closed toilet lid of, of course washlet, opens and closes by sensor, etc), making the stay ever more pleasant.

Thank you for the amazing time during our 6 days stay. The service and politeness from all the staffs are just AMAZING. The location of the property is close to everywhere (shopping center, restaurants, fish market, subway stations ). Thank you for the great hospitality and looking forward to stay there in future.

locate just in front of Tokyo metro exit. Superior Double Room is extremely spacious compare to Tokyo hotel standard. A separation room of toilet from baht room quite useful for couple travelers. Room is clean, bed is comfort, large TV screen equipped. and Speedy Internet speed is free. This hotel would be one among short list when I return to stay in Tokyo.

Room is adequately spacious. Hotel is situated 3 minutes walk away from Ginza Station and right next to Higashi-Ginza Subway station.Modern designer hotel. Check in was smooth. There is also a currency exchange machine in the lobby (though the rates were not the best). Will recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to travel to Tokyo!

We stayed 3 nights, July 10-13. The modern and neat design of the lobby impressed me !the room was cozy, small around 200sq. ft. ,with the well clever design which made good use and organized all the available space . When the toilet door is opened it triggered the modernized automatic lift up toilet seat cover,fun! It is happy to have English TV channels , CNN and FOX!The location is great! The metro A1 exit is just on the front side. Mitsubishi dept. store is right across the street. It takes 15 min walk to to fish market and 5-10 min walk to Kabuki theatre . There is a airport shuttle bus stop located 2 blocks away. The hotel staffs speak pretty good English no and eager to help out!I paid 200.0/night in which breakfast wasn't included(charging 23.00 each). I tried out once and we were disappointed with the selection of the foods. It's the first time I didn't enjoy the breakfast served in Japanese hotels since 1982!In the future, if I stay in Gina area I will choose this hotel but skip the breakfast!

I can't think of a better location--in the heart of the Ginza, within a block of Mitsukoshi dept store, Kabuki theatre, 4-square intersection. Atop one major subway line, a block away from another. Staff was very helpful an accommodating, room was not large but well-designed, fancy Toto toilet. Clean, nicely decorated. Onsite restaurant not particularly good but OK if you don't need to go far for breakfast or lunch. Varied clientele--Japanese business types, families, foreigners. English proficiency was pretty good. Free wi-fi, refrigerator, safe. Very highly recommended.

I was pleasantly surprised with this facility: Location, simply fantastic, level of service: superb (accommodating to very particular needs), very modern style and in room disposables and amenities of great qualityOn the down side, entrance to the hotel is a bit complicated (reception located at a high floor)

I found this hotel to be comfortable, well designed and best of all-spacious. We stayed for a week and loved it. We had a corner room with two double beds, which were very comfortable. The hotel was very quiet, just the place to recover from jet lag. Everything in the mini bar was free! The wifi in the room worked great.The breakfast, though extra, was good too. The front staff was friendly and helpful and spoke English. This was our first trip to Japan and we needed a little help. The location was good, lots of little restaurants nearby, easy to get to the subway and Tokyo train station. The amenities were first rate. This hotel was not inexpensive, but I thought it was a good value and was worth the money.

Excellent location right by Ginza station (exit A5). Extremely clean and modern rooms with attentive staff, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff.Wi-fi in room was quick, no problems at all.Limited view from some rooms depending on side ofnthe building, but that's OK... i suppose the more expensive rooms have a better view.

Location - Exit A1 from Higashi-Ginza if you are coming from Haneda Airport. The location is so strategic that you have both Ginza station & Higashi-Ginza right at the hotel's entrance. There's a Family Mart, Lawson & plenty of food choices opposite the hotel such as steak, ramen, udon, tempura etc. All at very affordable prices.Rooms - Clean, Cozy & Spacious. Wish they offered some English channels though.. everything was either in Japanese or dubbed in their language. Wifi was strong. Service - The front desk & housekeeping employees were friendly and eager to help. No issue with the communication.Will be back!!

My wife and I stayed here in April 2016 for 3 nights. The location is unbeatable, right at the heart of Ginza (Tokyo's financial district) and right in front of a subway station. I have to say that the service (like many places in Tokyo) is top notch. All hotel staff we encountered spoke English quite well, so no worries there. Hotel lobby is thoroughly contemporary, looks quite new. Rooms were great, small by most Western standards but definitely comfortable for the two of us, plus two large luggage. There's a restaurant in the basement but we didn't eat there, though it looks pretty decent. But being in Ginza, you won't be short on options. There's a mini-mart just next door, but it's a small one that closes at 10 or 11pm. If you want a morning coffee/tea or cup noodle, the room has a water kettle, along with a mini-fridge. Even for a small room, I didn't have trouble pulling out the ironing board to iron my clothes. The shower and toilet are enclosed in their own little room/glass compartment but you will have to walk out in view of the bed area... not a problem for couples but just something to be aware of. Again, top notch service, can't say enough about that! Exceptionally helpful at all times. Bargain price for a decent hotel smack in the middle of Ginza. Getting here isn't too bad: from Tokyo Station (where you'll find the Narita Express to/from the airport), a taxi gets you here in about 15 mins depending on traffic.

We stayed here for one night in this fairly new hotel. Like most Japanese hotels the room is compact but has everything you need and is well designed, clean and comfortable. The toiletries are great too. The location of the hotel is right by the A1 exit of the tube station - we used the lift to save carrying our roll on luggage up the stairs and this brings you out right by the hotel. A great place to stay in Tokyo. We ate out at a restaurant nearby, of which there are loads to choose form. Would certainly stay again.

Totally love this hotel because of it's location. The rooms are a little small but very clean. The hotel is super modern and I like the design. What makes it special is the great location, walking distance to the Fish market or the shopping malls of Ginza and Ginze station. Top place!

I enjoyed the Millennium a lot. Our room, a corner room on the top floor, offered very interesting city views of the nearby skyscrapers in Ginza. Talk about efficient use of space, the room basically used every inch of available space in a smart way that made it seem much larger than it really was. As our first stop in Japan after a long flight, it was quite welcoming and really gave me what I was expecting from a Japanese hotel experience. Also, incredibly clean and the elevators felt like they were just levitating...no noise or feeling of motion. Pretty incredible.As for the lobby, it was small and quite crowded, but not a problem. The staff all spoke sufficient English for me and were very helpful overall.

This hotel has nice rooms, spacious by Japanese standards with a full shower and bath. The noise insulation is very good; we didn't hear anything when we were in our rooms. The location is excellent for Ginza, one block from the 4-chome crossing. The price doesn't include breakfast, and the restaurant is very uninspiring. But a block behind the hotel (go left as you exit the lobby entrance) there are two decent baker cafes. This is a good hotel in a good location.

Good choice to stay in the middle of Ginza. The superior room are small for western standard but well organized. Big walk-in shower.Great breakfast with delicious home-made fruit juice! Good price for a 4* hotel in Tokyo.Stayed 3 night.

The hotel is located in Ginza shopping area. You can easily find good restaurants nearby. The nearest metro station is Higashi-Ginza. The A1 entrance is right in front of the hotel with an elevator. The Asakusa line can connect to both Narita and Haneda Airport. The hotel room is stylish and the bed is comfortable. We have a pleasant stay here.

Room Booked: Deluxe Room (A Corner Room)I did not book a standard room, so I can't comment on the size of those. However, our corner room was more than ample by Tokyo standards. It is evident that this is a newly built hotel - there is no sign of wear at all. Corner rooms occupy the top floors of the hotel - our room in particular featured a lovely view of the Kabuki-za theatre. The bed was comfortable enough, and we appreciated that pyjamas were provided. The bathroom featured double sinks, and a large soaking tub which was very comfortable (thanks to the recessed sides). The amenities provided were elaborate as expected from a Japanese hotel. Since we were staying in a deluxe room, our toiletries were Laura Ashley which was a nice touch.However, I felt that the room could have been better designed. While an open-concept bathroom made the room feel more spacious, it was quite impractical, especially for a twin room. Furthermore, it would have made more sense for the bathtub (instead of the luggage rack) to be built by the window so one can enjoy the view whilst taking a bath. What a pity, given that everything else was perfect. Location wise, this hotel can't be beat. While there really isn't a most central neighbourhood in Tokyo much like in other cities, I found the Ginza place, and particularly the Mitsui Garden very strategically located. There are easily 5 department stores within walking distance, as well as flagship stores of almost every international brand. The Tsukiji fish market is a walking distance away (great for those planning an early morning visit), and restaurants to suit every budget. It is located right above Higashi-Ginza station, which is served by both the Asakusa and Hibiya lines which connects you to the Shinjuku/Shibuya/Omotesando districts. Service was more than passable, though I felt that the staff was a little overwhelmed. Perhaps I stayed during a particularly busy time, but despite multiple counters open the lobby felt pretty hectic. Overall, this hotel delivers more hits and misses, serving as an excellent base for exploring Tokyo.

I loved this hotel! My friends and I stayed here for our 10 day trip. Everything was awesome and the room was super modern. I loved the shower and yes, the Japanese style toilet was really nice. The bed was big and a little stiff but by the 3rd night I was used to it. The location is also really close to a subway stop like literally it's below the hotel. Also, it was nice to stay here because there were lots of fun places to eat and shop nearby. The service was also great and I liked that they were able to put all 3 rooms that we had next to each other. Also, the staff was always helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel!

Great location on the Ginza shopping street. We love the whole feel of the hotel - modern, slightly upscale and well-designed. Rooms were slightly above average size which adds to the value of our stay. Shiseido amenities and a toilet seat that moves every time you open the bathroom door (we were so fascinated!).The hotel also gave us a momento as it was our honeymoon.

good place, right in the hart of the vivant Ginza center. Small rooms but has everything you need, even a high tech toilet :-)Had to sleep 2 nights in a smelly smoking room but aparently this was my mistake during booking

Check-in was fast and fuss free. The hotel is right in the center of Ginza, and about a minute walk to both Ginza subway station and Higashi Ginza subway station. Takes a short 10-15 mins walk (one direction literally) to Tsukiji Fish Market. There is no transfer to the airport, you will have to roll your luggage to the nearby Courtyard mariott (probably 5 mins walk) for the airport limousine bus service.Food and shopping is everywhere.

The hotel is brand new and has everything a visitor needs - friendly staff, Shiseido toiletry, PJ, a baby crib (upon request), umbrellas on a rainy day, drip instant coffee, and even a pair of slipper for a kid! You literally just come in without anything and have a comfortable stay.Considering the prime location, room size was generous (and we had a 8 month old baby). Perhaps it was the smart layout of furniture (btw awesome Panasonic TV) that made the room more functional. You won't get much view but it's a perfect resting place after a long shopping day or early visit to Tsukiji market. 24 hour convenient store is half a block away and it's right across from major department stores. We will definitely stay next time we visit Tokyo.

Stayed here for three nights, brilliant location seemed to be near everything. Rooms are fully equipped with everything you need even an iron and ironing board. Staff have a fairly decent grasp of English and are always very helpful. Didn't have breakfast so can not comment, but reception give free water out. Would love to leave some reviews on the restaurants we went to in Tokyo but because we tried a lot of local ones we could never work out the names.But if you go left outside the hotel walk about 30 metres and on your left upstairs there is an amazing sushi place.

Centrally located in the Ginza - in fact, there are signs in the Higashi-Ginza and Ginza stations pointing towards the proper exit for the hotel.Clean, modern, quiet (for the area), very comfortable beds and high level of service. Not cheap, but a lot cheaper than other quality hotels in the area.And the toilet seat rises to welcome you as soon as you enter the room!

We stayed at the Mitsui when it was very new and were rather skeptical as we booked when it had just opened with minimal reviews. We were not disappointed!! We loved the modernity and design of the hotel as it embraced the modern Tokyo in a dated yet fashionable area. The rooms were rather small, however that is Tokyo, and the room was fit with all the amenities that we required. The rooms were comfortable and clean, which is all you really need for a city visit! The views are worth keeping your blind shut, as we looked straight at a brick wall, which probably added to illusion that the room was smaller than it was. Admittedly, we did stay in smaller rooms in Osaka and other parts of Tokyo - therefore it is actually decent sized.We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, however did take advantage of the daily paper delivery and found all the staff delightful upon entering and existing the hotel. The hotel is extremely conveniently located and is close to the current location of the Tsukiji Markets, and the trendy Ginza shopping district. Our short stay was delightful, and we would recommend this hotel to those looking to embrace a chic Tokyo-city lifestyle with modern and fresh accommodation.

First and foremost, the location. Right in a middle of the Ginza district, practically across the street from Kabuki-za theater, few steps away from a number of subway lines entrances.Clean and modern inside, small but inviting lobby.Rooms are reasonable size, clean, modern. Large, very comfortable bed. Note that room has no storage drawers, only one open basket which can be used to store some of your clothes on top shelf in open closet. Note that absolute majority of outlets are two-prong US type - there are only few three-prong outlets located mostly outside of comfortable reach for the computer cord. My room had an electric teakettle and a small fridge.Large, spacious bathroom, very clean, everything is in the perfect working condition.Hotel’s restaurant is open throughout a day. I only had breakfast there which offered good variety of both traditional Western and Japanese dishes.Definitely recommended. I would gladly stay there again any time.

We stayed at the Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel for one night in May, 2016 and had an excellent experience. The location was outstanding; near the heart of the famous Ginza district and just steps from the Higashi-Ginza station.The room was VERY nice, with a large bed, enough room to open suitcases, etc, and had everything we wanted. The view out the window was limited, but given the design and location of the hotel there wouldn't be much to see anyway. The room was very quiet with no noise whatsoever. The decor was very pleasant and modern, and overall we just loved it.Staff spoke limited but more than adequate english, and tried very hard to help us in every way. Breakfast provided both Japanese and Western food; the Western options were a bit limited but still adequate. Many more options for Japanese food, some of which I sampled and greatly enjoyed. Overall we were very, very pleased with our stay, and would make this hotel our first choice if we return to Tokyo. We felt like honored guests at a Japanese hotel, which was exactly what we were hoping for. The cost was reasonable and we felt it was a very good value.

The hotel is centrally located in Ginza close to two subway stations and across from Mistukoshi Department store. The basic room with no view was on the small side where the bathroom was not entirely partitioned apart. Rather, the washbasin was in the entryway. I encountered major trouble sending a package from the hotel by courier overseas due to gross information by the reception staff. Everyone was very polite in the usual Japanese manner but the inability to be even slightly flexible to problem solve such as searching for different courier options was shocking. Compared to other properties in Tokyo such as the Mandarin Oriental and the Ritz Carlton, the service needs vast improvement for a five star hotel.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Firstly, the location is central, super close to 2 x metro stations, and walking distance from the fish markets and Ginza shopping district. Staff were helpful and friendly and spoke reasonable English. While room was a little on the small side, the quality was high, comfortable bed and very clean. Really enjoyed our stay here especially for our first time in Tokyo

Only 12 months old, clean, bathroom facilities excellent, bed very comfortable. Very pleasant, helpful reception staff. Convenient situation right in the midst of good shopping and restaurants, and underground rail station. A nice little Italion restaurant just 2 mins walk from hotel.

Great hotel with Metro access just outside the front door. Hotel room was more than adequate, clean, tidy and by Tokyo standards a reasonable size. We found Ginza a good base from which to travel to the various sights of Tokyo. Having mastered the Metro system it was really easy to get around.

The location is very good for shopping, eating, and travelling around Tokyo even if you are out 24 hours a day.Plus :1) Business hotel. Thus, a lot of business people. As such, there is business efficiency about the place2) Check in is hassle free, very clear instructions with a pictorial booklet. They also speak very slowly in English and they pronounce every single vowel to make sure I understand them3) Room is a tad on the small size but this is Tokyo. I don't mind it4) The room is very clean, bed and pillows are very comfortable. The linen is also very good5) Wifi is very good6) Airport Bus to Narita, there is a stop right outside the hotel. The hotel can arrange for the tickets and booking. 7) Special mention. The house cocktail. Think it is called Karin. Amazingly good. You can get it at the little bar next to the liftMinus :1) Breakfast. Of the 4 breakfasts I ate there, 95% of the dishes are the same over the 4 days. I would have liked a bit more variety2) Small entrance to the hotel. It is hard to see. Others:1) Exit the hotel, walk straight across the street. A shop name Don Quixote. They sell nearly everything you can want and need. Fair prices as well. 2) Exit the hotel, turn right. Walk for 1-2 mins. There is a restaurant named Ginza Tenkuni. A tendon (tempura on top of rice) restaurant is over 100 yrs old on your right. Corner lot. It has a menu in English3) Exit the hotel, cross the road. Turn right. Walk for about 10 mins. Ootoya restaurant. Very good value for the taste and quality of the food. They serve cooked Japanese food. 4) Exit the hotel, turn left. Go up the pedestrian bridge and cross the busy main road. Turn right at the 1st, 2nd or 3rd roads. Walk to the end (around 10mins), and turn left. Tsukiji market will be on your right.5) Plenty of places to eat around the hotel, including the cheap all you can eat Japanese BBQ type restaurants

Nice new hotel in Ginza -- 5 minute walk from the old fish market, or 5 minutes the other way puts you right in the middle of Ginza's major shopping area. Rooms are small but very well appointed and staff are very helpful and friendly. Close to public transport and taxis always outside --- but you can comfortably walk anywhere in Ginza from the hotel.

The rooms were modern clean, tidy, non-smoking room. Staff were very professional, courteous, client focused and always prepared to provide assistance to clients. Free and fast Wi-Fi in rooms. Rooms comfortable with modern fit-out Restaurant on lower floor has a reasonable variety of food. Close to Ginza Railway station.

Amazing location in the heart of the Ginza District. Compared to other hotels in Tokyo the price is right. Newly built, cool vibes in the lobby. The rooms are small but incredibly efficient. I have stayed at other hotels in worse locations for double the price. All things considered this is a great option especially if you're looking for a great location, cool hotel priced below its competition. The staff is super friendly and check in check out was a breeze. Would definitely stay here again.At the end of the day, a hotel is a place to sleep. This gives you headquarters in a solid location and the rooms get the job done.

Absolutely love this hotel. It's a very modern hotel, with slick rooms. The rooms themselves aren't huge but are definitely a decent size compared to many other Tokyo hotels. Our room had a very clever shower / sink / toilet arrangement which I've seen in other hotels in Asia where space is at a premium. One issue with the arrangement though is that you don't have a lobby outside of the shower; this basically means that you're walking out of the shower straight into the room..... naked. A bit weird if you're sharing the room though I'm not sure if this is the same arrangement for rooms with two beds.The hotel staff were very helpful. We arrived around 10/11am and we were able to go straight to our room even though check-in is at 2/3pm. Staff spoke excellent english which was very helpful too.Location is also excellent. Ginza is a great place to spend some time and the hotel is really close to Tsukiji fish market and also walking distance to the Tokyo Imperial Palace. There is an underground station right outside of the hotel which is great, but even more convenient than this is the fact that this station is served by the Asakusa Line which has direct trains to Haneda Airport and Narita Airport (it's a bit confusing but basically some trains on the Asakusa line are marked to go to Narita / Haneda which means that they follow the standard Asakusa line route until a certain point and then divert to the respective airport).In fact, the Asakusa line is a very useful line for other reasons as it also goes to Senso-Ji Temple and also the Tokyo Skytree; two places that are definitely worth visiting when in Tokyo.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on their first trip to tokyo and would seriously consider coming here again if i choose to stay in Ginza when im next in Tokyo.

This is a very recently built hotel, excellently located for Ginza shopping and Metro access. The lobby is open and impressive, even if it has a slight feeling of an airport check-in area.The rooms are compact but they are a perfect example of how to pack everything you need into a small area.Modern technology is present in all the rooms, from toilets that do more than I could ever imagine, to the room-safe neatly tucked into a draw. Large TV screen can be hidden by a sliding panel (simple, great idea), Shower was powerful; everything works as it should.The hotel is very close to two metro stations: Ginza and Higashi-Ginza. Between them you can find good connections to much of Tokyo. (Higashi-Ginza also has a direct metro service to Narita and Haneda Airports. It takes about 1h20).Eating in the Ginza area can be expensive, but if you walk a minute or two along the side/back streets adjacent to the hotel, there are some good inexpensive alternatives with a local feel. (Ask at reception for recommendations).Staff are friendly, helpful, and speak good English.Altogether a great experience. I have stayed here twice and will definitely return. Its on the expensive side but worth it if you have the budget and want the convenience.

Hotel was a fantastic base to our discoveries of Ginza/Tokyo. Rooms are modern and clean, wifi is acceptable. There is no bar, only a dining area in the basement. View is okay for half of the rooms -- wish you luck! Don't get stuck inside, explore Tokyo instead: the hotel is in the center of Ginza, and it's easy to access the rest from the two nearby subway stations.

The lobby is off-putting after having stayed at two other (5 star) hotels in Tokyo, and the rooms are small. That said, it's a place for a wonderful night's sleep. The hotel is clean, the room we had was tiny, but well appointed. At the edge of the Ginza shopping district, and a breezy walk to the Imperial Gardens and Tokyo Forum (and some wonderful restaurants too), Millennium Mitsui is a good value for a short stay. We booked for our last night in Tokyo and were not disappointed; the cab ride to the airport at 10:30 p.m. was effortless and affordable. This hotel and staff are professional and take pride in their hotel.

G and S G
Los Angeles, California

review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located right above one of the Higashi Ginza station exits and is <50 metres from the main street in Ginza (Chuo-dori). Rooms are good sized for Japan, although ours faced another building. Reception was very efficient and helpful in answering any questions. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there were many options within 50m of the hotel.A great spot for exploring Ginza and accessing other parts of Tokyo

This is a perfect location for a 1st time visit in Tokyo. My family and I stayed here from 4/17-4/22 and from 4/25-4/30. For were in rooms 917 and 811, which had a great city view of Ginza. Check-in process was smooth and we did not have to wait long. The rooms are a bit small in size but has nice lay out and good for a small family like us. One downfall was the lack of drawer space, but we made due and kept most of our clothes in our luggage on the floor. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable and the hotel linens were clean. The cleaning ladies are terrific and we always had a cleaned room after a day of sight seeing. They also provided an electric teakettle to boil water and 2 complimentary of bottled water. There are slippers and hotel pajamas too. The concierge is extremely friendly and provided great service. They also watched our luggage for us while we were away in Kyoto. We requested a slightly later check out and were given till 1 pm, which helped us out greatly especially traveling with a toddler. Just downstairs from the hotel that is a train station which was very convenient. Nearby are busy streets with lot of shopping. You can also walk over to the Tsujiki Fish Market, which is about 10-15 minute walk. Overall, we would stay here again because of the location and inviting hotel room.
user_name:
twinklec28
Long Island City, New York

review_body: Millenium Mitsui Garden is situated at the heart of Ginza. Its near a lot of restaurants like Ikinari Steak, Ippudo Ramen, Teppanyaki Ten, Gyuan, and several convenient store such as Mini Stop (just beside the hotel), Lawsons, Family Mart etc.Ginza is knows for its high end brands, so if you're looking for shopping, this is the best hotel to stay because price is within budget (and you can have more money for shopping).The staffs are very friendly and helpful with whatever you need. They can also assist you in making reservations for restaurant (even outside the hotel). Just dial * on the phone.The rooms are mostly consist of two double beds so sharing of room for 3 to 4 people is possible. Hotel do not serve breakfast but not to worry, you can grab yummy breakfast treats at a Family Mart nearby.

Great choice for any type of trip to Tokyo. Awesome, clean, modern hotel in a perfect location. Right in the heart of Ginza. Close to shopping, restaurants, subways. Friendly, helpful staff that speak English. Would definitely stay here again!

This was our second stay at this hotel and we loved it. The location is excellent with many shops and restaurants. It's walking distance from Tokyo station and has a metro station right next door to the hotel lobby.The rooms are great and staff is friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo to consider staying at this hotel. We will certainly do so for our next visit.
