review_body: This hotel is a new boutique hotel located in Ginza, Tokyo. The location is wonderful opposite the Tokyo Metro station with lots of connections to all over the city. The rooms are not large but big enough for a long stay. The rooms include all the required amenities and the bedding is very very comfortable and good. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. Also, the hotel is very close to the Tsukiji Fish Market (approx. 800 meters) so for those planning to make the 3:00AM trip, it is a good location to be in. Also, nearby are all the shops of the Ginza area (all the designer names including a large Apple store) so it is a good location for shopping as well. The small streets behind Miyakoshi Department store house wonderful small restaurants with amazing Japanese food. This is the place to stay for me in Tokyo.

A very conveniently located hotel in Ginza..Near Gin shopping area..5 to 10 minutes by taxi to Tokyo central railway station..Next to subway Metro station ..Very good rooms/ bathrooms, breakfast & services at the front desk..Reasonable prices..

We returned for another stay at this wonderful hotel. Happy to note that the service is still thoughtful, attentive and prompt. On the day we left it was raining. The front desk simply gave us 2 umbrellas so that we could make our way to the limo bus pick up. That's to me is great service.

In the middle of Ginza, good, clean, not outdated hotel. Standard rooms are very small.Skip breakfast at the hotel, it is an awful quality. Pick the corner rooms, these are just big enough with a nice view on the street. From the hotel it is easy to take the underground to several "must see" locations. A perfect hotel in the middle of Ginze and walking distance to the fishmarket ( 10 minites). Friendly, helpful staff and rooms are clean.A very good pick for as starting point for sightseeing. Impression? search Chiara bakker japan in a flash.

Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. Chose to stay in the Ginza after previously staying in Shibuya and Shinjuku hotels. Both Shibuya and Shinjuku were very crowded. Ginza was less crowded and the closure of the roads over the weekeend makes things less hectic. Location in the Ginza area was very very good - near subway stations, walking distance to the fish market, the Yurakacho and Manunouchi areas etc, Service at the hotel was good. Cheerful and helpful. Wifi worked well.All in all one of the better stays in Tokyo

Stayed 5 nights in this beautiful boutique hotel! Chosen for it central location to the main shopping area and the main train station. The staff were beyond helpful-so polite and accomodating! The rooms-although modern and beautiful, were extremely tight on space! Maybe to be expected in the heart of Tokyo! Beds and pillows very firm by western standards but we found this all over Japan! Really unhappy that you needed to pay for Foxtel, standard TV other than Japanese channels-the tariffs at this hotel are large enough to have encompassed this! Room was very quiet ! We did have fridge, iron-ironing board, tea/coffee so usual amenities were available. This hotel does not have a bar to have a drink in-does have all day dinning-however, the staff spoke little English in the restaurant which made ordering difficult! Most other staff at hotel desk spoke reasonable English. No room service also. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the main Ginza area!

this hotel is right behind the Mitsukoshi and Matsuya department in Ginza, perfectly located for shopper.U are do your shopping and carry your purchases back to your room several times with ease.Where better location can one ask for.The rooms are well designed, Quite large for Tokyo standard. The bathroom well appointed.Breakfast, nothing to write about.

We stayed at Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo this July, and had a pleasant stay there. The hotel is conveniently located in the central part of Ginza and it literally takes one minute to walk to the nearest subway station. Check-in was not quite efficient since we were required to fill a form with our personal information, which is oddly common in Japanese hotels; however, the staff here are very friendly and gladly assisted us with all sorts of questions regarding the neighborhood. The room is on the small side, but nonetheless very modern and clean. The beds are very comfortable, and the bathroom is also quite nice. The breakfast, however, leaves a bit to be desired. Overall, this hotel is a great option, albeit a little bit overpriced.

Stayed 4 nights in June. Very friendly and centrally located hotel in Ginza. Smallish trendy room was bigger than normal budget hotels. Toilet was separated from the bath/shower area. Comfortable bed but air conditioner blew directly onto it. Window could be slightly opened to fresh air in. Airport Limousine Bus available from the nearby Marriott Courtyard Ginza Hotel.

Room is small especially for 2 person and a luggage. Had a fire evacuation at 3.05am on the 25/09/2015.. The fire was supposed to be on the 9th floor. We were on the 13th floor. The doors to the 2 emergency exits on the 13th floor could not be opened. Finally someone managed to open it and we make our way down the spiral staircase under the shower of Tokyo rain. No one from the hotel was there to meet us and we have to make our way to the lobby only to be told that it was a false alarm. Apparently the sprinkler in the room on the 9th floor had gone off and thus trigger the alarm. Luckily there were no panic during the evacuation but where are the hotel staff at the end of the emergency exit. Understand such incident is beyond the hotel's control but the handling of the "emergency" evacuation could be better.

we stayed here for 4 nights when we first arrived in Tokyo. the first thing that came to mind was the room was rather small (which id soon learn was rather large for tokyo. the location was quite good as you can take the JR right to the area and it has quite a few really nice food places and bars around. my only issue was it was really quite over priced for what it was when we returned back to Tokyo we stayed in a different hotel and got much better value for money.we had a high floor room but it was still rather noisy during the night with teh main road. our room was not ready for us arriving either after 16 hours travelling the first thing i wanted to do was shower. we had to wait a further 1.5 hours before we got into our room. although the hotel did not have any washing facilities in it there was a laundrette around the corner.

Located in Ginza and practically on top of the Subway station - this is a great hotel. The staff are extremely professional and extremely helpful. We needed medical advice, help with lost property and a bit of translation help. They were great on all counts. Rooms compact but clean and comfortable.

A beautiful hotel in Ginza, just 2 minute walk from Ginza station & 1 minute from Higashi Ginza station. The Airport limousine stops at the Courtyard Marriott - about 4 minutes walk from the hotel. Perfect location for both business & shopping as all major stores are minutes away & open late till 8/9. Room sizes are Japanese style - on the smaller side but very well done up with very modern decor & amenities, Has a refrigerator & kettle but no mini bar. Stayed on the 10th Floor with a huge window looking out to the main street. Amazingly comfortable beds !! Complimentary water bottles & Wifi with good speed. Very helpful staff - try & accommodate all requests.Uncountable number of Japanese restaurants & Cafes in the area, with convenience stores next door & a family mart in the back lane. Food floors in Mitsukoshi, Matsuya & Lumine malls are a must try for an amazing variety of Japanese dishes, salads & Deserts - start offering discounts around 7.30/8 pm. Bic Camera Yurakucho is a 10 minute walk. Would highly recommend for people who looking to explore Ginza & Shop in Tokyo !!

Great location, very clean and WiFi worked well for our needs. We had a superior room and had enough space for 2 people. We would have appreciated more closet space and the 5 hangers provided were not sufficient. I noticed someone already mentioned the bathroom and I can reinforce that I haven't seen anything like that before. I would definitely choose this hotel again.

We are glad we chose this hotel due to the area - Ginza is a wonder place to explore when visiting Tokyo for the first time. Restaurants and shops are great, open late and fun to explore. This hotel was a good choice, great service except the only bad thing was when asking for simple directions we were sent to the wrong place more then once. The room condition is fantastic and staff made an effort to ensure we had a good stay. Glad we chose this hotel for our days in Tokyo. The technology in the room especially the bathroom was great.

New, clean, comfortable, convenient Hotel. The staff was nice and the rooms were clean and fresh, the Wifi worked well at an excellent speed. The hotel is close to many attractions and several underground lines, which makes it a good hub for visiting Ginza and an easy walk to Tsukiji.

First time stayed in this hotel. The location is awesome. I took a train from Haneda to Ginza Station, and the hotel is exactly in front of the train station's elevator. Room is rather small but very clean and very well appointed. WiFi is complimentary but the speed is horrible.....very bad connection. If they improve the WiFi, I will not hesitant to give a 5-Star mark.

We stayed for 4 nights and the stay was excellent! Modern hotel with great facilities and very friendly staff. The bathroom and wiz-bang bidet style toilet are clean and modern with the sink located in the main room - which didn't bother us. The bed was super comfy and the pillows weren't bad either. The location is perfect!! There are loads of cafes, restaurants and convenience stores in walking distance - not to mention the shopping centres as well! There is a subway station right out the front and Tokyo and Ginza station are only a short walk. We tried the breakfast once, which was not to impressive - but we were happy to get out to any of the numerous cafes to eat.Access to and from Narita Airport is easiest via the Access Narita Bus. It stops right out the front of Ginza station, costs 1000yen, stowed luggage, is air-conditioned and easy! You just pay cash on the bus, so no lining up to purchase tickets or negotiating the trains with your luggage.

Need the limousine bus to stop here to make it even better. The bathroom setup is also not so user-friendly unless you are travelling with your partner only. The staff are very helpful and kind despite uncouth tourists using the small lobby to unpack & repack their massive suitcases.

What a lovely new hotel in Ginza area ! The hotel is situated half a minute from the Higashi-Ginza metro station, exit A. This station can only reached by the Asakusa line and Hibiya line. You can also reach the hotel by other metro line but to the Ginza station, only 3 minute walk to the hotel if you can find the right exit.The room was not big but sufficient, very thoughtful design, clean and comfortable. That's what you need in a city hotel. Breakfast was delicious and half Western and half Japanese food. If your room don't include breakfast, there are so many coffee shops around The Tully's coffee at the back of the hotel served great coffee at reasonable price.We had a wonderful Japanese BBQ dinner in a restaurant in Ginza Core basement near the hotel. Great place with very reasonable price and fantastic food. Highly recommend!

great location, great design and great staff!I absolutely recommend this hotel and would love to come back.Rooms are not big but nicely designed and filled with quality amenities.It is located in the heart of Ginza and walking distance to the fish market.Housekeeping staff did a perfect job and the front desk staff is extremely hospitable.We loved this hotel.

The location is wonderful: in the beautiful Ginza area. Close to the metro.The Hotel is new and Very clean. The Room was small but enough. All staff was very friendly and very kind.The price is good compared to the quality of the hotel. I recommend it.

Staff greeted us with lovely smiles.... Our hotel room did not have a great view, but hey we are in Tokyo... The curtain blinds were perfect...we woke up next day thinking it was still dark, upon opening the blinds, the sun was shinning and the sky was blue. Excellent black out blinds. Must mention the "loo"... fantastic..has all the" bells and whistles"..We never had a chance to eat at the restaurant but found heaps of backstreet eateries that specialised in "sushi and sashimi" nearby. The staff helpful with printing out street maps, I also requested the maps to be enlarged which they did so. Good value

This hotel has everything a traveler would hope for - the location, the facility, helpful staffs.The hotel is located in the heart of Ginza, so you can easily walk and explore Ginza,which is full of great restaurants, shopping center, bars... The room is relatively spacious, considering avg size of Japanese hotel.The room is very clean, has everything you need - closet, sizable bed, even bathtub - and the hotel provide Shiseido amenities.Also, The bed & bedding - It was fantastic, extremely comfortable.I have been to many 5 star hotels, including Conrad, St.regis, the luxury collection hotels, etc,and I have to say, it is one of the best.(The bed & bedding is definitely better than Conrad Tokyo, which I stayed the next day.)And I think I fell in love with the pajama the hotel provided. (I wish I bought one.)Even though the hotel does not have a concierge, the staff at the front desk helped me find the best sushi restaurant in Ginza & made a reservation for us.All in all, I would strongly recommend this hotel.If you wish to stay in the Ginza area, this is the hotel you are looking for.I will definitely stay here in my next trip to Tokyo.

It took us a while to choose a hotel in Tokyo. Finally we decided on the Millennium Mitsui Garden and it proves to be the right decision. The service was great and the location was perfect. Right in the middle of Ginza, next to the train station. For such a hotel in Tokyo, I would say it good value for money. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Loved the location of this hotel which is located very conveniently to Ginza and also the service by the friendly staff there. However, they did not acknowledge many of our requests for example: we requested for a high floor but was given 2nd floor (which is the lowest room floors), we requested for a non-smoking room but we were given rooms that smell like smoke- which was really a let down of the room.. We also requested for a twin bed in our room but was given a king bed!! So overall did not think that they really acknowledge our requests at all. The hotel itself is great.. Overall a pleasant stay apart from the room smelling like smoke all the time!!

The hotel does not offer room service, and there was no mini bar, which I found odd given the price. (I know it is next to some great places, but sometimes after pounding pavements for hours in the heat, a treat to them room is looked forward too) The check in and check out keep you waiting, and seems a bit chaotic, unlike other hotels that are around the same price, there is no offer of taking luggage to room, no smiles from reception, kind of sounds like first world problems, they have the room interior sorted 'the process' stuff ... but miss the heart and mind things, for the price that is paid, I kind of want to feel special, not just have a pretty room. One resturaunt in base of hotel, limited menu, small portions for price, limited hours. English speaking not great, I gave up calling reception twice asking for train details, no tour desk, no concierge. On the + side the room is fab (small but that is norm in Japan), super clean, great wifi, bed uber comfy, brilliant location.

We satisfy stayed here. We stayed here for several days and we have a good impression for this hotel. The location is great in front of mitsukoshi dept store -the landmark of ginza and just 2 minute from the gate of ginza metro station, just 5 minute to the ginza mainroad. The hotel is new operated, a modern and classy hotel. The staff serve very well and very helpful a specially Ms. Yamamoto that serve us very well, domo arigato Ms Yamamoto. We strong recomended if you want to stay at the heart of ginza.

I was really pleasant staying at this hotel, much better than the last hotel which I stayed at Tokyo. The hotel is near to train station (less than 2 minutes walks!), and also near to many stores and malls around ginza. It only took minutes to go to Tsukiji market. The room was not very spacious but had more than enough facilities and amenities. Wifi was there but the connection was not that fast. The staff was nice. The room rate was quite expensive but overall its worth the price!

Great location, lovely staffers, well thought out comfortable room. Clean. Nothing to fault. Loved our stay here. Would stay here again if back in Tokyo. Made to feel very welcomed. Lots of good eateries in the neighborhood. Convenience store near to it. Next to Higashi-Ginza metro stop. Very satisfied with our choice.

Stayed here for one night during our overnighter in Tokyo, before heading to Kyoto. Location of the hotel in the Ginza is great for both shoppers and tourists that want to move around the city. The Ginza line from what we felt a hub for connecting lines all around town witch makes it so much more easy to get where you want with least amount of subway changes. The rooms where great and breakfast had it all. Found at least our hotel next time we are to visit Tokyo again

Stayed for a couple of nights for business purposes and wanted to try out this "fairly new" hotel in the Ginza area. And it was just brilliant - the rooms were large compared to Japanese standards and as well as other Mitsui Garden Hotels that I have stayed at. Plenty of storage space for suitcases and that is always nice that you can maneuver inside the room. Did not try their breakfast. English speaking staff is also quite positive. Would definitely stay here again!

Located next to a station (Hibiya line) and short stroll to the Ginza station, this hotel makes for an ideal spot to base yourself. The hotel is still rather new which means its rooms are in good conditions. Mattress of double bed is very comfortable and I loved how the room's every square inch was properly thought out. It does feel more a business hotel than one for leisure.

This is a spanking new hotel at a great location. The rooms are of a decent size and very well appointed. I loved the fact that the palace gardens were a short walk away, making a great place to go for the morning walk. The staff is very polite and speak good English. Reaching the hotel from the airport was very easy using the train or the bus. The toilet is very modern with automated seats closing, etc. Perhaps the only thing I missed was that there was no English language programming on the TV. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Firstly, I do not understand why people complain about the room size. I have stayed in much smaller rooms in Europe. Even a 5 star Parissian hotel may be smaller! The room size in Millennium Mitsui is functional and good enough for a couple! The hotel is not a 5 stars hotel. This has to be considered while users a writing their reviews. This is why I give it 5/5 for its class. Before our trip, the hotel staff were ever ready and patient in assisting us in making our restaurant reservations. Please be mindful that the hotel has a policy of not booking certain restaurants - please check with them. Therefore, we missed out on some omakase restaurants that we really wanted to try. Reaching the hotel from Haneda is extremely convenient. The Keikyu train stops right at Higashi Ginza. You get off, take the lift up from the subway, and, bang the hotel is right in front of you. We arrived really early at 830AM. The hotel was fully booked and we could not check-in early. Understandable but there was no shower facilities that we could use to shower after two long flights.Back to the room, the shower and toilet are separate. We are a couple and had no issues with this. The toilet, like all Japanese toilets, has now spoiled us with its auto open function and one button press to lift the seat. For those being annoyed / woken up by the noise of the auto open function, just close the toilet door - no big deal.There is no mini bar but a near empty fridge (with comp mineral water bottles). This is to encourage you to go out to the MANY vending machines or convenience stores (one next to the hotel) to purchase any of the drinks you want. This is what we usually do anyway whilst on vacation as it is the cheaper alternative. We stayed on the 7th floor facing away from the unavoidable construction of a neighbouring building that was scheduled during our stay. We were not disturbed in any way by the construction. Management also provided an apology letter in all the rooms. Wifi is decent. But it drops out quite often. This could be improved. Smoking area is in a small room that is located in the basement level. The restaurant is also in the basement level. We did not try the restaurant.Location of the hotel is PERFECT. Less than 10 minutes walk to Tsukiji Market - even though we preferred another small Sushi restaurant as compared to the ones in Tsukiji. Ginza metro is a very short walk and the Ginza line takes you directly to Shibuya and Omotasendo. The Maranouchi line is also there for direct travel to Shinjuku. TIP - if it rains, take the Higashi Ginza station entrance and do the underground connection walk to to the Ginza Metro - Higashi Ginza and Ginza metro are two different stations. Tokyo underground is amazing and they even have underground shopping centres. Therefore, always remember the train station exit/entrance number so you can easily get back to the hotel. Shopping around the area is very good with most of the luxury brands to mid-scale brands. Department stores are located next to the hotel.There are plenty of upscale to budget restaurants around the hotel. Sukiyabashi Jiro and Sushi Yoshitake are under 10 minutes away. For those wishing to save money, there is a Tendon Tenya Ginza nearby which serves cheap tempura meals. Ichiran Ramen Shinbashi is around 10-15 minutes walk. Very cheap yakitori at Yakitori alley at Yurakucho Metro is around 10 minutes walk.One big tip for tourists is to purchase the 3 / 5 days metro pass at the airport (right after you retrieved your bags and exit customs). You cannot purchase this at the metro station. This is much cost effective than purchasing standard tickets at the metro. The hotel staff speaks fairly good English. If they do not know a specific word, they will be innovative in their explanation such as drawing visuals. Overall, an excellent hotel in its class.

Every structure in Tokyo has the same basic challenge of how to make the best use of limited space. The room my wife and I rented for two nights at this hotel was not significantly bigger than any other Tokyo room we have stayed in, but the furnishings, efficient use of space, and nice view helped us to relax much better than other small hotel rooms we have rented elsewhere. My wife chose this hotel because of its proximity to Tsukiji Fish Market, which we wanted to visit, and because she read that it was newly built. In fact, the room did have a "new" feel to it, with more contemporary design. My wife read some reviews that complained that the furnishings seemed "cheap," but we did not share that complaint. It was not necessarily fancy or high-end, but it felt comfortable and clean. The space was efficiently organized as well, with a flat panel TV hidden behind a painting that slid to the side, and a sink and toilet separated from the shower/bath, so that two people could use those facilities at the same time without disturbing each other. We really like the shower, which had two shower heads and good, strong water pressure. There is a nice, deep bath tub as well. It is not the typical one-piece, molded vinyl "drop-in" bathroom that you see in many Tokyo hotels, but rather, a glass tiled room with stainless fixtures and porcelain tub. Also, there is no chintzy shower curtain, but the entire shower room is enclosed in frosted glass that you enter and it is enclosed. The toilet is worth mentioning because, even in Japan, the country of high-tech toilets, this toilet is fully automated with motion sensors. When you slide open the door, the toilet automatically opens the lid. When you sit, the seat is already warmed up. The bed was large enough for myself, my wife and our one-year-old daughter, and the mattress was comfortable. One of the best features of this room was that, on our large window, which showed us a nice view of Ginza and Kabuki-Za below, we had a blackout curtain that COMPLETELY blocked out ALL the light in the morning. I awoke, thinking it was 3am because the room was pitch black, only to find that it was 830am. I peeked behind the window shade, and the light of day was blinding. I loved this feature, and think every hotel should have this, because it really helps a weary international traveler, whose body may be accustomed to a different time zone, get restful sleep no matter what time of day it is. The location of the hotel was very convenient. We arrived from Higashi-Ginza station and found a taxi. We loaded all our luggage and baby inside and told the driver to go to Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel and he looked confused. "We are parked in front of it now," he told us, surprised. We laughed and felt a little stupid, but we were so tired we didn't realize the hotel was DIRECTLY in front of the station. Also, when we went to Tsukiji Fish Market, it was a very pleasant walk of only about 5 or 6 blocks to get there. The hotel location is also great if you plan to visit Kabuki-Za, or do any shopping in Ginza. The staff were very courteous and friendly.

Very new hotel, less than a year old. Stayed here for 2 nights with each night being around $165US. Centrally located in the Ginza and about 10 min. walk to the famous fish market. Lobby staff were all very professional, efficient, spoke English, respectful. The whole joint looked like a night club all sparkly and brand new. The room was a good size. Had tea and drip coffee (pretty neat and funky) at the ready, and Shiseido products in the drawer. Nifty shoe brush. Toilets were equipped with the modern civilized amenities that Japanese toilets are known for. Make sure to keep the toilet room closed as the sensors will lift the toilet seat each time one passes by the room. There was a master light switch at the bedside -- very convenient. Shower was a totally enclosed room, brand new no mildew/mold anywhere.FYI: TV was limited to Japanese channels. The bed was firm and comfortable. We have an allergy to goose down feathers, which the heavy blanket (room has AC you can easily set but there was a heat wave outside!) was filled with. And by the next morning we informed the front desk and w/n hours they replaced the heavy down blanket with a thinner blanket with no down feathers.All in all, a great comfortable stay. Central location that can't be beat and a 30 second walk to the subway line.

Stayed here twice this year on two separate trips. The location is convenient, being located at the gateway to Ginza. The breakfast buffet was also very good, but it came at an extra cost. However, I thought that the room size was too small for the price. Villa Fontaine Shiodome, a 10-minute walk away, offered bigger rooms at a significantly lower price.

The subway exit is right out side the hotel door. Food are everywhere.The service is good but the hotel doesn't have airport pick up service.Two big department stores are right across the street. Mitsukoshi and Isetan.Near the hotel there is a tiny sushi restaurant . It's exactly in between two camera stores. I was recommended to eat there by the hotel staff and it was not disappointing. The seafood is fresh we only spend ¥7600 for 5 set of sushi with two glasses of beer.

I stayed at the Millennium Mitsui for 4 nights on May 2015, while in Tokyo on business.This is a relatively new facility and is pitched (and priced) at a level well above the traditional Japanese 'business hotel'. Location is quite good, with an easy walk to the Yamanote-sen, and just a few steps into the labyrinth that is the subway network. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and shops within an easy ten minute stroll (head up toward Shinbashi station for the best selection).The room was not huge, but was quite well appointed. A negative was that the shower opens directly into the room, meaning a constantly wet floor. I guess this helps in squeezing every inch out of the floor plate, but is not ideal for a wet socks point of view. There was absolutely no view from the window, as it opened into an internal light well. This helped with keeping the room quiet, but it's hardly a pleasant outlook.Wifi was fast and free, the TV was big screen and modern and the room had iron, tea and coffee making and a small fridge. Service was very, very good, with a small army of staff on the oversized reception desk ready to help with just about anything you could ask. There was a fair level of English spoken, but this is a hotel clearly geared up for the big Chinese groups (as evidenced by the crowds in reception each morning).There is a pricey, but better-than-average breakfast buffet downstairs.Overall, a good choice in a middle price bracket for Tokyo. I would stay there again.

Very convenient location, decent services. If you are expecting bell services and personalised attention, then maybe this is not for you as its more of a self service hotel. The rooms are well equipped and beds are very comfortable!! For the location, its a very good option & definitely worth booking if you wish to be in Ginza.

Well located. Very new and clean. Though small, it is very comfortable. The shower area is considered big for the room size. You can walk to the fish market. There is a small mini mart just next door. Go give the ramen stall just opposite the main road a try! Love the gyoza. The noodle portion is huge.

A really nice hotel to stay in. You are very well received by nice, helpful and English speaking personel. Restaurant (bit pricey but good), toilets and an inside Smoking room is available on floor B1, vending machines are on floor 2. You access your rooms floor with your card.Laundry service (high quality and fast) is available and is cheaper than is most big cities.The buildingsite is in across the hotel but you can't hear it.Rooms are nice and spacious with TV, minibar, AC, complimentary coffee and beauty/hygiene products, shower/bathtub and toilet. Not so much clothing area except hangers in the hallway. But over all clear and with friendly housekeepers.The Location is perfect! From the hotel you have pretty much 20 meters to Tokyo Metro station; Higashi-Ginza (Hibya line) and 200m (south towards Tsukiji) to Tokyo Metro station; Ginza (Hibya/Asakusa line). Here's also Ginza shopping street and Mitsukoshi shopping center. 50m north is the famous Kabukiza theather.I had a pleasent stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Really enjoyed our five night stay here.The modern hotel is close by train stations, and only one stop on the underground from a JR station.Staff are incredibly polite and very helpful. Always greeting us enthusiastically. They supplied us free of charge with umbrellas every rainy day that we ventured out.Breakfast buffet was plentiful, with both hot and cold selections, plus plenty of pastries. you could also order eggs benedict to be cooked for you.The staff at breakfast were very polite and accomodating.Rooms were well appointed with tea and coffee making facilities in the room, bar fridge and safe.The hotel is very close to the main Ginza shopping area and plenty of restaurants. Close also to the Kabuki theatre.I will definitely stay here again when in Tokyo.

Only stayed one night - arrived late, left early. Room was a bit on the small side, no view. Free wifi though. Reception helped arranged for our bags to be transported to the next hotel - we only had to take carry on bags on the train then - huge bonus. Would stay again if we were in the area as don't recall it being overly expensive.

I highly recommend this hotel. Highlights are as follows:*Location, location. You are in the middle of Ginza, close to multiple subway lines. It was super easy to get around, and also easy to get to from Narita airport (we took Limousine bus).*Well laid out rooms. The rooms are on the small side--it is Tokyo, after all. That said, we had a crib in our room and still managed to fit 2 adults, 1 baby, and a bunch of luggage, no problem.*Family-friendly. The hotel provided us with a crib free of charge and also gave us a sweet little baby kit, complete with kid slippers. Much appreciated.*Quiet. We had no noise issues, and I am sensitive to noise.*Breakfast buffet was quite good.*The price was right. This hotel won't break the bank, and I felt that the value for money was excellent.I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

New York City, New York

review_body: We spend four nights there and the only negative is that the rooms are very small, as in many other Tokyo hotels. Your bathroom is separated from the bed by white glass so its hard for one person to take a shower without waking up another. Other than that, great location, exceptionally clean, comfortable bed. The staff downstairs was extremely helpful and gave us few good sightseeing advises. They also helped make dinner reservations. If you arrive late and are hungry, there is a great ramen place steps away, one of the best in the city - just ask them.

The hotel was lovely, and clean. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom facilities were excellent right down to the toilet that lifted its own lid when you open the door. The staff were very helpful and obliging. We used the restaurant each day for breakfast and dinner and really enjoyed the food. The restaurant staff were excellent and helpful with describing the different foods to us. Location was very good being close to shops and restaurants, the fish market and the train station. The bus from Narita Airport dropped us just around the corner from the hotel. Walking was very easy from the hotel and the area was clean and tidy and safe feeling. We would definitely stay here again.

Lovley new hotel with an awsome location in Ginza. Close to the metro, shops and the fish market. Very friendly and helpful staff. Cozy clean rooms. Looking forward to staying here again next time I'm in Tokyo.

Before I start saying nice things about the hotel, I'll say one small thing which I didn't like. The Beverage VENDING MACHINE. Japan is literally full of vending machines. Let say you could find at least one within 100 yards from your current location to any direction. Hotels also set vending machines at each floor, It's common. If you don't stay at five star hotel, you might not find any mini-bar. But you still have a vending machine and it's way cheaper. Let get back to the point. The hotel sets only one vending machine on second floor. It's bit frustrating. Other than that, I had no problem at all.I visit Tokyo once or twice every year. My trip is solely for business purpose. The price for the night seemed bit pricy. But I booked because of the following reason.1. the closest hotel from any exit of Ginza or Higashi(east) Ginza station in Ginza. 2. Even the closest exit has an elevator, which means I don't need to lift up my heavy luggage through stairways. Kudos for that.3. I don't need to transfer to any other line from Haneda airport to Higashi Ginza station.I thought it's worth the price already.Like everyone else, the location is absolutely turn-on point of this hotel. Remember the elevator? It's main entrance is 10 to 20 seconds walk away. You cannot expect service man pick your luggage from the station exit but we are talking about 20 seconds. I almost forgot. There must be always dark side. When I got back to Haneda airport for my flight, I climbed up and down and walked enough to sweat all over me. No, elevators or escalator. The size of the room was kind of OKAY. If your next trip is first time to Japan, I warn you DO NOT EXPECT or IMAGINE the size of it. Compare to other hotels excluding 5 stars, size was big enough. One thing strange is a basin is not in a bathroom. You can watch your friend or family to wash their face from a bed. They also separate a shower room and a toilet. Another thumbs up is that a room is well equipped. I could find a humidifier, Febreeze kind of thing and an universal charger. A charger fits to almost every device charging through USB power. I cannot recall iPhone 4 or prior fits but iPhone 5 and later does the job. The hotel provides free wifi in my room. And you can find a LAN cable in a drawer. Power outlet is important to me. the room has full of power outlets. some on the desk, some right next to TV set and some on the right next to bed. I've never seen so many outlets for a guest. Forget about a view. All I saw is someone was working hard at his desk. The bottom line isPros: location, room equipment, room cleaning status, public smoking room on the B1 floor.Cons: bit pricy, no view, only one vending machine, a basin location.

It was a direct train from Haneda Airport to the hotel. With 2 kids and 2 elderly in the group, that was a huge relief. The proximity to metro for the daily commute made travelling around very easy. At the end of each day, going back to a clean and cosy room was soothing. Can't imagine another hotel providing all these.

It is hard to get too excited by this large hotel. The rooms and beds are comfortable, with modern furnishings. Whilst not generously large, it didn’t feel too small (which was our fear when visiting Tokyo for the first time). As a tourist, the location is great for going to the big modern apartment stores and not far from the Imperial Palace and the fish market. But we went elsewhere to eat as it didn’t feel very lively in the evenings. For this reason, as a tourist I think there might be better locations to be in, but we don’t know where to suggest.

This is a beautiful hotel with oodles of style, ambiance, good english speaking reception staff (rare in japan), good selection of breakfast (except if you have allergies), good wifi, small but modern rooms and facilities.the room was on 11th floor overlooking the highrise buildings of lovely ginza with its ricefield terraces which will surprise you. rooms are well appointed albeit on the small size, bed very comfortable and tv has good selection of international channels, wifi is good though on the first night it was a bit temperamental. Staff are very friendly and reception ladies are always smiling. These are the positives.Negatives - hotel does not cater for if you have gluten or lactose allergies so be aware - if you have these conditions it is a bit tough to get your message across as we found out.Upon checkout i asked the quickest route to narita airport from the reception staff. i was given completely wrong information and got me stuck at Nippori station trying to take the next train. If it wasn't for this kind Japanese man I would be missing my flight. So make sure you have your return journey fixed yourself - you know what might happen if you rely on others.Another strange thing is if you have friends/colleague/family staying on a different level, you can't visit their levels as your card will only work to get you to your room level, restaurant or reception. You need to call on reception staff to escort you which can be super frustrating.A suggestion - make sure you get a room on higher levels.

Functional, pleasant but a little unmemorable, to be honest. Great for the Mitsukoshi dept store across the road and the Metro, with Ginza (exit 5A) a few minutes and Higashiginza a few steps away. Good front desk service, of course. Very comfortable beds! If Ginza shopping isn't your entire reason for being in Tokyo, Tsukiji market is literally a straight 10 minute walk away (turn right... and that's it.) For more interesting, local dining options, make sure you stray a couple of streets off the main shopping roads, and you can't go wrong. (For good quality budget dining, besides dept store basement food halls, however, you'd be better off in other areas.)

The Location is good, in the heart of Ginza....Shopping malls (Mitsukoshi department store is right across the street), restaurants and coffee shops are just few minutes walk, There are also 24 hrs. sushi place and some eating place that closes rather late, so if you happen to arrive late at night and feels hungry or still with jet lag, there's still place to go. There are few Metro subway stations that are near (Higashi-Ginza Station is in front of the hotel). Check-in/Check-out are not bad. The room is modern and clean, the size is fair for a Japanese Hotel room, and is equipped with basic things you would need, the bed is fairly soft (not the usual Japanese hard kind of bed). Hotel staff speaks good english, and are friendly too. Wifi is average, good enough for checking emails and browsing. Some may think why only Average, it's because the hotel it self is on average, considering of the price which is not cheap and can actually be very expensive during some peak days/season. The hotel still has a big room for improvement.

The Hotel is relatively new and the location is very good. In front of the hotel is a entrance of Tokyo Metro Subway (Higashi-Ginza Station) and just 2 blocks away is the Tokyo Metro Subway Ginza Station. The hotel is at walking distance to the Tsukiji Market and the famous Seiko Tower which is the center of Ginza, Japan. Restaurants, 24-hour Stores, Shopping surround's the hotel.The rooms are a bit small compared to international standards but is big enough as to Japan's standard. Rooms have Nespresso machines, ref and the sink, shower and toilet is separate with each other which I like. Staff speaks English well.

We had a stopover for 24 hrs in Tokyo and have stayed close to this place before so decided to give it a go it is located about 3 blocks from the Tokyo Fish Market and right on the edge of the Ginza . This is a very modern Hotel room size a little bit small for the price but the beds where very comfortable and all the mod cons very nice staff with ok English

We stayed there for 3 nights. Check in is at 2pm and check out at 12pm. We stayed at 13th floor deluxe room with a view of Ginza shopping areas. Location is good as Higashiginza station ( Asakusa metro line ) is just around the corner of the hotel. Ginza station is around 5-10 mins walk. It's walkable to Tokyo station and a number of sights of Tokyo. Hotel is very near Mitsukoshiko department store and the giant Uniqlo. It is also near the Famous Japanese Kabukiza Theater. And 15-20 mins walk to tsukuji fish market. There is a Lawson nearby. Lots of ramen shops around. And if you walk further towards Uniqlo , there are more cafes and restaurants around. Location is no doubt very convenient. Room we stayed were spacious and very clean. Room wifi is okay. There is an espresso machine in the room. Hotel is a non smoking Hotel.

Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

review_body: Brand new hotel, extremely well located. The corner room is amazing. The staff couldn't be more helpful - even for Japanese standards, which are the higher I have ever known. Very nice breakfast. Can't find a single bad thing to say about it. Look very much forward to our next stay.

First time stay at the hotel, great location. No more than 3 mins walk to the Mitsokoshi department store, near fantastic eateries, 7 mins walk to the limo bus pick up. The room is thoughtfully designed maximizing space; chic and modern. Definitely will be our hotel choice if we are staying around Ginza again

We stayed in Tokyo for 5 nights and each of those nights were close to perfect. The hotel is centrally located in the Ginza district and the subway is literally just outside the hotel. The hotel is well staffed with personnel eager to help. Most of them speak English and provide excellent suggestions for restaurants. Our room was well appointed, with a large shower room which was separate from the toilet room. The washing sink was outside, in the room. The room is small but well laid out. The TV is large and bolted to the wall. The furnishings are modern and clean. The beds are comfortable and spotless. The cleaners do not come in unless you leave a sign saying you wish for your room to be cleaned.An overall terrific stay. We would do it again.

Loved our stay at this hotel. We had two stays (5 nights and one night) during a two week trip and got two different rooms. I provide some detail about the difference so you can choose what is right for you.First, It is in a great location to get around with a subway stop right outside the door and a JR station less than a 10 minute walk away. We got a good deal on the room (<200 USD) and while the room was snug, which is common in Tokyo, it was quite comfortable and serviceable. Both rooms were doubles and the double room fit us just fine with the bed being comfortable, although a little hard at first, and the shower and WC being excellent. The hotel is brand new and very well designed from both a functional and aesthetic perspective.The differences between the rooms were that the first had a shower and tub and the second had just a shower stall with the extra space used for a small sitting area. If we did it again, we would go for the one with the sitting area since we did not use the tub and the small sitting area was nice in the tight space. The shower stall was comfortable for me and I am 6 feet and 185 lbs. Did not bang my elbows or knees once.The people working in the hotel were very helpful with recommendations about anything although, depending on the individual you got, language was sometimes a problem. Everybody spoke some English but it did vary widely. This is common in Japan, even Tokyo, and my Japanese is very limited so it was sometimes a challenge. One thing I would suggest is if you ask for restaurant recommendations to be very specific about what you are looking for.Our last night in the hotel during the first stay, we wanted to go for yakitori and try to repeat the experience of another place they sent us to which was very local, good and small. Unfortunately, i forgot to specify the last part and was sent to a large place that had several different types of restaurants and we ended up sitting at a huge Yakitori bar by ourselves. It was much more geared to tourists, which is not what we wanted. Food was good and inexpensive but not quite the experience we were looking for. Our mistake which we fixed for the future.] And all was good.I cannot speak to the hotel restaurant because we went out for every meal. There are tons of choices in the area so the hotel restaurant was never even a consideration.Overall, a great start and a hotel I would gladly go back to.

fantastic hotel. location is perfect as it between Ginza Line and Asakusa Line with both entrance just 100m and 50m away. the lift to Asakusa line was infront of the hotel!. location are just next to ginza premium shopping complex mean the happening area just round the corner. foods and drink are everywhere.check in was smooth. room is japan standard but was packed with surprises specially with the bathtub! yes bathtub and shower are separated which create a roomy shower area. toilet, shower area and sink are separated. it come with shiseido items. bed are super comfy.going to stay here again for sure.

This hotel is a gem of a find and a pleasant surprise for us. The most important thing was its accessibility - the subway exit was an elevator /lift right outside the door of the hotel! It works well as a base for visiting other locations via the subway!If you are coming from Haneda Airport, the ride is a direct 30 mins train ride right to the door step of the hotel! The area is in a nice and serene part of Ginza, about 10 to 15 mins walk to the Tsujiki fish market (for your sushi fix)! Major departmental stores are just across the road.We had a corner twin room (as the normal twin room was fully booked) for more than ¥30,000 because the other rooms were full. It was just right for two persons (more than 30 sqm). The hotel is new as it just opened last year. The room comes with an expresso machine and plenty of toiletries. The layout of the room was rather unusual though as the sink area is separate and you walk right in between the sink, the shower and the toilet as you enter. Nevertheless, it was advantageous as two persons can get ready at the same time. Staff are courteous and had good service. Will stay here again on my next trip to Tokyo!

The price for this reservation was pretty decent for Tokyo, and the hotel was in a perfect location to visit the Tsukiji market at 3.15am (which guaranteed that we were in the first group). Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the market, just off the main road. The reason for the reduced rating is due to the rude lady at the check in counter, who I believe honestly was only rude due to her frustration at the following: not being fully conversant in English, and the fact that none of my credit cards appeared to be working....until good ol AMEX saved the day! I tried to lighten the situation, only to be met with a brash response. Anyway, the other reason is due to the high cost of the breakfast, which I decided to try one morning, only to be disappointed at the options. Nevertheless the hotel was clean, the room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, free-wifi was provided, and the hotel provided extra supplies when requested. We marvelled at the toilet and due to reading some of the other reviews, ensured that we closed the door to avoid being kept awake by it. I had asked for a quiet room, after I read that there was construction going on nearby, and I did not hear any noise during my stay. All the other staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating. They helped my friends make a reservation at a number of restaurants, helped book the service to transfer my luggage to the next hotel I would be staying at, once I returned to Tokyo, and even took the time to snap a few pictures for us. I would definitely stay here again. Upon exiting the hotel, Higashiginza station (Asakusa metro line) is less than a minutes walk away, while the Ginza station (Ginza metro line) is about a 5 minute walk away. Which makes it convenient for reaching the other parts of Tokyo. Ginza is a very nice area, with loads of shops for all budgets, and loads of restaurants.

I stayed in an AirBnb originally with my girlfriend and unfortunatley didn't have my brightest AirBnb experience. We did have an awesome one in Kyoto but Tokyo's fell short so we got out and stayed at the Mitsui Garden and loved our experience. The decor was awesome, location was great, and overall experience was fantastic. I will definitely stay there again if I need a hotel in Tokyo and will gladly stay at any of Mitsui's properties when I have one near by. Highly recommended!

This place was stellar. Not only was the price under $200 a night, but the hotel was modern, clean, and had excellent amenities. Our favorite amenity was the Japanese toilet that automatically opened when you slid the bathroom door open. It also had an assortment of functions and an automatic nightlight which came in handy. The shower room had a bathtub, shower, and a little thing to sit on while showering. The mirror over the sink also lit up around the border, which was cool. Even the shampoo and conditioner was awesome and left my hair feeling smooth.The hotel staff was also excellent. They recommended a top notch Kobe beef restaurant and made the reservation for us. They also recommended a convenient and cheap bus service that got us back to Narita Airport. I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Ginza, Tokyo. It's right next to the metro and walking distance to the Tsukiji Fish Market.

review_body: A cozy and modern new hotel which just opened in Dec., 2014. Located in the Ginza, Tokyo, convenient for shopping, dining, sight-seeing and business. And if you are interested in Japanese traditional performance, kabuki, the hotel is just several steps away from the Kabuki Za where the show is usually on. No worry of not speaking Japanese, the hotel staffs speak fluent English and Chinese (and maybe also other languages).

This is a new hotel with good sized rooms for a hotel in Japan. We stayed in one of the upgraded rooms which was laid out well, but had zero drawers for clothes. The staff were extremely helpful and the location was great. My major gripe was the extremely slow wifi. Seriously slow. Maddening slow. I also would have liked more open space. The lobby was tiny with limited seating - not conducive to sitting and relaxing. The restaurant is located in the basement with no direct sunlight. Overall, I was happy with the hotel, but will probably look for another alternative on my next visit because of the wifi issue.

Millenium Mitsui Garden Hotel is designed for maximum comfort and convenience. Located at the top end of Ginza and in easy walking distance to parks and gardens, Tokyo Station and other subway connections. The hotel is central to a weath of quality restaurants and cafes as well as high end sopping and department stores. Taxis cheap and readily available outside the hotel are the perfect way to move across the city. Supremely comfortable bed with quality bedding. Our room was small as expected in Japan but at no stage felt claustrophic. Everything you need at your fingertips and the hotel staff prepared to go out of their way to ensure your stay is fully enjoyable. Highly recommend for the quality of the hotel, staff and location

I have traveled Tokyo twice in recent 2 years. I stayed in Ginza Mitsui Garden last year and owing to the previous great experience, I chose Millennium this time, which belongs to the same Mitsui Garden hotel family. This hotel didn't let me down. Fisrt of all, great location and just "one"minute walk from 2 different Metro station that lead your way to numerous Tokyo famous destination. The room is new and elegant with nice equipment quality. Service is also kind and sweet, I love their attitude and am grateful for the every day room cleaning. Fair space under reasonable price. The only cons that I can come up with now is the slow wi-fi speed. In conclusion, I will definitely choose this hotel again and I am willing to recommend it to my friends

I stayed for three nights during a recent business trip. The hotel is relatively new, with smallish rooms. Location is great, especially if you're visiting Ginza. A few steps to the metro if you're interested in going elsewhere in Tokyo (Hibiya line and others). If you can't sleep due to jet lag, take the 15 minute walk to the Tsukiji fish market. Warning - do not follow the guidelines on the market web site... They're wrong. Best to enquire at the fish information center the day before, or perhaps the hotel concierge. I showed up at 5am, and was told it was too late and should have shown up at 3am. One peculiar thing in the room was the automatic toilet.. Not just your standard Japanese washlet... This one detects where you're in the vicinity and lifts the lid. The first time it was cool, but having it happen every time I walked past the bathroom became a bit disconcerting..... Enjoy your trip - and don't forget to randomly walk into a restaurant filled with locals and take your chances .... Even without an English menu

This is a big city hotel. It is very modern, only open for six months. My room was rather small but has everything that you need when staying in Tokyo. There is a metro station literally outside the front door. The bed was very comfortable, the air conditioning strong and the curtain well able to keep the neon signs from disturbing sleep. I booked at short notice and had a room on the smoking floor, less than perfect, but I knew it was a smoking room when I booked the room. Breakfast is well up to standard and served in the basement restaurant. This is a good hotel for when you need to be in the big city.

Our home for five days in Tokyo. New hotel,good location for shopping and eating, located in Ginza, very accessible from Haneda Airport and JR line by Metro. Metro stations are just a few steps away from thehotel and friendly staff.

We stayed one night at this hotel. Taxi driver first took us to the Mitsui Premium Garden Hotel Which is just a short 2 mins drive away. I believe the Premium one is a step up version of the Millennium hotel. The hotel itself is fairly new. The room is small but adequately equipped. The style is chic and modern. We stayed one night comfortably there. Highly recommend for staying in the Ginza neighborhood if you plan to spend most of your day outside! (The blackout shade is perfect! The room was so dark at night I slept so well!)

Rooms are a little small though for Ginza, this is not surprising. Friendly staff, modern design in rooms; clean and very pleasant even for the size.Better prices if you come off season with the added benefit you will also have better weather. Avoid tourist season and in the summer -- hot, rainy and humid.

review_body: Great stay in this new hotel. The rooms are well appointed and the restaurant offered a good breakfast (asian-american mix). We were always greeted nicely by front desk.Minor Down sides - no pool or health club and they should have a storage room for tour suitcases so they do not crowd up the lobby.

Fresh hotel - It's very new so everything is clean and quite modern. Our room was compact as is typical of hotels in Japan, but rather comfortable. Everything in the room seemed well-planned and purposeful. The toilet was in a separate "room", the shower occupied a separate space, and the sink was located in the entry hallway--which made it quicker for us to get ready in the mornings. I would have liked more closet space though, but whatever little closet space they had was maximized.The breakfast buffet was a good selection. Not too much options, but enough to enjoy different types of food in the 3 days we were there.Great location - Right at the heart of Ginza. Access to the nearest Ginza line metro station (via stairs, not elevator) is just 20-30 steps outside the main entrance of the hotel (Although there was elevator access right outside the hotel to another metro line which we never got to use). Convenient store located right beside the hotel, not to mention the famous Ginza shopping.

New hotel, directly across from the awesome department store - there were great options from the food courts and restaurants :) The room was small, but perfectly organized. We would love to stay again. Upon request, the receptionists kindly booked us awesome sushi reservations.

I like Mitsui hotels in general - well priced, sophisticated and good service overall. Millennium Mitsui is well positioned in Ginza, across from Matsuya. I liked the size of the room (decent for Tokyo) and the hotel's decor. I deducted 1 star for 3 reasons: 1) my room was directly facing a building in construction with absolutely zero view. 2) my room was right by the elevators with a lot of noise, particularly in the mornings. 3) The lobby was constantly filled with tourists laying out their suitcases and repacking in the middle of the lobby, blocking the way to the only elevators available.

My sister actually found and booked this hotel for a trip a couple of weeks ago to Japan. In Japan, the people are pretty much always polite and the hotel staff were extremely courteous. We loved that it was modern yet warm. The room was larger than we expected--a nice surprise! The toilets in Japan are always amazing (had to mention this) and this one had all the bells and whistles. The bathroom mirror was large and ringed with light--perfect for makeup. Shower was strong and conveniently plumbed. This hotel was in a very convenient location--one of the reasons we had selected it. I highly recommend it to anyone wishing to find a nice hotel at what I consider to be a reasonable price. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but you need not do that--there are so many restaurants within steps of the hotel. Again, I can't stress how polite the staff was.

Lovely hotel. Excellent location amazing use of space in the rooms! We struggled a bit with luggage from the cruise we arrived on but we had a happy 5 days. What makes it special?THE AMAZING STAFF! HOSPITALITY SECOND TO NONE!nothing is too much trouble! Love Japan!xx

Hotel is well located, next to subway. Rooms are good, not large but comfortable. We dined at the hotel cafe one evening when we came back to hotel late. Food was cold and roast chicken was like rubber and consisted of a wing and a leg. There were also no side dishes on the menu so our children were hungry and we left to buy noodles at the mini mart! Very disappointing for an all-day dining cafe.

Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: Good location, polite and helpful staffs, Efficiency, clean & simple room, powerful shower,Reasonable room rate, are the kind of hotel that I like most.This is a true four stars hotel, 570 yen under ground train from Haneda airport to Ginza, take Tokyo Metro Hibiya line to Higashi Ginza station- take exit 1A lift, hotel entrance just seconds away on your left.Normal room size is around 220 sf, twin beds room around 286 sf.I stayed in a twin bed room and very happy with it.Seem that construction work next door had finish because I didn't hear any noise at all during my five days stay.Only thing is Wifi in room needed to be more powerful.I highly recommend this property, nearly a prefect score from my point of view.

Hotel room was clean and comfortable. Good location in Ginza right next to a subway exit and walking distance to the fish market. If using taxis to get to the hotel make sure you show the driver the location on a map or give him the hotel phone number to add to the sat nav and stress its the Millenium hotel as many don't know it and take you to the Mitsui Garden hotel Ginza Premier instead.

This hotel only opened in January 2015,, so everything is new, !!!!! even the toilets, it took me a while to workout how to use it. The rooms are relatively small but there is enough room for two persons to have room in the room. The hotel provides almost all the things you would hope for in a 4 star hotel, but done in a unique Japanese way. We stayed here for 6 days and wnjoyed our stay. The staff are very friendly and all speak English. The hotel is locate over a subway station so it is easy to acces the train system.Only disappoint we had is that they do not have room service, and arriving at 11:30pm I would have loved to get something to eat.The breakfasts are great plenty of choice.This hotel located on the Ginza, is an outstanding location for places like the Tokyo railway station, Imperial Palace and a number of the sights of Tokyo.Don discount this hotel its worth a visit.

The hotel is tastefully decorated and well appointed, making the most of small rooms, so that they still feel somewhat spacious. Rooms are well appointed with a couch bench and other comforts. The hotel has an excellent location in the heart of Ginza. Staff were also very friendly and helpful (I arrived on a very early flight, and keeping bags until checkin was no hassle) I enjoyed my short stay.

We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is amazing. New, very clean, very tastefully decorated. Rooms are not that small as you might expect, very efficient and well structured. Very good matress and overall very good sleep quality.It's very close to a metro station, just outside the entrance.Employees are extremly polite and helpfull.We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and recommend it!

To start off, this relatively new hotel has a great location as there is a subway station just outside the hotel. Opposite of the hotel are two Mitsukoshi (s). Just two blocks away is Ginza Street, home to branded goods for shopping. There is also a mini-stop nearby for rushed needs.Hotel is clean and the staffs can speak good English. The lobby wall can change lights, an amusement to watch. The flower display in the lobby is also changed daily as they use fresh flowers and carefully arranged by a professional gardener. Rooms are clean and spacious (in Japanese standards). Quality brand Shiseido is being used for the toilet amenities. Complete toilet amenities such as cotton buds, milk wash, emulsifying oil, skin lotion, and make up remover are available. Breakfast is located at the basement and offers very good food. Although small in variety, they offer Japanese breakfast on one side, and Western style on another. A fresh carving of Jamon Iberico is also available. There is a wide range of salad, yogurt, fruits, breads and pastries. Another corner has various teas, juices, and even healthy smoothies.A very good value to stay at this hotel.

Booked in here by a travel company and could not have been more pleased. Arrived in the morning, well before the strict Japanese check in time, but staff helpful and let us leave luggage etc.Great location - 10 minutes walk to fish market, 5 minutes to Ginza and about 30 seconds to a subway station. Made it a fantastic base to explore the city from.Being brand new the rooms were all modern, well equipped and clean. Rooms were small, but this is the same all over Japan. We had two medium sized suitcases and there wasn't really enough room to put them both out and no space to unpack to. But that said we didn't spend much time in our room so didn't matter too much.Free wi-fi and (importantly for Japan) complimentary umbrellas.We had breakfast included in our room rate. It was a buffet style with mix of western and Japanese food. All seemed nice and certainly enough to get us ready for a day of sightseeing.

The Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo is at the centre of Ginza and within 1 min walk from the metro station. The staff are very nice, friendly and professional, and speak very good English. A good base if you are exploring the Tokyo city. The facilities are new and all in good condition.

Perfect location in ginza, just opposite to mitsukushi department store. The hotel is new so everything is clean and in a great condition. The rooms are very small so don't expect to much space. Toilet and bathroom are separate and there is a sink and mirror also separate.but after you get over the room size issue it's really a great hotel. Ginza is a very nice neighborhood with lots of upscale stores and restaurants. Mitsukushi department store has some great restaurants on the 11th floor, which are open till 10 pm. it's a good choice if you want to eat good without having to go far after a long day.

We recently had our family vacation in Tokyo in time to catch the tail end of the famous cherry blossom season. We booked in Millennium Mitsui Garden because it's new and there are lots of positive reviews. Location is 10 minutes walk from Ginza station. Higashi ginza station is also a few steps away. Checking in was a breeze. Room was not that big though it can accommodate up to 3 people conveniently. Basic amenities are provided. Free WiFi in the room. Very quiet even though we were looking down at Harumi dori Avenue. A large tv is provided in the room but all the shows are Japanese so they are not that appealing to tourists. Staff are very courteous and helpful especially when we had trouble opening the safe in our room. Requests for extra towels and bottled water were quickly provided. We will definitely consider staying in this hotel again when we plan our next Tokyo trip.

The location is super good..right in the middle of ginza which is a shopping haven...the building is so new when i went there and the room is quite small with no view although there is a small window but facing a wall.but overall is good...there is no gym there available.it's so easy to food around the hotel and mostly is good..there are a lot of buildings with each floor is one restaurants so look around for 5-8 stories buildings with food billboards.

For my first trip to Tokyo I don't think I could have chosen a better option: A brand new hotel at the heart of Ginza. The room was very clean, the view from the 9th floor was great, although not spectacular. All the Ginza boutiques are just a few blocks walking. The metro station Higashi-Ginza is in front of the hotel, so you can travel to anyplace in Tokyo very easily. The breakfast menu is excellent. This is not a budget hotel -- Tokyo is not a budget city -- but you get very good value for your money.

This wasn't our first choice of hotel but for the period of our stay - Easter weekend - this offered the best value while still being in Ginza, where we wanted to be. Like other establishments associated with the Millennium group, this hotel is nicely designed and trendy and more than adequate as a business hotel offering the basic amenities.Service was friendly and prompt although slightly hectic since there doesn't seem to be a line up at the front desk and you simply had to grab the nearest available attendant. This was efficient (we never had to wait) for checking in, but since there wasn't a designated concierge, the whole experience was a bit random and hardly personal.The room was clean, small, but still very comfortable, and even feature a sitting area where you can read or have your morning tea, or a night cap before turning in. But while the room's layout was great, there wasn't much of anything else at this hotel. There is a single cafe/restaurant/lounge (which we didn't try). There is no bar, no pool or gym (as far as we can tell), not even room service, which meant that anything extra, like wine glasses for your room, are a challenge - we asked for some and got champagne flute-like ones instead. On the upside, the room comes with free beverages (tea and coffee), and the hotel throws in a couple of bottles of distilled waters in otherwise empty mini bar.One of the best things about this hotel is the location. It is literally across the street from the Mitsukoshi department store, 2 minutes away from Uniqlo's flagship store, and another 2 minutes from the Sony Building and the main Ginza station with access to multiple Tokyo metro lines. That said, the address of the hotel is a bit of a challenge because there actually TWO Mitsui Garden hotels in Ginza. And as anyone who has tried to pronounce Millennium to a Tokyo taxi driver knows, it is almost impossible to convey to the driver which one you want to go to. An important advice is to always carry a hotel card with you if you plan to take taxis, because the OTHER Mitsui Garden has been around longer and chances are you'll end up there (which is quite a way down the street).Perhaps the best thing about the Millennium Mitsui Garden is that it comes with free Wifi. For some gracious reason, this hotel made the leap forward to the 21st century and decided to give you the internet for free (unlike so many others that still try to charge you extra for Wifi). While the network is a bit patchy at times, it is still glorious, free and available everywhere in the hotel.All around, good value, good stay

I have just one word to describe this hotel " perfection!!!"I didnt feel i was staying in a hotel, i felt i was at my parents home where they took care of me like a baby.I don't ever remember feeling this comfortable at a hotel before. The staff is very friendly, speak good English (or at least Ok for some of them), and very helpful. They are very efficient, if they dont know the answer to your question, they go search for it and get back to you.I had to check out of the hotel in the middle of my stay and go to Hakone (onsen) for a couple of days. The hotel staff accepted to keep my luggage. I had some chocolate and sweet boxes that needed to be kept in the fridge. Guess what...not only they kept them in the reception's fridge until I came back, but they also took them to my room and placed them in my room's fridge!!! When I walked into my room and opened the fridge I was very nicely surprised !The hotel location is wonderful. Multiple subway stations few steps away from the hotel ( higashi ginza station, ginza station, shinbashi station....you pick)Being a strong coffee addict, i needed my starbucks coffee every morning...guess what..there are two of them just 5mn walk from the hotel.The hotel is also at a walking distance from Ginza shopping street..Hotel cleanliness...jst perfect!! You can tell that the hotel is still new (opened in Dec 2014) and in excellent shape. The house keeping ladies are great and very friendly.I would like to thank the hotel staff for making my stay so enjoyable...i hope they keep the same standards.this is going to be my "home" whenever I visit Tokyo!Cant wait! :)

We had booked this hotel even before it opened, but the artist pictures seemed good. All i can say is that the actual room is true to the drawings. Very pretty, well designed and made well. We loved the high tech rooms and the fabulous decor. Even the outside of the building seems like a work of art. The spacious lobby is grand and screams luxury. I specially loved the changing colors behind the front desk which spans the entire wall. Amazing. Security seems to be a priority in the hotel. You need a key card just to be able to press any floor. The main door is also needs a key card from 1am until 6am. I love that. Rooms are small-ish. But hey this is japan. however small, everything a regular size hotel is still available here. We had a kick using the toilets with its heated seats and auto flush after closing the lid. Only complaints is that the bed is already sagging at the edges where you frequently sit on. Considering that this property has only been open 3-4 months, i'm wondering how that bed will look in a year. Wifi connection was spotty at times. But we rented a portable router and used that in the room instead. So the connection wasn't much of an issue to us. And may i request that they have more english channels? The only one they have on is a news channel.Hotel staff is always pleasant and knowledgeable about the area. Check in and check out was a breeze. Location is the best. So near mitsukoshi and ippudo (best ramen!!). Exit via the higashi ginza station gate a1, so convenient. The hotel offers to donate to an environmental cause if you do not take the in-room toiletries provided. Nice touch!Millennium Mitsui is a top notch, "it doesn't get any better than this" hotel. If you plan to stay in ginza, this should be your number 1 option. Pricey, but definitely worth it.

Millennium Mitsui Garden Hotel Tokyo is a beautiful brand-new hotel right in Ginza. Its location is very close to all of Ginza's glitzy shopping - including departments stores like Mitsukoshi. The rooms are VERY small, so either stay alone or be VERY comfortable with who you are staying with. The toilet is in a separate small room that is not connected to the shower, and the shower is its own separate small room as well. The sink is outside in the room's hallway - so there really is no privacy going back and forth between the sink, toilet, and shower since they are all disconnected.

This is a brand new hotel, located 1 1\2 blocks from the famed Mitsukoshi - Wako intersection of Tokyo's Ginza, about 1 1\2 blocks from the Kabukiza Theater and while I did not go there about 4 blocks from Tsukuji Fish Market, just walk down Harumi Dori the broad avenue in front of the hotel. There is a subway entrance less than 50 meters from the front door of the hotel, probably the Ginza line, I did not use the subway to get here so I do not know for sure.The rooms are on the small side, we had a double bed and my side of the bed, next to the window was perhaps 9 inches from the window, but for only $200 in a new hotel in the absolute center of where you want to be on the Ginza who is to complain. There was a chair on the other side of the bed and there is a small desk, large enough for a laptop or writing across from the foot of the bed.The breakfast buffet was adequate but nothing to write home about, but in Japan breakfast is hard to find other than at your hotel, so eat there and do not fuss.On the whole I recommend it highly for location location location and value.

This is a new hotel with excellent facilities but do not cost you an arm or a leg. Newly opened so you would enjoy facilities that are new. Room is more spacious than average Japan hotels. The location without saying is excellent. The lift to subway station for train to Narita Airport is just right in front of the hotel.

Stayed for 6 nights and this hotel was very comfortable with no frills or pretentiousness just attention to the small things that makes life easy. Clean room comfortable bed high thread count sheets clean pajamas every day powerful rain shower head. Shishedo skincare packets for face but didn't have body lotion?? Bring your own. Deluxe double room very much small but comfortable and the view was amazing from 11 floor. If this is your first visit to Tokyo take the limousine bus from narita to this property cost is 6200 for two tickets and the counter is right there in the airport easy to find. The bus will drop you off at courtyard Marriott which is less than 5 minutes walk to the hotel one block. don't worry you won't be the only one pushing your suitcase to the hotel. Very friendly staff they will keep your stuff if your flight is after checkout time. The price per night I paid was 171$ but it was worth it. Very good location could not be any better subways and train right in front of hotel.

Excellent hotel, great location, close to train station and great restaurants nearby to the hotel. my husband and i stayed there for 7 nights and loved every night when we returned from our outings. The room is furnished well, bed very comfortable and most of all very clean and the towels were very good. we will be coming back to stay again in the Autumn. Although there was not much view from our room as it faces a contsruction building, we could hardly hear any noise. the comfort of the room made up for it.
